member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BalanceAvailable
member.summary: Occurs whenever your Stripe balance has been updated (e.g. when a charge collected is available to be paid out). By default, Stripe will automatically transfer any funds in your balance to your bank account on a daily basis.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.CashBalanceFundsAvailable
member.summary: Occurs whenever there is a positive remaining cash balance after Stripe automatically reconciles new funds into the cash balance. If you enabled manual reconciliation, this webhook will fire whenever there are new funds into the cash balance.

member.summary: May be sent by Stripe at any time to see if a provided webhook URL is working.

member.name: F:Stripe.TransferMethod.Standard
member.summary: Standard is the default method.

member.name: F:Stripe.TransferMethod.Instant
member.summary: Only supported for transfers to debit cards.

member.name: T:Stripe.AccountLink
member.summary:
Account Links are the means by which a Connect platform grants a connected account permission to access Stripe-hosted applications, such as Connect Onboarding.
Related guide: Connect Onboarding.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLink.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLink.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLink.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The timestamp at which this account link will expire.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLink.Url
member.summary: The URL for the account link.

member.name: T:Stripe.Account
member.summary:
This is an object representing a Stripe account. You can retrieve it to see properties on the account like its current e-mail address or if the account is enabled yet to make live charges.
Some properties, marked below, are available only to platforms that want to create and manage Express or Custom accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.BusinessProfile
member.summary: Business information about the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.ChargesEnabled
member.summary: Whether the account can create live charges.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Country
member.summary: The account's country.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Created
member.summary: Time at which the account was connected. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that Stripe supports in the account's country.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.DetailsSubmitted
member.summary: Whether account details have been submitted. Standard accounts cannot receive payouts before this is true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Email
member.summary: An email address associated with the account. You can treat this as metadata: it is not used for authentication or messaging account holders.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.ExternalAccounts
member.summary: External accounts (bank accounts and debit cards) currently attached to this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Individual
member.summary:
This is an object representing a person associated with a Stripe account.
A platform cannot access a Standard or Express account's persons after the account starts onboarding, such as after generating an account link for the account. See the Standard onboarding or Express onboarding documentation for information about platform pre-filling and account onboarding steps.
Related guide: Handling Identity Verification with the API.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.PayoutsEnabled
member.summary: Whether Stripe can send payouts to this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Settings
member.summary: Options for customizing how the account functions within Stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Type
member.summary: The Stripe account type. Can be standard, express, or custom. One of: custom, express, or standard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.Mcc
member.summary: The merchant category code for the account. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.Name
member.summary: The customer-facing business name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.ProductDescription
member.summary: Internal-only description of the product sold or service provided by the business. It's used by Stripe for risk and underwriting purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.SupportAddress
member.summary: A publicly available mailing address for sending support issues to.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.SupportEmail
member.summary: A publicly available email address for sending support issues to.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.SupportPhone
member.summary: A publicly available phone number to call with support issues.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.SupportUrl
member.summary: A publicly available website for handling support issues.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfile.Url
member.summary: The business's publicly available website.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.DirectorsProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's directors have been provided. This Boolean will be true if you've manually indicated that all directors are provided via the directors_provided parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.ExecutivesProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's executives have been provided. This Boolean will be true if you've manually indicated that all executives are provided via the executives_provided parameter, or if Stripe determined that sufficient executives were provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.Name
member.summary: The company's legal name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.NameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.NameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.OwnersProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's owners have been provided. This Boolean will be true if you've manually indicated that all owners are provided via the owners_provided parameter, or if Stripe determined that sufficient owners were provided. Stripe determines ownership requirements using both the number of owners provided and their total percent ownership (calculated by adding the percent_ownership of each owner together).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.OwnershipDeclaration
member.summary: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.Phone
member.summary: The company's phone number (used for verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.Structure
member.summary: The category identifying the legal structure of the company or legal entity. See Business structure for more details. One of: free_zone_establishment, free_zone_llc, government_instrumentality, governmental_unit, incorporated_non_profit, limited_liability_partnership, llc, multi_member_llc, private_company, private_corporation, private_partnership, public_company, public_corporation, public_partnership, single_member_llc, sole_establishment, sole_proprietorship, tax_exempt_government_instrumentality, unincorporated_association, or unincorporated_non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.TaxIdProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's business ID number was provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.TaxIdRegistrar
member.summary: The jurisdiction in which the tax_id is registered (Germany-based companies only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.VatIdProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's business VAT number was provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.Verification
member.summary: Information on the verification state of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOwnershipDeclaration.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOwnershipDeclaration.Ip
member.summary: The IP address from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOwnershipDeclaration.UserAgent
member.summary: The user-agent string from the browser where the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.BackId
member.summary: (ID of the File) The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.Back
member.summary:
(Expanded) The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.Details
member.summary: A user-displayable string describing the verification state of this document.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.DetailsCode
member.summary: One of document_corrupt, document_expired, document_failed_copy, document_failed_greyscale, document_failed_other, document_failed_test_mode, document_fraudulent, document_incomplete, document_invalid, document_manipulated, document_not_readable, document_not_uploaded, document_type_not_supported, or document_too_large. A machine-readable code specifying the verification state for this document.

member.summary:
(Expanded) The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountController.IsController
member.summary: true if the Connect application retrieving the resource controls the account and can therefore exercise platform controls. Otherwise, this field is null.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountController.Type
member.summary: The controller type. Can be application, if a Connect application controls the account, or account, if the account controls itself. One of: account, or application.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.Alternatives
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing the corresponding alternative fields instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: Date on which future_requirements merges with the main requirements hash and future_requirements becomes empty. After the transition, currently_due requirements may immediately become past_due, but the account may also be given a grace period depending on its enablement state prior to transitioning.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by future_requirements[current_deadline], these fields will transition to the main requirements hash.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: This is typed as a string for consistency with requirements.disabled_reason, but it safe to assume future_requirements.disabled_reason is empty because fields in future_requirements will never disable the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.Errors
member.summary: Fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in currently_due as well.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by requirements.current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the capability on the account. New fields will never appear here; future_requirements.past_due will always be a subset of requirements.past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. Will be an empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, these fields move to eventually_due or currently_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirementsAlternative.AlternativeFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that can be provided to satisfy all fields in original_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirementsAlternative.OriginalFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing all fields in alternative_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirementsError.Code
member.summary: The code for the type of error. One of: invalid_address_city_state_postal_code, invalid_dob_age_under_18, invalid_representative_country, invalid_street_address, invalid_tos_acceptance, invalid_value_other, verification_document_address_mismatch, verification_document_address_missing, verification_document_corrupt, verification_document_country_not_supported, verification_document_dob_mismatch, verification_document_duplicate_type, verification_document_expired, verification_document_failed_copy, verification_document_failed_greyscale, verification_document_failed_other, verification_document_failed_test_mode, verification_document_fraudulent, verification_document_id_number_mismatch, verification_document_id_number_missing, verification_document_incomplete, verification_document_invalid, verification_document_issue_or_expiry_date_missing, verification_document_manipulated, verification_document_missing_back, verification_document_missing_front, verification_document_name_mismatch, verification_document_name_missing, verification_document_nationality_mismatch, verification_document_not_readable, verification_document_not_signed, verification_document_not_uploaded, verification_document_photo_mismatch, verification_document_too_large, verification_document_type_not_supported, verification_failed_address_match, verification_failed_business_iec_number, verification_failed_document_match, verification_failed_id_number_match, verification_failed_keyed_identity, verification_failed_keyed_match, verification_failed_name_match, verification_failed_other, verification_failed_residential_address, verification_failed_tax_id_match, verification_failed_tax_id_not_issued, verification_missing_executives, verification_missing_owners, or verification_requires_additional_memorandum_of_associations.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirementsError.Reason
member.summary: An informative message that indicates the error type and provides additional details about the error.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountFutureRequirementsError.Requirement
member.summary: The specific user onboarding requirement field (in the requirements hash) that needs to be resolved.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.Alternatives
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing the corresponding alternative fields instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: Date by which the fields in currently_due must be collected to keep the account enabled. These fields may disable the account sooner if the next threshold is reached before they are collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If the account is disabled, this string describes why. Can be requirements.past_due, requirements.pending_verification, listed, platform_paused, rejected.fraud, rejected.listed, rejected.terms_of_service, rejected.other, under_review, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.Errors
member.summary: Fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in currently_due as well, and current_deadline becomes set.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. Will be an empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, these fields move to eventually_due, currently_due, or past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsAlternative.AlternativeFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that can be provided to satisfy all fields in original_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsAlternative.OriginalFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing all fields in alternative_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsError.Code
member.summary: The code for the type of error. One of: invalid_address_city_state_postal_code, invalid_dob_age_under_18, invalid_representative_country, invalid_street_address, invalid_tos_acceptance, invalid_value_other, verification_document_address_mismatch, verification_document_address_missing, verification_document_corrupt, verification_document_country_not_supported, verification_document_dob_mismatch, verification_document_duplicate_type, verification_document_expired, verification_document_failed_copy, verification_document_failed_greyscale, verification_document_failed_other, verification_document_failed_test_mode, verification_document_fraudulent, verification_document_id_number_mismatch, verification_document_id_number_missing, verification_document_incomplete, verification_document_invalid, verification_document_issue_or_expiry_date_missing, verification_document_manipulated, verification_document_missing_back, verification_document_missing_front, verification_document_name_mismatch, verification_document_name_missing, verification_document_nationality_mismatch, verification_document_not_readable, verification_document_not_signed, verification_document_not_uploaded, verification_document_photo_mismatch, verification_document_too_large, verification_document_type_not_supported, verification_failed_address_match, verification_failed_business_iec_number, verification_failed_document_match, verification_failed_id_number_match, verification_failed_keyed_identity, verification_failed_keyed_match, verification_failed_name_match, verification_failed_other, verification_failed_residential_address, verification_failed_tax_id_match, verification_failed_tax_id_not_issued, verification_missing_executives, verification_missing_owners, or verification_requires_additional_memorandum_of_associations.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsError.Reason
member.summary: An informative message that indicates the error type and provides additional details about the error.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsError.Requirement
member.summary: The specific user onboarding requirement field (in the requirements hash) that needs to be resolved.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.PrimaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.SecondaryColor

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardIssuingTosAcceptance.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardIssuingTosAcceptance.Ip
member.summary: The IP address from which the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardIssuingTosAcceptance.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPayments.StatementDescriptorPrefix
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPayments.StatementDescriptorPrefixKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only). This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix_kana specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix_kana is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPayments.StatementDescriptorPrefixKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only). This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix_kanji specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix_kanji is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDashboard.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name for this account. This is used on the Stripe Dashboard to differentiate between accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDashboard.Timezone
member.summary: The timezone used in the Stripe Dashboard for this account. A list of possible time zone values is maintained at the IANA Time Zone Database.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayments.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayments.StatementDescriptorKana

member.name: T:Stripe.Apps.Secret
member.summary:
Secret Store is an API that allows Stripe Apps developers to securely persist secrets for use by UI Extensions and app backends.
The primary resource in Secret Store is a secret. Other apps can't view secrets created by an app. Additionally, secrets are scoped to provide further permission control.
All Dashboard users and the app backend share account scoped secrets. Use the account scope for secrets that don't change per-user, like a third-party API key.
A user scoped secret is accessible by the app backend and one specific Dashboard user. Use the user scope for per-user secrets like per-user OAuth tokens, where different users might have different permissions.
Related guide: Store data between page reloads.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: The Unix timestamp for the expiry time of the secret, after which the secret deletes.

member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: T:Stripe.Balance
member.summary:
This is an object representing your Stripe balance. You can retrieve it to see the balance currently on your Stripe account.
You can also retrieve the balance history, which contains a list of transactions that contributed to the balance (charges, payouts, and so forth).
The available and pending amounts for each currency are broken down further by payment source types.
Related guide: Understanding Connect Account Balances.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Available

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.ConnectReserved
member.summary: Funds held due to negative balances on connected Custom accounts. The connect reserve balance for each currency and payment type can be found in the source_types property.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.InstantAvailable
member.summary: Funds that can be paid out using Instant Payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Pending
member.summary: Funds that are not yet available in the balance, due to the 7-day rolling pay cycle. The pending balance for each currency, and for each payment type, can be found in the source_types property.

member.name: T:Stripe.BalanceTransaction
member.summary:
Balance transactions represent funds moving through your Stripe account. They're created for every type of transaction that comes into or flows out of your Stripe account balance.
Related guide: Balance Transaction Types.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.summary: Gross amount of the transaction, in %s.

member.summary: The date the transaction's net funds will become available in the Stripe balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.ExchangeRate
member.summary: The exchange rate used, if applicable, for this transaction. Specifically, if money was converted from currency A to currency B, then the amount in currency A, times exchange_rate, would be the amount in currency B. For example, suppose you charged a customer 10.00 EUR. Then the PaymentIntent's amount would be 1000 and currency would be eur. Suppose this was converted into 12.34 USD in your Stripe account. Then the BalanceTransaction's amount would be 1234, currency would be usd, and exchange_rate would be 1.234.

member.summary: Fees (in %s) paid for this transaction.

member.summary: Detailed breakdown of fees (in %s) paid for this transaction.

member.summary: Net amount of the transaction, in %s.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Type
member.summary: Transaction type: adjustment, advance, advance_funding, anticipation_repayment, application_fee, application_fee_refund, charge, connect_collection_transfer, contribution, issuing_authorization_hold, issuing_authorization_release, issuing_dispute, issuing_transaction, payment, payment_failure_refund, payment_refund, payout, payout_cancel, payout_failure, refund, refund_failure, reserve_transaction, reserved_funds, stripe_fee, stripe_fx_fee, tax_fee, topup, topup_reversal, transfer, transfer_cancel, transfer_failure, or transfer_refund. Learn more about balance transaction types and what they represent. If you are looking to classify transactions for accounting purposes, you might want to consider reporting_category instead. One of: adjustment, advance, advance_funding, anticipation_repayment, application_fee, application_fee_refund, charge, connect_collection_transfer, contribution, issuing_authorization_hold, issuing_authorization_release, issuing_dispute, issuing_transaction, payment, payment_failure_refund, payment_refund, payout, payout_cancel, payout_failure, refund, refund_failure, reserve_transaction, reserved_funds, stripe_fee, stripe_fx_fee, tax_fee, topup, topup_reversal, transfer, transfer_cancel, transfer_failure, or transfer_refund.

member.name: T:Stripe.BankAccount
member.summary:
These bank accounts are payment methods on Customer objects.
On the other hand External Accounts are transfer destinations on Account objects for Custom accounts. They can be bank accounts or debit cards as well, and are documented in the links above.
Related guide: Bank Debits and Transfers.

member.summary: Whether this bank account is the default external account for its currency.

member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.summary: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccount.Last4
member.summary: The last four digits of the bank account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccount.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccount.RoutingNumber
member.summary: The routing transit number for the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccount.Status
member.summary:
For bank accounts, possible values are new, validated, verified, verification_failed, or errored. A bank account that hasn't had any activity or validation performed is new. If Stripe can determine that the bank account exists, its status will be validated. Note that there often isnâ€™t enough information to know (e.g., for smaller credit unions), and the validation is not always run. If customer bank account verification has succeeded, the bank account status will be verified. If the verification failed for any reason, such as microdeposit failure, the status will be verification_failed. If a transfer sent to this bank account fails, we'll set the status to errored and will not continue to send transfers until the bank details are updated.
For external accounts, possible values are new and errored. Validations aren't run against external accounts because they're only used for payouts. This means the other statuses don't apply. If a transfer fails, the status is set to errored and transfers are stopped until account details are updated.

member.name: T:Stripe.BillingPortal.Session
member.summary:
The Billing customer portal is a Stripe-hosted UI for subscription and billing management.
A portal configuration describes the functionality and features that you want to provide to your customers through the portal.
A portal session describes the instantiation of the customer portal for a particular customer. By visiting the session's URL, the customer can manage their subscriptions and billing details. For security reasons, sessions are short-lived and will expire if the customer does not visit the URL. Create sessions on-demand when customers intend to manage their subscriptions and billing details.
Learn more in the integration guide.

member.name: T:Stripe.Capability
member.summary:
This is an object representing a capability for a Stripe account.
Related guide: Account capabilities.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the capability.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.AccountId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account for which the capability enables functionality.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Account
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account for which the capability enables functionality.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Requested
member.summary: Whether the capability has been requested.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.RequestedAt
member.summary: Time at which the capability was requested. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Status
member.summary: The status of the capability. Can be active, inactive, pending, or unrequested. One of: active, disabled, inactive, pending, or unrequested.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.Alternatives
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing the corresponding alternative fields instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: Date on which future_requirements merges with the main requirements hash and future_requirements becomes empty. After the transition, currently_due requirements may immediately become past_due, but the account may also be given a grace period depending on the capability's enablement state prior to transitioning.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the capability enabled. If not collected by future_requirements[current_deadline], these fields will transition to the main requirements hash.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: This is typed as a string for consistency with requirements.disabled_reason, but it safe to assume future_requirements.disabled_reason is empty because fields in future_requirements will never disable the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.Errors
member.summary: Fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in currently_due as well.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by requirements.current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the capability on the account. New fields will never appear here; future_requirements.past_due will always be a subset of requirements.past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. Will be an empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, these fields move to eventually_due or currently_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirementsAlternative.AlternativeFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that can be provided to satisfy all fields in original_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirementsAlternative.OriginalFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing all fields in alternative_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirementsError.Code
member.summary: The code for the type of error. One of: invalid_address_city_state_postal_code, invalid_dob_age_under_18, invalid_representative_country, invalid_street_address, invalid_tos_acceptance, invalid_value_other, verification_document_address_mismatch, verification_document_address_missing, verification_document_corrupt, verification_document_country_not_supported, verification_document_dob_mismatch, verification_document_duplicate_type, verification_document_expired, verification_document_failed_copy, verification_document_failed_greyscale, verification_document_failed_other, verification_document_failed_test_mode, verification_document_fraudulent, verification_document_id_number_mismatch, verification_document_id_number_missing, verification_document_incomplete, verification_document_invalid, verification_document_issue_or_expiry_date_missing, verification_document_manipulated, verification_document_missing_back, verification_document_missing_front, verification_document_name_mismatch, verification_document_name_missing, verification_document_nationality_mismatch, verification_document_not_readable, verification_document_not_signed, verification_document_not_uploaded, verification_document_photo_mismatch, verification_document_too_large, verification_document_type_not_supported, verification_failed_address_match, verification_failed_business_iec_number, verification_failed_document_match, verification_failed_id_number_match, verification_failed_keyed_identity, verification_failed_keyed_match, verification_failed_name_match, verification_failed_other, verification_failed_residential_address, verification_failed_tax_id_match, verification_failed_tax_id_not_issued, verification_missing_executives, verification_missing_owners, or verification_requires_additional_memorandum_of_associations.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirementsError.Reason
member.summary: An informative message that indicates the error type and provides additional details about the error.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityFutureRequirementsError.Requirement
member.summary: The specific user onboarding requirement field (in the requirements hash) that needs to be resolved.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.Alternatives
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing the corresponding alternative fields instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: Date by which the fields in currently_due must be collected to keep the capability enabled for the account. These fields may disable the capability sooner if the next threshold is reached before they are collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the capability enabled. If not collected by current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the capability is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary:
If the capability is disabled, this string describes why. Can be requirements.past_due, requirements.pending_verification, listed, platform_paused, rejected.fraud, rejected.listed, rejected.terms_of_service, rejected.other, under_review, or other.
rejected.unsupported_business means that the account's business is not supported by the capability. For example, payment methods may restrict the businesses they support in their terms of service:.
- Afterpay Clearpay's terms of service.
If you believe that the rejection is in error, please contact support at https://support.stripe.com/contact/ for assistance.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.Errors
member.summary: Fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in currently_due as well, and current_deadline becomes set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the capability on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. Will be an empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, these fields move to eventually_due, currently_due, or past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirementsAlternative.AlternativeFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that can be provided to satisfy all fields in original_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirementsAlternative.OriginalFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing all fields in alternative_fields_due.

member.name: T:Stripe.Card
member.summary:
You can store multiple cards on a customer in order to charge the customer later. You can also store multiple debit cards on a recipient in order to transfer to those cards later.
Related guide: Card Payments with Sources.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.summary:
(Expanded) The account this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to a customer or recipient instead.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.summary: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

member.summary: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

member.summary: State/County/Province/Region.

member.summary: ZIP or postal code.

member.summary: If address_zip was provided, results of the check: pass, fail, unavailable, or unchecked.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.AvailablePayoutMethods
member.summary: A set of available payout methods for this card. Only values from this set should be passed as the method when creating a payout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Brand
member.summary: Card brand. Can be American Express, Diners Club, Discover, JCB, MasterCard, UnionPay, Visa, or Unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Country
member.summary: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for currency. Only applicable on accounts (not customers or recipients). The card can be used as a transfer destination for funds in this currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The customer that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to an account or recipient instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The customer that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to an account or recipient instead.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.CvcCheck
member.summary: If a CVC was provided, results of the check: pass, fail, unavailable, or unchecked. A result of unchecked indicates that CVC was provided but hasn't been checked yet. Checks are typically performed when attaching a card to a Customer object, or when creating a charge. For more details, see Check if a card is valid without a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.DefaultForCurrency
member.summary: Whether this card is the default external account for its currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Description
member.summary: A high-level description of the type of cards issued in this range. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.DynamicLast4
member.summary: (For tokenized numbers only.) The last four digits of the device account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.ExpMonth
member.summary: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.ExpYear
member.summary: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Fingerprint
member.summary:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers whoâ€™ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.
Starting May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect will change to allow two fingerprints for the same card --- one for India and one for the rest of the world..

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Funding
member.summary: Card funding type. Can be credit, debit, prepaid, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Iin
member.summary: Issuer identification number of the card. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Issuer
member.summary: The name of the card's issuing bank. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Last4
member.summary: The last four digits of the card.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Name
member.summary: Cardholder name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Status
member.summary: For external accounts, possible values are new and errored. If a transfer fails, the status is set to errored and transfers are stopped until account details are updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.TokenizationMethod
member.summary: If the card number is tokenized, this is the method that was used. Can be android_pay (includes Google Pay), apple_pay, masterpass, visa_checkout, or null.

member.name: T:Stripe.CashBalance
member.summary: A customer's Cash balance represents real funds. Customers can add funds to their cash balance by sending a bank transfer. These funds can be used for payment and can eventually be paid out to your bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalance.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalance.Available
member.summary: A hash of all cash balances available to this customer. You cannot delete a customer with any cash balances, even if the balance is 0. Amounts are represented in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalance.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer whose cash balance this object represents.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalance.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalanceSettings.ReconciliationMode
member.summary: The configuration for how funds that land in the customer cash balance are reconciled. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: T:Stripe.Charge
member.summary:
To charge a credit or a debit card, you create a Charge object. You can retrieve and refund individual charges as well as list all charges. Charges are identified by a unique, random ID.
Related guide: Accept a payment with the Charges API.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.AmountCaptured
member.summary: Amount in %s captured (can be less than the amount attribute on the charge if a partial capture was made).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.AmountRefunded
member.summary: Amount in %s refunded (can be less than the amount attribute on the charge if a partial refund was issued).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationId
member.summary: (ID of the Application) ID of the Connect application that created the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Application
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Connect application that created the charge.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFeeId
member.summary: (ID of the ApplicationFee) The application fee (if any) for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFee
member.summary:
(Expanded) The application fee (if any) for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) requested for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: Authorization code on the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge on your account balance (not including refunds or disputes).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.BalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge on your account balance (not including refunds or disputes).
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.CalculatedStatementDescriptor
member.summary: The full statement descriptor that is passed to card networks, and that is displayed on your customers' credit card and bank statements. Allows you to see what the statement descriptor looks like after the static and dynamic portions are combined.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Captured
member.summary: If the charge was created without capturing, this Boolean represents whether it is still uncaptured or has since been captured.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Currency

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

(Expanded) The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of without triggering an automatic transfer. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.summary: Details about whether the payment was accepted, and why. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Paid
member.summary: true if the charge succeeded, or was successfully authorized for later capture.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) ID of the PaymentIntent associated with this charge, if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentIntent

(Expanded) ID of the PaymentIntent associated with this charge, if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentMethodDetails
member.summary: Details about the payment method at the time of the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.RadarOptions
member.summary: Options to configure Radar. See Radar Session for more information.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge was sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptNumber
member.summary: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this charge. This attribute will be null until a receipt has been sent.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptUrl
member.summary: This is the URL to view the receipt for this charge. The receipt is kept up-to-date to the latest state of the charge, including any refunds. If the charge is for an Invoice, the receipt will be stylized as an Invoice receipt.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Refunded
member.summary: Whether the charge has been fully refunded. If the charge is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Refunds
member.summary: A list of refunds that have been applied to the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReviewId
member.summary: (ID of the Review) ID of the review associated with this charge if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Review
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the review associated with this charge if one exists.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Source
member.summary: This is a legacy field that will be removed in the future. It contains the Source, Card, or BankAccount object used for the charge. For details about the payment method used for this charge, refer to payment_method or payment_method_details instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.SourceTransferId
member.summary: (ID of the Transfer) The transfer ID which created this charge. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.SourceTransfer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The transfer ID which created this charge. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. See the Connect documentation for details.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For card charges, use statement_descriptor_suffix instead. Otherwise, you can use this value as the complete description of a charge on your customersâ€™ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Status
member.summary: The status of the payment is either succeeded, pending, or failed. One of: failed, pending, or succeeded.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferId
member.summary: (ID of the Transfer) ID of the transfer to the destination account (only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Transfer
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the transfer to the destination account (only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter).
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferData
member.summary: An optional dictionary including the account to automatically transfer to as part of a destination charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeBillingDetails.Address
member.summary: Billing address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeBillingDetails.Email
member.summary: Email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeBillingDetails.Name
member.summary: Full name.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeBillingDetails.Phone
member.summary: Billing phone number (including extension).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetails.StripeReport
member.summary: Assessments from Stripe. If set, the value is fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetails.UserReport
member.summary: Assessments reported by you. If set, possible values of are safe and fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.NetworkStatus
member.summary: Possible values are approved_by_network, declined_by_network, not_sent_to_network, and reversed_after_approval. The value reversed_after_approval indicates the payment was blocked by Stripe after bank authorization, and may temporarily appear as "pending" on a cardholder's statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Reason
member.summary: An enumerated value providing a more detailed explanation of the outcome's type. Charges blocked by Radar's default block rule have the value highest_risk_level. Charges placed in review by Radar's default review rule have the value elevated_risk_level. Charges authorized, blocked, or placed in review by custom rules have the value rule. See understanding declines for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RiskLevel
member.summary: Stripe Radar's evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are normal, elevated, highest. For non-card payments, and card-based payments predating the public assignment of risk levels, this field will have the value not_assessed. In the event of an error in the evaluation, this field will have the value unknown. This field is only available with Radar.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RiskScore
member.summary: Stripe Radar's evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are between 0 and 100. For non-card payments, card-based payments predating the public assignment of risk scores, or in the event of an error during evaluation, this field will not be present. This field is only available with Radar for Fraud Teams.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RuleId
member.summary: (ID of the Radar.Rule) The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Rule
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.SellerMessage
member.summary: A human-readable description of the outcome type and reason, designed for you (the recipient of the payment), not your customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Type
member.summary: Possible values are authorized, manual_review, issuer_declined, blocked, and invalid. See understanding declines and Radar reviews for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetails.Type
member.summary: The type of transaction-specific details of the payment method used in the payment, one of ach_credit_transfer, ach_debit, acss_debit, alipay, au_becs_debit, bancontact, card, card_present, eps, giropay, ideal, klarna, multibanco, p24, sepa_debit, sofort, stripe_account, or wechat. An additional hash is included on payment_method_details with a name matching this value. It contains information specific to the payment method.

member.summary: The tax ID of the customer (CPF for individuals consumers or CNPJ for businesses consumers).

member.summary: Check results by Card networks on Card address and CVC at time of payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Country
member.summary: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Description
member.summary: A high-level description of the type of cards issued in this range. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.ExpMonth
member.summary: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.ExpYear
member.summary: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Fingerprint
member.summary:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers whoâ€™ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.
Starting May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect will change to allow two fingerprints for the same card --- one for India and one for the rest of the world..

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Funding
member.summary: Card funding type. Can be credit, debit, prepaid, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Iin
member.summary: Issuer identification number of the card. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.summary:
Installment details for this payment (Mexico only).
For more information, see the installments integration guide.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Issuer

member.summary: Identifies which network this charge was processed on. Can be amex, cartes_bancaires, diners, discover, interac, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, visa, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.ThreeDSecure
member.summary: Populated if this transaction used 3D Secure authentication.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.Wallet
member.summary: If this Card is part of a card wallet, this contains the details of the card wallet.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardChecks.AddressLine1Check
member.summary: If a address line1 was provided, results of the check, one of pass, fail, unavailable, or unchecked.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardChecks.AddressPostalCodeCheck

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardChecks.CvcCheck

member.summary: Installment plan selected for the payment.

member.summary: The authorized amount.

member.summary: Card brand. Can be amex, diners, discover, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, visa, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.CaptureBefore
member.summary: When using manual capture, a future timestamp after which the charge will be automatically refunded if uncaptured.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.CardholderName
member.summary: The cardholder name as read from the card, in ISO 7813 format. May include alphanumeric characters, special characters and first/last name separator (/). In some cases, the cardholder name may not be available depending on how the issuer has configured the card. Cardholder name is typically not available on swipe or contactless payments, such as those made with Apple Pay and Google Pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Country
member.summary: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Description
member.summary: A high-level description of the type of cards issued in this range. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.EmvAuthData
member.summary: Authorization response cryptogram.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.ExpMonth
member.summary: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.ExpYear
member.summary: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Fingerprint
member.summary:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers whoâ€™ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.
Starting May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect will change to allow two fingerprints for the same card --- one for India and one for the rest of the world..

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Funding
member.summary: Card funding type. Can be credit, debit, prepaid, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.GeneratedCard
member.summary: ID of a card PaymentMethod generated from the card_present PaymentMethod that may be attached to a Customer for future transactions. Only present if it was possible to generate a card PaymentMethod.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Iin
member.summary: Issuer identification number of the card. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.IncrementalAuthorizationSupported
member.summary: Whether this PaymentIntent is eligible for incremental authorizations. Request support using request_incremental_authorization_support.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Issuer
member.summary: The name of the card's issuing bank. (For internal use only and not typically available in standard API requests.).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Last4
member.summary: The last four digits of the card.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Network
member.summary: Identifies which network this charge was processed on. Can be amex, cartes_bancaires, diners, discover, interac, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, visa, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.OvercaptureSupported
member.summary: Defines whether the authorized amount can be over-captured or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.ReadMethod
member.summary: How card details were read in this transaction. One of: contact_emv, contactless_emv, contactless_magstripe_mode, magnetic_stripe_fallback, or magnetic_stripe_track2.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresent.Receipt
member.summary: A collection of fields required to be displayed on receipts. Only required for EMV transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.AccountType
member.summary: The type of account being debited or credited. One of: checking, credit, prepaid, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.ApplicationCryptogram
member.summary: EMV tag 9F26, cryptogram generated by the integrated circuit chip.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.ApplicationPreferredName
member.summary: Mnenomic of the Application Identifier.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: Identifier for this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.AuthorizationResponseCode
member.summary: EMV tag 8A. A code returned by the card issuer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.CardholderVerificationMethod
member.summary: How the cardholder verified ownership of the card.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.DedicatedFileName
member.summary: EMV tag 84. Similar to the application identifier stored on the integrated circuit chip.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.TerminalVerificationResults
member.summary: The outcome of a series of EMV functions performed by the card reader.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardPresentReceipt.TransactionStatusInformation
member.summary: An indication of various EMV functions performed during the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardThreeDSecure.AuthenticationFlow
member.summary: For authenticated transactions: how the customer was authenticated by the issuing bank. One of: challenge, or frictionless.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardThreeDSecure.Result
member.summary: Indicates the outcome of 3D Secure authentication. One of: attempt_acknowledged, authenticated, exempted, failed, not_supported, or processing_error.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardThreeDSecure.ResultReason
member.summary: Additional information about why 3D Secure succeeded or failed based on the result. One of: abandoned, bypassed, canceled, card_not_enrolled, network_not_supported, protocol_error, or rejected.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardThreeDSecure.Version
member.summary: The version of 3D Secure that was used. One of: 1.0.2, 2.1.0, or 2.2.0.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardWallet.DynamicLast4
member.summary: (For tokenized numbers only.) The last four digits of the device account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCardWallet.Type
member.summary: The type of the card wallet, one of amex_express_checkout, apple_pay, google_pay, masterpass, samsung_pay, or visa_checkout. An additional hash is included on the Wallet subhash with a name matching this value. It contains additional information specific to the card wallet type. member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsInteracPresent.CardholderName
member.summary: The cardholder name as read from the card, in ISO 7813 format. May include alphanumeric characters, special characters and first/last name separator (/). In some cases, the cardholder name may not be available depending on how the issuer has configured the card. Cardholder name is typically not available on swipe or contactless payments, such as those made with Apple Pay and Google Pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsInteracPresent.Country
member.summary: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

member.summary: Authorization response cryptogram.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsInteracPresent.ExpMonth
member.summary: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsInteracPresent.ExpYear
member.summary: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsInteracPresent.Fingerprint
member.summary:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers whoâ€™ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.
Starting May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect will change to allow two fingerprints for the same card --- one for India and one for the rest of the world..

member.name: T:Stripe.Checkout.Session
member.summary:
A Checkout Session represents your customer's session as they pay for one-time purchases or subscriptions through Checkout or Payment Links. We recommend creating a new Session each time your customer attempts to pay.
Once payment is successful, the Checkout Session will contain a reference to the Customer, and either the successful PaymentIntent or an active Subscription.
You can create a Checkout Session on your server and pass its ID to the client to begin Checkout.
Related guide: Checkout Quickstart.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object. Used to pass to redirectToCheckout in Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.AfterExpiration
member.summary: When set, provides configuration for actions to take if this Checkout Session expires.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.AllowPromotionCodes
member.summary: Enables user redeemable promotion codes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.AmountSubtotal
member.summary: Total of all items before discounts or taxes are applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.AmountTotal
member.summary: Total of all items after discounts and taxes are applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.BillingAddressCollection
member.summary: Describes whether Checkout should collect the customer's billing address. One of: auto, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CancelUrl
member.summary: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ClientReferenceId
member.summary: A unique string to reference the Checkout Session. This can be a customer ID, a cart ID, or similar, and can be used to reconcile the Session with your internal systems.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Consent
member.summary: Results of consent_collection for this session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ConsentCollection
member.summary: When set, provides configuration for the Checkout Session to gather active consent from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The ID of the customer for this Session. For Checkout Sessions in payment or subscription mode, Checkout will create a new customer object based on information provided during the payment flow unless an existing customer was provided when the Session was created.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the customer for this Session. For Checkout Sessions in payment or subscription mode, Checkout will create a new customer object based on information provided during the payment flow unless an existing customer was provided when the Session was created.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerCreation
member.summary: Configure whether a Checkout Session creates a Customer when the Checkout Session completes. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerDetails
member.summary: The customer details including the customer's tax exempt status and the customer's tax IDs. Only the customer's email is present on Sessions in setup mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerEmail
member.summary: If provided, this value will be used when the Customer object is created. If not provided, customers will be asked to enter their email address. Use this parameter to prefill customer data if you already have an email on file. To access information about the customer once the payment flow is complete, use the customer attribute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The timestamp at which the Checkout Session will expire.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.LineItems
member.summary: The line items purchased by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Locale
member.summary: The IETF language tag of the locale Checkout is displayed in. If blank or auto, the browser's locale is used. One of: auto, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, en-GB, es, es-419, et, fi, fil, fr, fr-CA, hr, hu, id, it, ja, ko, lt, lv, ms, mt, nb, nl, pl, pt, pt-BR, ro, ru, sk, sl, sv, th, tr, vi, zh, zh-HK, or zh-TW.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Mode
member.summary: The mode of the Checkout Session. One of: payment, setup, or subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) The ID of the PaymentIntent for Checkout Sessions in payment mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.PaymentIntent
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the PaymentIntent for Checkout Sessions in payment mode.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.PaymentMethodCollection
member.summary: Configure whether a Checkout Session should collect a payment method. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: A list of the types of payment methods (e.g. card) this Checkout Session is allowed to accept.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.PaymentStatus
member.summary: The payment status of the Checkout Session, one of paid, unpaid, or no_payment_required. You can use this value to decide when to fulfill your customer's order. One of: no_payment_required, paid, or unpaid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.RecoveredFrom
member.summary: The ID of the original expired Checkout Session that triggered the recovery flow.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.SetupIntentId

member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the SetupIntent for Checkout Sessions in setup mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ShippingAddressCollection

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ShippingCost

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ShippingDetails

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ShippingOptions

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Status

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.SubmitType
member.summary: Describes the type of transaction being performed by Checkout in order to customize relevant text on the page, such as the submit button. submit_type can only be specified on Checkout Sessions in payment mode, but not Checkout Sessions in subscription or setup mode. One of: auto, book, donate, or pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.SubscriptionId

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Subscription

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.SuccessUrl

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.TotalDetails
