member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Url
member.summary: The URL to the Checkout Session. Redirect customers to this URL to take them to Checkout. If youâ€™re using Custom Domains, the URL will use your subdomain. Otherwise, itâ€™ll use checkout.stripe.com. This value is only present when the session is active.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpiration.Recovery
member.summary: When set, configuration used to recover the Checkout Session on expiry.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationRecovery.AllowPromotionCodes
member.summary: Enables user redeemable promotion codes on the recovered Checkout Sessions. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationRecovery.Enabled
member.summary: If true, a recovery url will be generated to recover this Checkout Session if it expires before a transaction is completed. It will be attached to the Checkout Session object upon expiration.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationRecovery.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The timestamp at which the recovery URL will expire.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationRecovery.Url
member.summary: URL that creates a new Checkout Session when clicked that is a copy of this expired Checkout Session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAutomaticTax.Enabled
member.summary: Indicates whether automatic tax is enabled for the session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAutomaticTax.Status
member.summary: The status of the most recent automated tax calculation for this session. One of: complete, failed, or requires_location_inputs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionConsent.Promotions
member.summary: If opt_in, the customer consents to receiving promotional communications from the merchant about this Checkout Session. One of: opt_in, or opt_out.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionConsent.TermsOfService
member.summary: If accepted, the customer in this Checkout Session has agreed to the merchant's terms of service.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionConsentCollection.Promotions
member.summary: If set to auto, enables the collection of customer consent for promotional communications. The Checkout Session will determine whether to display an option to opt into promotional communication from the merchant depending on the customer's locale. Only available to US merchants. One of: auto, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionConsentCollection.TermsOfService
member.summary: If set to required, it requires customers to accept the terms of service before being able to pay. One of: none, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCustomerDetails.Address

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCustomerDetails.Email

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCustomerDetails.Name

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebit.Currency
member.summary: Currency supported by the bank account. Returned when the Session is in setup mode. One of: cad, or usd.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebit.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: none, off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebit.VerificationMethod

member.summary: A URL for custom mandate text.

member.summary: List of Stripe products where this mandate can be selected automatically. Returned when the Session is in setup mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptions.IntervalDescription
member.summary: Description of the interval. Only required if the 'payment_schedule' parameter is 'interval' or 'combined'.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptions.PaymentSchedule
member.summary: Payment schedule for the mandate. One of: combined, interval, or sporadic.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptions.TransactionType

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationOptions.Recovery
member.summary: Configure a Checkout Session that can be used to recover an expired session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationRecoveryOptions.AllowPromotionCodes
member.summary: Enables user redeemable promotion codes on the recovered Checkout Sessions. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAfterExpirationRecoveryOptions.Enabled
member.summary: If true, a recovery URL will be generated to recover this Checkout Session if it expires before a successful transaction is completed. It will be attached to the Checkout Session object upon expiration.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionAutomaticTaxOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Set to true to enable automatic taxes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionConsentCollectionOptions.Promotions
member.summary: If set to auto, enables the collection of customer consent for promotional communications. The Checkout Session will determine whether to display an option to opt into promotional communication from the merchant depending on the customer's locale. Only available to US merchants. One of: auto, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionConsentCollectionOptions.TermsOfService
member.summary: If set to required, it requires customers to check a terms of service checkbox before being able to pay. There must be a valid terms of service URL set in your Dashboard settings. One of: none, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.BillingAddressCollection
member.summary: Specify whether Checkout should collect the customer's billing address. One of: auto, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CancelUrl
member.summary: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.ClientReferenceId
member.summary: A unique string to reference the Checkout Session. This can be a customer ID, a cart ID, or similar, and can be used to reconcile the session with your internal systems.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.ConsentCollection
member.summary: Configure fields for the Checkout Session to gather active consent from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CustomText
member.summary: Display additional text for your customers using custom text.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of an existing Customer, if one exists. In payment mode, the customerâ€™s most recent card payment method will be used to prefill the email, name, card details, and billing address on the Checkout page. In subscription mode, the customerâ€™s default payment method will be used if itâ€™s a card, and otherwise the most recent card will be used. A valid billing address, billing name and billing email are required on the payment method for Checkout to prefill the customer's card details.
If the Customer already has a valid email set, the email will be prefilled and not editable in Checkout. If the Customer does not have a valid email, Checkout will set the email entered during the session on the Customer.
If blank for Checkout Sessions in payment or subscription mode, Checkout will create a new Customer object based on information provided during the payment flow.
You can set payment_intent_data.setup_future_usage to have Checkout automatically attach the payment method to the Customer you pass in for future reuse.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CustomerCreation
member.summary:
Configure whether a Checkout Session creates a Customer during Session confirmation.
When a Customer is not created, you can still retrieve email, address, and other customer data entered in Checkout with customer_details.
Sessions that don't create Customers instead create Guest Customers in the Dashboard. Promotion codes limited to first time customers will return invalid for these Sessions.
Can only be set in payment and setup mode. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CustomerEmail
member.summary: If provided, this value will be used when the Customer object is created. If not provided, customers will be asked to enter their email address. Use this parameter to prefill customer data if you already have an email on file. To access information about the customer once a session is complete, use the customer field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CustomerUpdate
member.summary: Controls what fields on Customer can be updated by the Checkout Session. Can only be provided when customer is provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupon or promotion code to apply to this Session. Currently, only up to one may be specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The Epoch time in seconds at which the Checkout Session will expire. It can be anywhere from 30 minutes to 24 hours after Checkout Session creation. By default, this value is 24 hours from creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.LineItems
member.summary:
A list of items the customer is purchasing. Use this parameter to pass one-time or recurring Prices.
For payment mode, there is a maximum of 100 line items, however it is recommended to consolidate line items if there are more than a few dozen.
For subscription mode, there is a maximum of 20 line items with recurring Prices and 20 line items with one-time Prices. Line items with one-time Prices will be on the initial invoice only.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Locale
member.summary: The IETF language tag of the locale Checkout is displayed in. If blank or auto, the browser's locale is used. One of: auto, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, en-GB, es, es-419, et, fi, fil, fr, fr-CA, hr, hu, id, it, ja, ko, lt, lv, ms, mt, nb, nl, pl, pt, pt-BR, ro, ru, sk, sl, sv, th, tr, vi, zh, zh-HK, or zh-TW.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Mode
member.summary: The mode of the Checkout Session. Pass subscription if the Checkout Session includes at least one recurring item. One of: payment, setup, or subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PaymentIntentData
member.summary: A subset of parameters to be passed to PaymentIntent creation for Checkout Sessions in payment mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PaymentMethodCollection
member.summary:
Specify whether Checkout should collect a payment method. When set to if_required, Checkout will not collect a payment method when the total due for the session is 0. This may occur if the Checkout Session includes a free trial or a discount.
Can only be set in subscription mode.
If you'd like information on how to collect a payment method outside of Checkout, read the guide on configuring subscriptions with a free trial. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary:
A list of the types of payment methods (e.g., card) this Checkout Session can accept.
In payment and subscription mode, you can omit this attribute to manage your payment methods from the Stripe Dashboard. It is required in setup mode.
Read more about the supported payment methods and their requirements in our payment method details guide.
If multiple payment methods are passed, Checkout will dynamically reorder them to prioritize the most relevant payment methods based on the customer's location and other characteristics.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PhoneNumberCollection
member.summary:
Controls phone number collection settings for the session.
We recommend that you review your privacy policy and check with your legal contacts before using this feature. Learn more about collecting phone numbers with Checkout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.SetupIntentData

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.SubmitType

One of: auto, book, donate, or pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Description
member.summary: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Images
member.summary: A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended. For details, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with the payment method collected by this Checkout Session.
When setting this to on_session, Checkout will show a notice to the customer that their payment details will be saved.
When setting this to off_session, Checkout will show a notice to the customer that their payment details will be saved and used for future payments.
If a Customer has been provided or Checkout creates a new Customer, Checkout will attach the payment method to the Customer.
If Checkout does not create a Customer, the payment method is not attached to a Customer. To reuse the payment method, you can retrieve it from the Checkout Session's PaymentIntent.
When processing card payments, Checkout also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about the payment. This will appear on your customer's statement when this payment succeeds in creating a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, successful charges will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from charges will be transferred to the destination account. The ID of the resulting transfer will be returned on the successful charge's transfer field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptionsOptions.CustomMandateUrl
member.summary: A URL for custom mandate text to render during confirmation step. The URL will be rendered with additional GET parameters payment_intent and payment_intent_client_secret when confirming a Payment Intent, or setup_intent and setup_intent_client_secret when confirming a Setup Intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptionsOptions.DefaultFor
member.summary: List of Stripe products where this mandate can be selected automatically. Only usable in setup mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptionsOptions.IntervalDescription

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptionsOptions.TransactionType
member.summary: Transaction type of the mandate. One of: business, or personal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency. This is only accepted for Checkout Sessions in setup mode. One of: cad, or usd.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.MandateOptions
member.summary: Additional fields for Mandate creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: none, off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Verification method for the intent. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffixKana
member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the Kana prefix (shortened Kana descriptor) or Kana statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters. On card statements, the concatenation of both prefix and suffix (including separators) will appear truncated to 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffixKanji
member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the Kanji prefix (shortened Kanji descriptor) or Kanji statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 17 characters. On card statements, the concatenation of both prefix and suffix (including separators) will appear truncated to 17 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.FundingType

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataDeliveryEstimateOptions.Maximum

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataDeliveryEstimateOptions.Minimum

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataFixedAmountCurrencyOptionsOptions.Amount

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataFixedAmountCurrencyOptionsOptions.TaxBehavior

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataFixedAmountOptions.Amount
member.summary: A non-negative integer in cents representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataFixedAmountOptions.Currency

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataFixedAmountOptions.CurrencyOptions

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.DeliveryEstimate

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.DisplayName
member.summary: The name of the shipping rate, meant to be displayable to the customer. This will appear on CheckoutSessions.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.FixedAmount
member.summary: Describes a fixed amount to charge for shipping. Must be present if type is fixed_amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.TaxBehavior

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.TaxCode
member.summary: A tax code ID. The Shipping tax code is txcd_92010001.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingOptionShippingRateDataOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of calculation to use on the shipping rate. Can only be fixed_amount for now.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee percent, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the Stripe-Account header or an OAuth key. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The ID of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any subscription item that does not have tax_rates set. Invoices created will have their default_tax_rates populated from the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.Description
member.summary: The subscription's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription for rendering in Stripe hosted surfaces.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account on behalf of which to charge, for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the subscription's invoices will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfers will be found on the resulting charges.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. Has to be at least 48 hours in the future.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a planâ€™s trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end on subscription_data is preferred. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Integer representing the number of trial period days before the customer is charged for the first time. Has to be at least 1.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataTransferDataOptions.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionTaxIdCollectionOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Set to true to enable Tax ID collection.

member.name: T:Stripe.CountrySpec
member.summary:
Stripe needs to collect certain pieces of information about each account created. These requirements can differ depending on the account's country. The Country Specs API makes these rules available to your integration.
You can also view the information from this API call as an online guide.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object. Represented as the ISO country code for this country.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: The default currency for this country. This applies to both payment methods and bank accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedBankAccountCurrencies
member.summary: Currencies that can be accepted in the specific country (for transfers).

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedPaymentCurrencies
member.summary: Currencies that can be accepted in the specified country (for payments).

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedPaymentMethods
member.summary: Payment methods available in the specified country. You may need to enable some payment methods (e.g., ACH) on your account before they appear in this list. The stripe payment method refers to charging through your platform.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedTransferCountries
member.summary: Countries that can accept transfers from the specified country.

member.name: T:Stripe.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount you might want to apply to a customer. Coupons may be applied to subscriptions, invoices, checkout sessions, quotes, and more. Coupons do not work with conventional one-off charges or payment intents.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.AmountOff
member.summary: Amount (in the currency specified) that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Currency
member.summary: If amount_off has been set, the three-letter ISO code for the currency of the amount to take off.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Coupons defined in each available currency option. Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Duration
member.summary: One of forever, once, and repeating. Describes how long a customer who applies this coupon will get the discount. One of: forever, once, or repeating.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.DurationInMonths
member.summary: If duration is repeating, the number of months the coupon applies. Null if coupon duration is forever or once.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.MaxRedemptions
member.summary: Maximum number of times this coupon can be redeemed, in total, across all customers, before it is no longer valid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Name
member.summary: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on for instance invoices or receipts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.PercentOff
member.summary: Percent that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer for the duration of the coupon. For example, a coupon with percent_off of 50 will make a %s100 invoice %s50 instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.RedeemBy
member.summary: Date after which the coupon can no longer be redeemed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.TimesRedeemed
member.summary: Number of times this coupon has been applied to a customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Valid
member.summary: Taking account of the above properties, whether this coupon can still be applied to a customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponAppliesTo.Products
member.summary: A list of product IDs this coupon applies to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCurrencyOptions.AmountOff
member.summary: Amount (in the currency specified) that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineItem.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineItem.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineItem.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in %s representing the gross amount being credited for this line item, excluding (exclusive) tax and discounts.

One of: custom_line_item, or invoice_line_item.

member.name: T:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction
member.summary:
Each customer has a balance value, which denotes a debit or credit that's automatically applied to their next invoice upon finalization. You may modify the value directly by using the update customer API, or by creating a Customer Balance Transaction, which increments or decrements the customer's balance by the specified amount.
Related guide: Customer Balance to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Amount
member.summary: The amount of the transaction. A negative value is a credit for the customer's balance, and a positive value is a debit to the customer's balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.CreditNoteId
member.summary: (ID of the CreditNote) The ID of the credit note (if any) related to the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.CreditNote
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the credit note (if any) related to the transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The ID of the customer the transaction belongs to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the customer the transaction belongs to.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.EndingBalance
member.summary: The customer's balance after the transaction was applied. A negative value decreases the amount due on the customer's next invoice. A positive value increases the amount due on the customer's next invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.InvoiceId
member.summary: (ID of the Invoice) The ID of the invoice (if any) related to the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Invoice
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the invoice (if any) related to the transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Type
member.summary: Transaction type: adjustment, applied_to_invoice, credit_note, initial, invoice_too_large, invoice_too_small, unspent_receiver_credit, or unapplied_from_invoice. See the Customer Balance page to learn more about transaction types. One of: adjustment, applied_to_invoice, credit_note, initial, invoice_too_large, invoice_too_small, migration, unapplied_from_invoice, or unspent_receiver_credit.

member.name: T:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction
member.summary: Customers with certain payments enabled have a cash balance, representing funds that were paid by the customer to a merchant, but have not yet been allocated to a payment. Cash Balance Transactions represent when funds are moved into or out of this balance. This includes funding by the customer, allocation to payments, and refunds to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The customer whose available cash balance changed as a result of this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The customer whose available cash balance changed as a result of this transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.EndingBalance
member.summary: The total available cash balance for the specified currency after this transaction was applied. Represented in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.NetAmount
member.summary: The amount by which the cash balance changed, represented in the smallest currency unit. A positive value represents funds being added to the cash balance, a negative value represents funds being removed from the cash balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCashBalanceTransaction.Type
member.summary: The type of the cash balance transaction. One of applied_to_payment, unapplied_from_payment, refunded_from_payment, funded, return_initiated, or return_canceled. New types may be added in future. See Customer Balance to learn more about these types. One of: applied_to_payment, funded, refunded_from_payment, return_canceled, return_initiated, or unapplied_from_payment.

member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) The Payment Intent that funds were applied to.

member.summary:
(Expanded) The Payment Intent that funds were applied to.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.summary: The user-supplied reference field on the bank transfer.

member.summary: The funding method type used to fund the customer balance. Permitted values include: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer. One of: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer.

member.name: T:Stripe.Customer
member.summary:
This object represents a customer of your business. It lets you create recurring charges and track payments that belong to the same customer.
Related guide: Save a card during payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Address
member.summary: The customer's address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Balance
member.summary: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.CashBalance
member.summary: The current funds being held by Stripe on behalf of the customer. These funds can be applied towards payment intents with source "cash_balance". The settings[reconciliation_mode] field describes whether these funds are applied to such payment intents manually or automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for the currency the customer can be charged in for recurring billing purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.DefaultSourceId
member.summary:
(ID of the IPaymentSource) ID of the default payment source for the customer.
If you are using payment methods created via the PaymentMethods API, see the invoice_settings.default_payment_method field instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.DefaultSource
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment source for the customer.
If you are using payment methods created via the PaymentMethods API, see the invoice_settings.default_payment_method field instead.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Delinquent
member.summary:
When the customer's latest invoice is billed by charging automatically, delinquent is true if the invoice's latest charge failed. When the customer's latest invoice is billed by sending an invoice, delinquent is true if the invoice isn't paid by its due date.
If an invoice is marked uncollectible by dunning, delinquent doesn't get reset to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Discount
member.summary: Describes the current discount active on the customer, if there is one.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Email
member.summary: The customer's email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.InvoiceCreditBalance
member.summary: The current multi-currency balances, if any, being stored on the customer. If positive in a currency, the customer has a credit to apply to their next invoice denominated in that currency. If negative, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice denominated in that currency. These balances do not refer to any unpaid invoices. They solely track amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. A balance in a particular currency is only applied to any invoice as an invoice in that currency is finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.InvoicePrefix
member.summary: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Name
member.summary: The customer's full name or business name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.NextInvoiceSequence
member.summary: The suffix of the customer's next invoice number, e.g., 0001.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Phone
member.summary: The customer's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.PreferredLocales
member.summary: The customer's preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Shipping
member.summary: Mailing and shipping address for the customer. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Sources
member.summary: The customer's payment sources, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Subscriptions
member.summary: The customer's current subscriptions, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.TaxExempt
member.summary: Describes the customer's tax exemption status. One of none, exempt, or reverse. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the text "Reverse charge". One of: exempt, none, or reverse.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.TaxIds

member.name: T:Stripe.Dispute
member.summary:
A dispute occurs when a customer questions your charge with their card issuer. When this happens, you're given the opportunity to respond to the dispute with evidence that shows that the charge is legitimate. You can find more information about the dispute process in our Disputes and Fraud documentation.
Related guide: Disputes and Fraud.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Amount
member.summary: Disputed amount. Usually the amount of the charge, but can differ (usually because of currency fluctuation or because only part of the order is disputed).

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.BalanceTransactions
member.summary: List of zero, one, or two balance transactions that show funds withdrawn and reinstated to your Stripe account as a result of this dispute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.ChargeId
member.summary: (ID of the Charge) ID of the charge that was disputed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Charge
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the charge that was disputed.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.IsChargeRefundable
member.summary: If true, it is still possible to refund the disputed payment. Once the payment has been fully refunded, no further funds will be withdrawn from your Stripe account as a result of this dispute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.NetworkReasonCode
member.summary: Network-dependent reason code for the dispute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) ID of the PaymentIntent that was disputed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.PaymentIntent
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the PaymentIntent that was disputed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Reason

Read more about dispute reasons.

member.name: T:Stripe.Event
member.summary:
Events are our way of letting you know when something interesting happens in your account. When an interesting event occurs, we create a new Event object. For example, when a charge succeeds, we create a charge.succeeded event; and when an invoice payment attempt fails, we create an invoice.payment_failed event. Note that many API requests may cause multiple events to be created. For example, if you create a new subscription for a customer, you will receive both a customer.subscription.created event and a charge.succeeded event.
Events occur when the state of another API resource changes. The state of that resource at the time of the change is embedded in the event's data field. For example, a charge.succeeded event will contain a charge, and an invoice.payment_failed event will contain an invoice.
As with other API resources, you can use endpoints to retrieve an individual event or a list of events from the API. We also have a separate webhooks system for sending the Event objects directly to an endpoint on your server. Webhooks are managed in your account settings, and our Using Webhooks guide will help you get set up.
When using Connect, you can also receive notifications of events that occur in connected accounts. For these events, there will be an additional account attribute in the received Event object.
NOTE: Right now, access to events through the Retrieve Event API is guaranteed only for 30 days.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.Account
member.summary: The connected account that originated the event.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.ApiVersion
member.summary: The Stripe API version used to render data. Note: This property is populated only for events on or after October 31, 2014.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.summary: Number of webhooks that have yet to be successfully delivered (i.e., to return a 20x response) to the URLs you've specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.Request
member.summary: Information on the API request that instigated the event.

member.name: P:Stripe.Event.Type
member.summary: Description of the event (e.g., invoice.created or charge.refunded).

member.name: P:Stripe.EventData.Object
member.summary: Object containing the API resource relevant to the event. For example, an invoice.created event will have a full invoice object () as the value of the object key.

member.name: P:Stripe.EventData.PreviousAttributes
member.summary: Object containing the names of the attributes that have changed, and their previous values (sent along only with *.updated events).

member.name: P:Stripe.EventData.RawObject
member.summary: This contains the same data as , but untyped. This is occasionally useful, e.g. when working with an API resource for which the Stripe.net library does not have a concrete type.

member.name: P:Stripe.EventRequest.Id
member.summary: ID of the API request that caused the event. If null, the event was automatic (e.g., Stripe's automatic subscription handling). Request logs are available in the dashboard, but currently not in the API.

member.name: P:Stripe.EventRequest.IdempotencyKey
member.summary: The idempotency key transmitted during the request, if any. Note: This property is populated only for events on or after May 23, 2017.

Related guide: File Upload Guide.

member.summary:

Each key is a three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.
Each value is a integer amount. A positive amount indicates money owed to the account holder. A negative amount indicates money owed by the account holder.

member.summary:
The funds available to the account holder. Typically this is the current balance less any holds.
Each key is a three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.
Each value is a integer amount. A positive amount indicates money owed to the account holder. A negative amount indicates money owed by the account holder.

member.name: P:Stripe.FinancialConnections.AccountBalanceCredit.Used
member.summary:
The credit that has been used by the account holder.
Each key is a three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.
Each value is a integer amount. A positive amount indicates money owed to the account holder. A negative amount indicates money owed by the account holder.

member.name: T:Stripe.FundingInstructions
member.summary: Each customer has a balance that is automatically applied to future invoices and payments using the customer_balance payment method. Customers can fund this balance by initiating a bank transfer to any account in the financial_addresses field. Related guide: Customer Balance - Funding Instructions to learn more.

member.name: T:Stripe.Identity.VerificationReport
member.summary:
A VerificationReport is the result of an attempt to collect and verify data from a user. The collection of verification checks performed is determined from the type and options parameters used. You can find the result of each verification check performed in the appropriate sub-resource: document, id_number, selfie.
Each VerificationReport contains a copy of any data collected by the user as well as reference IDs which can be used to access collected images through the FileUpload API. To configure and create VerificationReports, use the VerificationSession API.
Related guides: Accessing verification results.

member.name: T:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession
member.summary:
A VerificationSession guides you through the process of collecting and verifying the identities of your users. It contains details about the type of verification, such as what verification check to perform. Only create one VerificationSession for each verification in your system.
A VerificationSession transitions through multiple statuses throughout its lifetime as it progresses through the verification flow. The VerificationSession contains the user's verified data after verification checks are complete.
Related guide: The Verification Sessions API.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.ClientSecret
member.summary: The short-lived client secret used by Stripe.js to show a verification modal inside your app. This client secret expires after 24 hours and can only be used once. Donâ€™t store it, log it, embed it in a URL, or expose it to anyone other than the user. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret. Refer to our docs on passing the client secret to the frontend to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.LastError
member.summary: If present, this property tells you the last error encountered when processing the verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.LastVerificationReportId
member.summary: (ID of the VerificationReport) ID of the most recent VerificationReport. Learn more about accessing detailed verification results..

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.LastVerificationReport
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the most recent VerificationReport. Learn more about accessing detailed verification results..
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.summary: Redaction status of this VerificationSession. If the VerificationSession is not redacted, this field will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.Status
member.summary: Status of this VerificationSession. Learn more about the lifecycle of sessions. One of: canceled, processing, requires_input, or verified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.Type
member.summary: The type of verification check to be performed. One of: document, or id_number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSession.Url
member.summary: The short-lived URL that you use to redirect a user to Stripe to submit their identity information. This URL expires after 48 hours and can only be used once. Donâ€™t store it, log it, send it in emails or expose it to anyone other than the user. Refer to our docs on verifying identity documents to learn how to redirect users to Stripe.

One of: abandoned, consent_declined, country_not_supported, device_not_supported, document_expired, document_type_not_supported, document_unverified_other, id_number_insufficient_document_data, id_number_mismatch, id_number_unverified_other, selfie_document_missing_photo, selfie_face_mismatch, selfie_manipulated, selfie_unverified_other, or under_supported_age.

member.name: P:Stripe.Identity.VerificationSessionLastError.Reason
member.summary: A message that explains the reason for verification or user-session failure.

member.name: T:Stripe.InvoiceItem
member.summary:
Sometimes you want to add a charge or credit to a customer, but actually charge or credit the customer's card only at the end of a regular billing cycle. This is useful for combining several charges (to minimize per-transaction fees), or for having Stripe tabulate your usage-based billing totals.
Related guide: Subscription Invoices.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItem.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.summary: Amount (in the currency specified) of the invoice item. This should always be equal to unit_amount * quantity.

member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

Note that for line items with type=subscription this will reflect the metadata of the subscription that caused the line item to be created.

member.name: T:Stripe.Invoice
member.summary:
Invoices are statements of amounts owed by a customer, and are either generated one-off, or generated periodically from a subscription.
They contain invoice items, and proration adjustments that may be caused by subscription upgrades/downgrades (if necessary).
If your invoice is configured to be billed through automatic charges, Stripe automatically finalizes your invoice and attempts payment. Note that finalizing the invoice, when automatic, does not happen immediately as the invoice is created. Stripe waits until one hour after the last webhook was successfully sent (or the last webhook timed out after failing). If you (and the platforms you may have connected to) have no webhooks configured, Stripe waits one hour after creation to finalize the invoice.
If your invoice is configured to be billed by sending an email, then based on your email settings, Stripe will email the invoice to your customer and await payment. These emails can contain a link to a hosted page to pay the invoice.
Stripe applies any customer credit on the account before determining the amount due for the invoice (i.e., the amount that will be actually charged). If the amount due for the invoice is less than Stripe's minimum allowed charge per currency, the invoice is automatically marked paid, and we add the amount due to the customer's credit balance which is applied to the next invoice.
More details on the customer's credit balance are here.
Related guide: Send Invoices to Customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object. This property is always present unless the invoice is an upcoming invoice. See Retrieve an upcoming invoice for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AccountCountry
member.summary: The country of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AccountName
member.summary: The public name of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AccountTaxIdIds
member.summary: (IDs of the AccountTaxIds) The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AccountTaxIds
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountDue
member.summary: Final amount due at this time for this invoice. If the invoice's total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the amount_due may be 0. If there is a positive starting_balance for the invoice (the customer owes money), the amount_due will also take that into account. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in amount_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountPaid
member.summary: The amount, in %s, that was paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountRemaining
member.summary: The difference between amount_due and amount_paid, in %s.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ApplicationId
member.summary: (ID of the Application) ID of the Connect Application that created the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Application
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Connect Application that created the invoice.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The fee in %s that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account when the invoice is paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AttemptCount
member.summary: Number of payment attempts made for this invoice, from the perspective of the payment retry schedule. Any payment attempt counts as the first attempt, and subsequently only automatic retries increment the attempt count. In other words, manual payment attempts after the first attempt do not affect the retry schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Attempted
member.summary: Whether an attempt has been made to pay the invoice. An invoice is not attempted until 1 hour after the invoice.created webhook, for example, so you might not want to display that invoice as unpaid to your users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice. When false, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.BillingReason
member.summary: Indicates the reason why the invoice was created. subscription_cycle indicates an invoice created by a subscription advancing into a new period. subscription_create indicates an invoice created due to creating a subscription. subscription_update indicates an invoice created due to updating a subscription. subscription is set for all old invoices to indicate either a change to a subscription or a period advancement. manual is set for all invoices unrelated to a subscription (for example: created via the invoice editor). The upcoming value is reserved for simulated invoices per the upcoming invoice endpoint. subscription_threshold indicates an invoice created due to a billing threshold being reached. One of: automatic_pending_invoice_item_invoice, manual, quote_accept, subscription, subscription_create, subscription_cycle, subscription_threshold, subscription_update, or upcoming.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ChargeId
member.summary: (ID of the Charge) ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Charge
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Currency

member.summary: The customer's address. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.address. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerEmail
member.summary: The customer's email. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.email. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerName
member.summary: The customer's name. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.name. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerPhone
member.summary: The customer's phone number. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.phone. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerShipping
member.summary: The customer's shipping information. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.shipping. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerTaxExempt
member.summary: The customer's tax exempt status. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.tax_exempt. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated. One of: exempt, none, or reverse.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerTaxIds
member.summary: The customer's tax IDs. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will contain the same tax IDs as customer.tax_ids. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultPaymentMethodId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary:

For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultSourceId
member.summary: (ID of the IPaymentSource) ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultSource
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: T:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization
member.summary:
When an issued card is used to make a purchase, an Issuing Authorization object is created. Authorizations must be approved for the purchase to be completed successfully.
Related guide: Issued Card Authorizations.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Amount
member.summary: The total amount that was authorized or rejected. This amount is in the card's currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Approved
member.summary: Whether the authorization has been approved.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.AuthorizationMethod
member.summary: How the card details were provided. One of: chip, contactless, keyed_in, online, or swipe.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.BalanceTransactions
member.summary: List of balance transactions associated with this authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Card
member.summary: You can create physical or virtual cards that are issued to cardholders.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.CardholderId
member.summary: (ID of the Cardholder) The cardholder to whom this authorization belongs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Cardholder
member.summary:
(Expanded) The cardholder to whom this authorization belongs.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The total amount that was authorized or rejected. This amount is in the merchant_currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The currency that was presented to the cardholder for the authorization. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.NetworkData
member.summary: Details about the authorization, such as identifiers, set by the card network.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.PendingRequest
member.summary: The pending authorization request. This field will only be non-null during an issuing_authorization.request webhook.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.RequestHistory
member.summary: History of every time pending_request was approved/denied, either by you directly or by Stripe (e.g. based on your spending_controls). If the merchant changes the authorization by performing an incremental authorization, you can look at this field to see the previous requests for the authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Status
member.summary: The current status of the authorization in its lifecycle. One of: closed, pending, or reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Transactions
member.summary: List of transactions associated with this authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Treasury
member.summary: Treasury details related to this authorization if it was created on a FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Wallet
member.summary: The digital wallet used for this authorization. One of apple_pay, google_pay, or samsung_pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.Category
member.summary: A categorization of the seller's type of business. See our merchant categories guide for a list of possible values.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.CategoryCode
member.summary: The merchant category code for the sellerâ€™s business.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.City
member.summary: City where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.Country
member.summary: Country where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.Name
member.summary: Name of the seller.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.NetworkId
member.summary: Identifier assigned to the seller by the card brand.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.PostalCode
member.summary: Postal code where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.State
member.summary: State where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationNetworkData.AcquiringInstitutionId
member.summary: ID from the network that identifies the acquiring financial institution. For Visa and Mastercard credit transactions this is as 6 digit code. For Maestro debit transactions this is a 9 digit code. Uncommonly, acquiring institution ID is not provided. When this occurs, the value will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.Amount
member.summary: The additional amount Stripe will hold if the authorization is approved, in the card's currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.IsAmountControllable
member.summary: If set true, you may provide amount to control how much to hold for the authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The amount the merchant is requesting to be authorized in the merchant_currency. The amount is in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The local currency the merchant is requesting to authorize.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequestAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Amount
member.summary: The pending_request.amount at the time of the request, presented in your card's currency and in the smallest currency unit. Stripe held this amount from your account to fund the authorization if the request was approved.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Approved
member.summary: Whether this request was approved.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The pending_request.merchant_amount at the time of the request, presented in the merchant_currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The currency that was collected by the merchant and presented to the cardholder for the authorization. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the approval or decline. One of: account_disabled, card_active, card_inactive, cardholder_inactive, cardholder_verification_required, insufficient_funds, not_allowed, spending_controls, suspected_fraud, verification_failed, webhook_approved, webhook_declined, webhook_error, or webhook_timeout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.ReasonMessage
member.summary: If approve/decline decision is directly responsed to the webhook with json payload and if the response is invalid (e.g., parsing errors), we surface the detailed message via this field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistoryAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.summary: The array of ReceivedCredits associated with this authorization.

member.summary: The array of ReceivedDebits associated with this authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationTreasury.Transaction
member.summary: The Treasury Transaction associated with this authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.AddressLine1Check
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided an address first line and if it matched the cardholderâ€™s billing.address.line1. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.AddressPostalCodeCheck
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided a postal code and if it matched the cardholderâ€™s billing.address.postal_code. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.CvcCheck
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided a CVC and if it matched Stripeâ€™s record. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.ExpiryCheck
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided an expiry date and if it matched Stripeâ€™s record. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.summary:
An Issuing Cardholder object represents an individual or business entity who is issued cards.
Related guide: How to create a Cardholder.

member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.summary: The card's CVC. For security reasons, this is only available for virtual cards, and will be omitted unless you explicitly request it with the expand parameter. Additionally, it's only available via the "Retrieve a card" endpoint, not via "List all cards" or any other endpoint.

member.summary: The expiration month of the card.
