member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Last4
member.summary: The last 4 digits of the card number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Number
member.summary: The full unredacted card number. For security reasons, this is only available for virtual cards, and will be omitted unless you explicitly request it with the expand parameter. Additionally, it's only available via the "Retrieve a card" endpoint, not via "List all cards" or any other endpoint.

(Expanded) The card this card replaces, if any.

member.summary: Where and how the card will be shipped.

member.summary: The delivery company that shipped a card. One of: dhl, fedex, royal_mail, or usps.

member.summary: Additional information that may be required for clearing customs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.Eta
member.summary: A unix timestamp representing a best estimate of when the card will be delivered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.Name
member.summary: Recipient name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.PhoneNumber
member.summary: The phone number of the receiver of the bulk shipment. This phone number will be provided to the shipping company, who might use it to contact the receiver in case of delivery issues.

member.summary: Whether a signature is required for card delivery. This feature is only supported for US users. Standard shipping service does not support signature on delivery. The default value for standard shipping service is false and for express and priority services is true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.Service
member.summary: Shipment service, such as standard or express. One of: express, priority, or standard.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.Status
member.summary: The delivery status of the card. One of: canceled, delivered, failure, pending, returned, or shipped.

member.summary: A tracking number for a card shipment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.TrackingUrl
member.summary: A link to the shipping carrier's site where you can view detailed information about a card shipment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShipping.Type
member.summary: Packaging options. One of: bulk, or individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShippingCustoms.EoriNumber
member.summary: A registration number used for customs in Europe. See https://www.gov.uk/eori and https://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/business/customs-procedures-import-and-export/customs-procedures/economic-operators-registration-and-identification-number-eori_en.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardSpendingControls.AllowedCategories

member.summary: Interval (or event) to which the amount applies. One of: all_time, daily, monthly, per_authorization, weekly, or yearly.

As a card issuer, you can dispute transactions that the cardholder does not recognize, suspects to be fraudulent, or has other issues with.

member.name: T:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction
member.summary:
Any use of an issued card that results in funds entering or leaving your Stripe account, such as a completed purchase or refund, is represented by an Issuing Transaction object.
Related guide: Issued Card Transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Amount
member.summary: The transaction amount, which will be reflected in your balance. This amount is in your currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.AuthorizationId
member.summary: (ID of the Authorization) The Authorization object that led to this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Authorization
member.summary:
(Expanded) The Authorization object that led to this transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) ID of the balance transaction associated with this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.BalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the balance transaction associated with this transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.CardId
member.summary: (ID of the Card) The card used to make this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Card
member.summary:
(Expanded) The card used to make this transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.CardholderId
member.summary: (ID of the Cardholder) The cardholder to whom this transaction belongs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Cardholder
member.summary:
(Expanded) The cardholder to whom this transaction belongs.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.DisputeId
member.summary: (ID of the Dispute) If you've disputed the transaction, the ID of the dispute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Dispute
member.summary:
(Expanded) If you've disputed the transaction, the ID of the dispute.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The amount that the merchant will receive, denominated in merchant_currency and in the smallest currency unit. It will be different from amount if the merchant is taking payment in a different currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The currency with which the merchant is taking payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.PurchaseDetails
member.summary: Additional purchase information that is optionally provided by the merchant.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Treasury
member.summary: Treasury details related to this transaction if it was created on a [FinancialAccount](/docs/api/treasury/financial_accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Type
member.summary: The nature of the transaction. One of: capture, or refund.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Transaction.Wallet
member.summary: The digital wallet used for this transaction. One of apple_pay, google_pay, or samsung_pay. One of: apple_pay, google_pay, or samsung_pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetails.Flight
member.summary: Information about the flight that was purchased with this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetails.Fuel
member.summary: Information about fuel that was purchased with this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetails.Lodging
member.summary: Information about lodging that was purchased with this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetails.Receipt
member.summary: The line items in the purchase.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetails.Reference
member.summary: A merchant-specific order number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlight.DepartureAt
member.summary: The time that the flight departed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlight.PassengerName
member.summary: The name of the passenger.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlight.Refundable
member.summary: Whether the ticket is refundable.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlight.Segments
member.summary: The legs of the trip.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlight.TravelAgency
member.summary: The travel agency that issued the ticket.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlightSegment.ArrivalAirportCode
member.summary: The three-letter IATA airport code of the flight's destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlightSegment.Carrier
member.summary: The airline carrier code.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlightSegment.DepartureAirportCode
member.summary: The three-letter IATA airport code that the flight departed from.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlightSegment.FlightNumber
member.summary: The flight number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlightSegment.ServiceClass
member.summary: The flight's service class.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFlightSegment.StopoverAllowed
member.summary: Whether a stopover is allowed on this flight.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFuel.Type
member.summary: The type of fuel that was purchased. One of diesel, unleaded_plus, unleaded_regular, unleaded_super, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFuel.Unit
member.summary: The units for volume_decimal. One of us_gallon or liter.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFuel.UnitCostDecimal
member.summary: The cost in cents per each unit of fuel, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsFuel.VolumeDecimal
member.summary: The volume of the fuel that was pumped, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsLodging.CheckInAt
member.summary: The time of checking into the lodging.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsLodging.Nights
member.summary: The number of nights stayed at the lodging.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsReceipt.Description
member.summary: The description of the item. The maximum length of this field is 26 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsReceipt.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of the item.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsReceipt.Total
member.summary: The total for this line item in cents.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionPurchaseDetailsReceipt.UnitCost
member.summary: The unit cost of the item in cents.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionTreasury.ReceivedCredit
member.summary: The Treasury ReceivedCredit representing this Issuing transaction if it is a refund.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.TransactionTreasury.ReceivedDebit
member.summary: The Treasury ReceivedDebit representing this Issuing transaction if it is a capture.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationApproveOptions.Amount
member.summary: If the authorization's pending_request.is_amount_controllable property is true, you may provide this value to control how much to hold for the authorization. Must be positive (use decline to decline an authorization request).

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationApproveOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderCreateOptions.Name
member.summary: The cardholder's name. This will be printed on cards issued to them. The maximum length of this field is 24 characters. This field cannot contain any special characters or numbers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderCreateOptions.PhoneNumber
member.summary: The cardholder's phone number. This will be transformed to E.164 if it is not provided in that format already. This is required for all cardholders who will be creating EU cards. See the 3D Secure documentation for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderCreateOptions.SpendingControls
member.summary: Rules that control spending across this cardholder's cards. Refer to our documentation for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderCreateOptions.Status
member.summary: Specifies whether to permit authorizations on this cardholder's cards. Defaults to active. One of: active, or inactive.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: One of individual or company. One of: company, or individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualDobOptions.Day
member.summary: The day of birth, between 1 and 31.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualDobOptions.Month
member.summary: The month of birth, between 1 and 12.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualDobOptions.Year
member.summary: The four-digit year of birth.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualOptions.Dob
member.summary: The date of birth of this cardholder.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualOptions.FirstName
member.summary: The first name of this cardholder. This field cannot contain any special characters or numbers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualOptions.LastName
member.summary: The last name of this cardholder. This field cannot contain any special characters or numbers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualOptions.Verification
member.summary: Government-issued ID document for this cardholder.

member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderIndividualVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControlsOptions.AllowedCategories
member.summary: Array of strings containing categories of authorizations to allow. All other categories will be blocked. Cannot be set with blocked_categories.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControlsOptions.BlockedCategories

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControlsOptions.SpendingLimitsCurrency

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControlsSpendingLimitOptions.Interval

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardPinOptions.EncryptedNumber

member.summary: Shipment service. One of: express, priority, or standard.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardShippingOptions.Type

member.summary: The unique id of the account you have revoked access to, as a string. This is the same as the you passed in. If this is returned, the revocation was successful.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.AccessToken

summary.para: The access token you can use to make requests on behalf of this Stripe account. Use it as you would any Stripe secret API key.
This key does not expire, but may be revoked by the user at any time (you'll get a account.application.deauthorized webhook event when this happens).

member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In backend code, it is recommended that you use your own secret key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

summary.para: The live mode indicator for the token. If true, the can be used as a live secret key. If false, the can be used as a test secret key.
Depends on the mode of the secret API key used to make the request.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.RefreshToken
member.summary: Can be used to get a new access token of an equal or lesser scope, or of a different live mode (where applicable).
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In backend code, it is recommended that you don't use access tokens or refresh tokens at all. Instead, you should use your own secret key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.Scope
member.summary: The scope granted to the access token, depending on the scope of the authorization code and scope parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.StripePublishableKey
member.summary: A publishable key that can be used with this account. Matches the modeâ€”live or testâ€”of the token.
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In frontend code, it is recommended that you use your own publishable key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.StripeUserId
member.summary: The unique id of the account you have been granted access to, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.TokenType
member.summary: Will always have a value of bearer.

member.name: T:Stripe.PaymentIntent
member.summary:
A PaymentIntent guides you through the process of collecting a payment from your customer. We recommend that you create exactly one PaymentIntent for each order or customer session in your system. You can reference the PaymentIntent later to see the history of payment attempts for a particular session.
A PaymentIntent transitions through multiple statuses throughout its lifetime as it interfaces with Stripe.js to perform authentication flows and ultimately creates at most one successful charge.
Related guide: Payment Intents API.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AmountCapturable
member.summary: Amount that can be captured from this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AmountReceived
member.summary: Amount that was collected by this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ApplicationId
member.summary: (ID of the Application) ID of the Connect application that created the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Application
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Connect application that created the PaymentIntent.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AutomaticPaymentMethods
member.summary: Settings to configure compatible payment methods from the Stripe Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CanceledAt
member.summary: Populated when status is canceled, this is the time at which the PaymentIntent was canceled. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for cancellation of this PaymentIntent, either user-provided (duplicate, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or abandoned) or generated by Stripe internally (failed_invoice, void_invoice, or automatic). One of: abandoned, automatic, duplicate, failed_invoice, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or void_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ClientSecret
member.summary:
The client secret of this PaymentIntent. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.
The client secret can be used to complete a payment from your frontend. It should not be stored, logged, or exposed to anyone other than the customer. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret.
Refer to our docs to accept a payment and learn about how client_secret should be handled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CustomerId
member.summary:
(ID of the Customer) ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.InvoiceId
member.summary: (ID of the Invoice) ID of the invoice that created this PaymentIntent, if it exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Invoice

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebit.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: none, off_session, or on_session.

member.summary: Transaction type of the mandate. One of: business, or personal.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.Network
member.summary: Selected network to process this payment intent on. Depends on the available networks of the card attached to the payment intent. Can be only set confirm-time. One of: amex, cartes_bancaires, diners, discover, interac, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, unknown, or visa.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, automatic, or challenge_only.

member.summary: Request ability to capture this payment beyond the standard authorization validity window.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardPresent.RequestIncrementalAuthorizationSupport
member.summary: Request ability to increment this PaymentIntent if the combination of MCC and card brand is eligible. Check incremental_authorization_supported in the Confirm response to verify support.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalance.FundingType
member.summary: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Permitted values include: bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalance.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransfer.RequestedAddressTypes
member.summary:
List of address types that should be returned in the financial_addresses response. If not specified, all valid types will be returned.
Permitted values include: sort_code, zengin, iban, or spei.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransfer.Type
member.summary: The bank transfer type that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use for funding Permitted values include: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer. One of: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferEuBankTransfer.Country
member.summary: The desired country code of the bank account information. Permitted values include: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL. One of: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentProcessingCardCustomerNotification.ApprovalRequested

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentProcessingCardCustomerNotification.CompletesAt

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferData.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferData.DestinationId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account (if any) the payment will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferData.Destination
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account (if any) the payment will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: T:Stripe.PaymentLink
member.summary:
A payment link is a shareable URL that will take your customers to a hosted payment page. A payment link can be shared and used multiple times.
When a customer opens a payment link it will open a new checkout session to render the payment page. You can use checkout session events to track payments through payment links.
Related guide: Payment Links API.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Active
member.summary: Whether the payment link's url is active. If false, customers visiting the URL will be shown a page saying that the link has been deactivated.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.AllowPromotionCodes
member.summary: Whether user redeemable promotion codes are enabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.BillingAddressCollection
member.summary: Configuration for collecting the customer's billing address. One of: auto, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.ConsentCollection
member.summary: When set, provides configuration to gather active consent from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.CustomerCreation
member.summary: Configuration for Customer creation during checkout. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.LineItems
member.summary: The line items representing what is being sold.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account on behalf of which to charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.OnBehalfOf
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account on behalf of which to charge. See the Connect documentation for details.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.PaymentIntentData
member.summary: Indicates the parameters to be passed to PaymentIntent creation during checkout.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.PaymentMethodCollection
member.summary: Configuration for collecting a payment method during checkout. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types that customers can use. When null, Stripe will dynamically show relevant payment methods you've enabled in your payment method settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.ShippingAddressCollection
member.summary: Configuration for collecting the customer's shipping address.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.ShippingOptions
member.summary: The shipping rate options applied to the session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.SubmitType
member.summary: Indicates the type of transaction being performed which customizes relevant text on the page, such as the submit button. One of: auto, book, donate, or pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.SubscriptionData
member.summary: When creating a subscription, the specified configuration data will be used. There must be at least one line item with a recurring price to use subscription_data.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.TransferData
member.summary: The account (if any) the payments will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from each payment will be transferred to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLink.Url
member.summary: The public URL that can be shared with customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkAfterCompletion.Type
member.summary: The specified behavior after the purchase is complete. One of: hosted_confirmation, or redirect.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkAfterCompletionHostedConfirmation.CustomMessage
member.summary: The custom message that is displayed to the customer after the purchase is complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkAfterCompletionRedirect.Url
member.summary: The URL the customer will be redirected to after the purchase is complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkAutomaticTax.Enabled
member.summary: If true, tax will be calculated automatically using the customer's location.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkConsentCollection.Promotions
member.summary: If set to auto, enables the collection of customer consent for promotional communications. One of: auto, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkConsentCollection.TermsOfService
member.summary: If set to required, it requires cutomers to accept the terms of service before being able to pay. If set to none, customers won't be shown a checkbox to accept the terms of service. One of: none, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCustomText.ShippingAddress
member.summary: Custom text that should be displayed alongside shipping address collection.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCustomText.Submit
member.summary: Custom text that should be displayed alongside the payment confirmation button.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCustomTextShippingAddress.Message
member.summary: Text may be up to 500 characters in length.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCustomTextSubmit.Message
member.summary: Text may be up to 500 characters in length.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkPaymentIntentData.CaptureMethod

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkPaymentIntentData.SetupFutureUsage

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkPhoneNumberCollection.Enabled

member.summary: Integer representing the number of trial period days before the customer is charged for the first time.

member.name: T:Stripe.PaymentMethod
member.summary:
PaymentMethod objects represent your customer's payment instruments. You can use them with PaymentIntents to collect payments or save them to Customer objects to store instrument details for future payments.
Related guides: Payment Methods and More Payment Scenarios.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethod.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethod.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethod.CustomerId

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethod.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the Customer to which this PaymentMethod is saved. This will not be set when the PaymentMethod has not been saved to a Customer.

member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

It contains additional information specific to the PaymentMethod type. member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCard.Fingerprint
member.summary:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers whoâ€™ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.
Starting May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect will change to allow two fingerprints for the same card --- one for India and one for the rest of the world..

member.name: T:Stripe.Payout
member.summary:
A Payout object is created when you receive funds from Stripe, or when you initiate a payout to either a bank account or debit card of a connected Stripe account. You can retrieve individual payouts, as well as list all payouts. Payouts are made on varying schedules, depending on your country and industry.
Related guide: Receiving Payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Amount
member.summary: Amount (in %s) to be transferred to your bank account or debit card.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.ArrivalDate
member.summary: Date the payout is expected to arrive in the bank. This factors in delays like weekends or bank holidays.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Automatic
member.summary: Returns true if the payout was created by an automated payout schedule, and false if it was requested manually.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this payout on your account balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.BalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this payout on your account balance.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.DestinationId
member.summary: (ID of the IExternalAccount) ID of the bank account or card the payout was sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Destination
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the bank account or card the payout was sent to.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.FailureBalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) If the payout failed or was canceled, this will be the ID of the balance transaction that reversed the initial balance transaction, and puts the funds from the failed payout back in your balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.FailureBalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) If the payout failed or was canceled, this will be the ID of the balance transaction that reversed the initial balance transaction, and puts the funds from the failed payout back in your balance.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.FailureCode
member.summary: Error code explaining reason for payout failure if available. See Types of payout failures for a list of failure codes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.FailureMessage
member.summary: Message to user further explaining reason for payout failure if available.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Method
member.summary: The method used to send this payout, which can be standard or instant. instant is only supported for payouts to debit cards. (See Instant payouts for marketplaces for more information.).

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.OriginalPayoutId
member.summary: (ID of the Payout) If the payout reverses another, this is the ID of the original payout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.OriginalPayout
member.summary:
(Expanded) If the payout reverses another, this is the ID of the original payout.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.ReversedById
member.summary: (ID of the Payout) If the payout was reversed, this is the ID of the payout that reverses this payout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.ReversedBy
member.summary:
(Expanded) If the payout was reversed, this is the ID of the payout that reverses this payout.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.SourceType
member.summary: The source balance this payout came from. One of card, fpx, or bank_account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a payout to be displayed on the user's bank statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Status
member.summary: Current status of the payout: paid, pending, in_transit, canceled or failed. A payout is pending until it is submitted to the bank, when it becomes in_transit. The status then changes to paid if the transaction goes through, or to failed or canceled (within 5 business days). Some failed payouts may initially show as paid but then change to failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Payout.Type
member.summary: Can be bank_account or card. One of: bank_account, or card.

member.name: T:Stripe.Person
member.summary:
This is an object representing a person associated with a Stripe account.
A platform cannot access a Standard or Express account's persons after the account starts onboarding, such as after generating an account link for the account. See the Standard onboarding or Express onboarding documentation for information about platform pre-filling and account onboarding steps.
Related guide: Handling Identity Verification with the API.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Nationality
member.summary: The country where the person is a national.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Phone
member.summary: The person's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.PoliticalExposure
member.summary: Indicates if the person or any of their representatives, family members, or other closely related persons, declares that they hold or have held an important public job or function, in any jurisdiction. One of: existing, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Requirements
member.summary: Information about the requirements for this person, including what information needs to be collected, and by when.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.SsnLast4Provided
member.summary: Whether the last four digits of the person's Social Security number have been provided (U.S. only).

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirements.Alternatives
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing the corresponding alternative fields instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the person's account enabled. If not collected by the account's future_requirements[current_deadline], these fields will transition to the main requirements hash, and may immediately become past_due, but the account may also be given a grace period depending on the account's enablement state prior to transition.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirements.Errors
member.summary: Fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in currently_due as well, and the account's future_requirements[current_deadline] becomes set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by the account's requirements.current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the person's account. New fields will never appear here; future_requirements.past_due will always be a subset of requirements.past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. Will be an empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, these fields move to eventually_due or currently_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirementsAlternative.AlternativeFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that can be provided to satisfy all fields in original_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirementsAlternative.OriginalFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing all fields in alternative_fields_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirementsError.Code
member.summary: The code for the type of error. One of: invalid_address_city_state_postal_code, invalid_dob_age_under_18, invalid_representative_country, invalid_street_address, invalid_tos_acceptance, invalid_value_other, verification_document_address_mismatch, verification_document_address_missing, verification_document_corrupt, verification_document_country_not_supported, verification_document_dob_mismatch, verification_document_duplicate_type, verification_document_expired, verification_document_failed_copy, verification_document_failed_greyscale, verification_document_failed_other, verification_document_failed_test_mode, verification_document_fraudulent, verification_document_id_number_mismatch, verification_document_id_number_missing, verification_document_incomplete, verification_document_invalid, verification_document_issue_or_expiry_date_missing, verification_document_manipulated, verification_document_missing_back, verification_document_missing_front, verification_document_name_mismatch, verification_document_name_missing, verification_document_nationality_mismatch, verification_document_not_readable, verification_document_not_signed, verification_document_not_uploaded, verification_document_photo_mismatch, verification_document_too_large, verification_document_type_not_supported, verification_failed_address_match, verification_failed_business_iec_number, verification_failed_document_match, verification_failed_id_number_match, verification_failed_keyed_identity, verification_failed_keyed_match, verification_failed_name_match, verification_failed_other, verification_failed_residential_address, verification_failed_tax_id_match, verification_failed_tax_id_not_issued, verification_missing_executives, verification_missing_owners, or verification_requires_additional_memorandum_of_associations.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirementsError.Reason
member.summary: An informative message that indicates the error type and provides additional details about the error.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonFutureRequirementsError.Requirement
member.summary: The specific user onboarding requirement field (in the requirements hash) that needs to be resolved.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Director
member.summary: Whether the person is a director of the account's legal entity. Directors are typically members of the governing board of the company, or responsible for ensuring the company meets its regulatory obligations.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Executive
member.summary: Whether the person has significant responsibility to control, manage, or direct the organization.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Owner
member.summary: Whether the person is an owner of the accountâ€™s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.PercentOwnership
member.summary: The percent owned by the person of the account's legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Representative
member.summary: Whether the person is authorized as the primary representative of the account. This is the person nominated by the business to provide information about themselves, and general information about the account. There can only be one representative at any given time. At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Title
member.summary: The person's title (e.g., CEO, Support Engineer).

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.Alternatives
member.summary: Fields that are due and can be satisfied by providing the corresponding alternative fields instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the person's account enabled. If not collected by the account's current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.Errors
member.summary: Fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in currently_due as well, and the account's current_deadline becomes set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by the account's current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the person's account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. Will be an empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, these fields move to eventually_due, currently_due, or past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirementsAlternative.AlternativeFieldsDue
member.summary: Fields that can be provided to satisfy all fields in original_fields_due.

member.name: T:Stripe.Plan
member.summary:
You can now model subscriptions more flexibly using the Prices API. It replaces the Plans API and is backwards compatible to simplify your migration.
Plans define the base price, currency, and billing cycle for recurring purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and plans help you track pricing. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by plans. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has plans for $10/month, $100/year, â‚¬9/month, and â‚¬90/year.
Related guides: Set up a subscription and more about products and prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan can be used for new purchases.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum. One of: last_during_period, last_ever, max, or sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Amount
member.summary: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.AmountDecimal
member.summary: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in amount) will be charged per unit in quantity (for plans with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for plans with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Interval
member.summary: The frequency at which a subscription is billed. One of day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.ProductId
member.summary: (ID of the Product) The product whose pricing this plan determines.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Product
member.summary:
(Expanded) The product whose pricing this plan determines.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires billing_scheme to be set to tiered. See also the documentation for billing_scheme.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price. In graduated tiering, pricing can change as the quantity grows. One of: graduated, or volume.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TransformUsage
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the amount billed. Cannot be combined with tiers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed. One of: licensed, or metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.FlatAmount
member.summary: Price for the entire tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as flat_amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UnitAmount
member.summary: Per unit price for units relevant to the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UpTo
member.summary: Up to and including to this quantity will be contained in the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsage.DivideBy
member.summary: Divide usage by this number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsage.Round
member.summary: After division, either round the result up or down. One of: down, or up.

member.name: T:Stripe.Price
member.summary:
Prices define the unit cost, currency, and (optional) billing cycle for both recurring and one-time purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and prices help you track payment terms. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by prices. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has prices for $10/month, $100/year, and â‚¬9 once.
Related guides: Set up a subscription, create an invoice, and more about products and prices.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Active
member.summary: Whether the price can be used for new purchases.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: T:Stripe.Product
member.summary:
Products describe the specific goods or services you offer to your customers. For example, you might offer a Standard and Premium version of your goods or service; each version would be a separate Product. They can be used in conjunction with Prices to configure pricing in Payment Links, Checkout, and Subscriptions.
Related guides: Set up a subscription, share a Payment Link, accept payments with Checkout, and more about Products and Prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.Product.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Product.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: T:Stripe.PromotionCode
member.summary: A Promotion Code represents a customer-redeemable code for a coupon. It can be used to create multiple codes for a single coupon.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.Active
member.summary: Whether the promotion code is currently active. A promotion code is only active if the coupon is also valid.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.Code
member.summary: The customer-facing code. Regardless of case, this code must be unique across all active promotion codes for each customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount you might want to apply to a customer. Coupons may be applied to subscriptions, invoices, checkout sessions, quotes, and more. Coupons do not work with conventional one-off charges or payment intents.

member.summary: Maximum number of times this promotion code can be redeemed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCode.TimesRedeemed
member.summary: Number of times this promotion code has been used.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeRestrictions.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Promotion code restrictions defined in each available currency option. Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeRestrictions.FirstTimeTransaction
member.summary: A Boolean indicating if the Promotion Code should only be redeemed for Customers without any successful payments or invoices.

member.name: T:Stripe.Quote
member.summary: A Quote is a way to model prices that you'd like to provide to a customer. Once accepted, it will automatically create an invoice, subscription or subscription schedule.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Quote.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Quote.AmountSubtotal
member.summary: Total before any discounts or taxes are applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.Quote.AmountTotal
member.summary: Total after discounts and taxes are applied.

member.summary: (ID of the Application) ID of the Connect Application that created the quote.

member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Connect Application that created the quote.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Quote.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. Only applicable if there are no line items with recurring prices on the quote.

member.name: P:Stripe.Quote.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. Only applicable if there are line items with recurring prices on the quote.

member.name: P:Stripe.Quote.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay invoices at the end of the subscription cycle or on finalization using the default payment method attached to the subscription or customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: T:Stripe.Refund
member.summary:
Refund objects allow you to refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded. Funds will be refunded to the credit or debit card that was originally charged.
Related guide: Refunds.

member.name: T:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun
member.summary:
The Report Run object represents an instance of a report type generated with specific run parameters. Once the object is created, Stripe begins processing the report. When the report has finished running, it will give you a reference to a file where you can retrieve your results. For an overview, see API Access to Reports.
Note that certain report types can only be run based on your live-mode data (not test-mode data), and will error when queried without a live-mode API key.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Error
member.summary: If something should go wrong during the run, a message about the failure (populated when status=failed).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Livemode
member.summary: true if the report is run on live mode data and false if it is run on test mode data.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.ReportType
member.summary: The ID of the report type to run, such as "balance.summary.1".

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Result
member.summary: The file object representing the result of the report run (populated when status=succeeded).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Status
member.summary: Status of this report run. This will be pending when the run is initially created. When the run finishes, this will be set to succeeded and the result field will be populated. Rarely, we may encounter an error, at which point this will be set to failed and the error field will be populated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.SucceededAt
member.summary: Timestamp at which this run successfully finished (populated when status=succeeded). Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Columns
member.summary: The set of output columns requested for inclusion in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.ConnectedAccount
member.summary: Connected account ID by which to filter the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Currency
member.summary: Currency of objects to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.IntervalEnd
member.summary: Ending timestamp of data to be included in the report run (exclusive).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.IntervalStart
member.summary: Starting timestamp of data to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Payout
member.summary: Payout ID by which to filter the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.ReportingCategory
member.summary: Category of balance transactions to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Timezone
member.summary: Defaults to Etc/UTC. The output timezone for all timestamps in the report. A list of possible time zone values is maintained at the IANA Time Zone Database. Has no effect on interval_start or interval_end.

member.name: T:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType
member.summary:
The Report Type resource corresponds to a particular type of report, such as the "Activity summary" or "Itemized payouts" reports. These objects are identified by an ID belonging to a set of enumerated values. See API Access to Reports documentation for those Report Type IDs, along with required and optional parameters.
Note that certain report types can only be run based on your live-mode data (not test-mode data), and will error when queried without a live-mode API key.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Id
member.summary: The ID of the Report Type, such as balance.summary.1.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.DataAvailableEnd
member.summary: Most recent time for which this Report Type is available. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.DataAvailableStart
member.summary: Earliest time for which this Report Type is available. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.DefaultColumns
member.summary: List of column names that are included by default when this Report Type gets run. (If the Report Type doesn't support the columns parameter, this will be null.).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Name
member.summary: Human-readable name of the Report Type.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Updated
member.summary: When this Report Type was latest updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Version
member.summary: Version of the Report Type. Different versions report with the same ID will have the same purpose, but may take different run parameters or have different result schemas.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunCreateOptions.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters specifying how the report should be run. Different Report Types have different required and optional parameters, listed in the API Access to Reports documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunCreateOptions.ReportType
member.summary: The ID of the report type to run, such as "balance.summary.1".

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.Columns
member.summary: The set of report columns to include in the report output. If omitted, the Report Type is run with its default column set.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.ConnectedAccount
member.summary: Connected account ID to filter for in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.Currency
member.summary: Currency of objects to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.IntervalEnd
member.summary: Ending timestamp of data to be included in the report run (exclusive).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.IntervalStart
member.summary: Starting timestamp of data to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.Payout
member.summary: Payout ID by which to filter the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.ReportingCategory
member.summary: Category of balance transactions to be included in the report run. One of: advance, advance_funding, anticipation_repayment, charge, charge_failure, connect_collection_transfer, connect_reserved_funds, contribution, dispute, dispute_reversal, fee, financing_paydown, financing_paydown_reversal, financing_payout, financing_payout_reversal, issuing_authorization_hold, issuing_authorization_release, issuing_dispute, issuing_transaction, network_cost, other_adjustment, partial_capture_reversal, payout, payout_reversal, platform_earning, platform_earning_refund, refund, refund_failure, risk_reserved_funds, tax, topup, topup_reversal, transfer, or transfer_reversal.
