member.name: T:Stripe.Review
member.summary:
Reviews can be used to supplement automated fraud detection with human expertise.
Learn more about Radar and reviewing payments here.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.BillingZip
member.summary: The ZIP or postal code of the card used, if applicable.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.ChargeId
member.summary: (ID of the Charge) The charge associated with this review.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Charge
member.summary:
(Expanded) The charge associated with this review.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.ClosedReason
member.summary: The reason the review was closed, or null if it has not yet been closed. One of approved, refunded, refunded_as_fraud, disputed, or redacted. One of: approved, disputed, redacted, refunded, or refunded_as_fraud.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.IpAddress
member.summary: The IP address where the payment originated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.IpAddressLocation
member.summary: Information related to the location of the payment. Note that this information is an approximation and attempts to locate the nearest population center - it should not be used to determine a specific address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Open
member.summary: If true, the review needs action.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.OpenedReason
member.summary: The reason the review was opened. One of rule or manual. One of: manual, or rule.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) The PaymentIntent ID associated with this review, if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.PaymentIntent
member.summary:
(Expanded) The PaymentIntent ID associated with this review, if one exists.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Reason
member.summary: The reason the review is currently open or closed. One of rule, manual, approved, refunded, refunded_as_fraud, disputed, or redacted.

member.name: P:Stripe.Review.Session
member.summary: Information related to the browsing session of the user who initiated the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.ReviewSession.Browser
member.summary: The browser used in this browser session (e.g., Chrome).

member.name: P:Stripe.ReviewSession.Device
member.summary: Information about the device used for the browser session (e.g., Samsung SM-G930T).

member.name: P:Stripe.ReviewSession.Platform
member.summary: The platform for the browser session (e.g., Macintosh).

member.name: P:Stripe.ReviewSession.Version
member.summary: The version for the browser session (e.g., 61.0.3163.100).

member.name: T:Stripe.SetupAttempt
member.summary: A SetupAttempt describes one attempted confirmation of a SetupIntent, whether that confirmation was successful or unsuccessful. You can use SetupAttempts to inspect details of a specific attempt at setting up a payment method using a SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.ApplicationId
member.summary: (ID of the Application) The value of application on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Application
member.summary:
(Expanded) The value of application on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.AttachToSelf
member.summary:
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the in-context Stripe Account.
It can only be used for this Stripe Accountâ€™s own money movement flows like InboundTransfer and OutboundTransfers. It cannot be set to true when setting up a PaymentMethod for a Customer, and defaults to false when attaching a PaymentMethod to a Customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The value of customer on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The value of customer on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.FlowDirections
member.summary:
Indicates the directions of money movement for which this payment method is intended to be used.
Include inbound if you intend to use the payment method as the origin to pull funds from. Include outbound if you intend to use the payment method as the destination to send funds to. You can include both if you intend to use the payment method for both purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The value of on_behalf_of on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.OnBehalfOf
member.summary:
(Expanded) The value of on_behalf_of on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.PaymentMethodId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the payment method used with this SetupAttempt.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.PaymentMethod
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the payment method used with this SetupAttempt.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.SetupError
member.summary: The error encountered during this attempt to confirm the SetupIntent, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.SetupIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the SetupIntent) ID of the SetupIntent that this attempt belongs to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.SetupIntent
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the SetupIntent that this attempt belongs to.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Status
member.summary: Status of this SetupAttempt, one of requires_confirmation, requires_action, processing, succeeded, failed, or abandoned.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttempt.Usage
member.summary: The value of usage on the SetupIntent at the time of this confirmation, one of off_session or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetails.Type
member.summary: The type of the payment method used in the SetupIntent (e.g., card). An additional hash is included on payment_method_details with a name matching this value. It contains confirmation-specific information for the payment method.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.BankCode
member.summary: Bank code of bank associated with the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.BankName
member.summary: Name of the bank associated with the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.Bic
member.summary: Bank Identifier Code of the bank associated with the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.GeneratedSepaDebitId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) The ID of the SEPA Direct Debit PaymentMethod which was generated by this SetupAttempt.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.GeneratedSepaDebit
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the SEPA Direct Debit PaymentMethod which was generated by this SetupAttempt.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.GeneratedSepaDebitMandateId
member.summary: (ID of the Mandate) The mandate for the SEPA Direct Debit PaymentMethod which was generated by this SetupAttempt.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.GeneratedSepaDebitMandate
member.summary:
(Expanded) The mandate for the SEPA Direct Debit PaymentMethod which was generated by this SetupAttempt.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupAttemptPaymentMethodDetailsBancontact.IbanLast4
member.summary: Last four characters of the IBAN.

member.name: T:Stripe.SetupIntent
member.summary:
A SetupIntent guides you through the process of setting up and saving a customer's payment credentials for future payments. For example, you could use a SetupIntent to set up and save your customer's card without immediately collecting a payment. Later, you can use PaymentIntents to drive the payment flow.
Create a SetupIntent as soon as you're ready to collect your customer's payment credentials. Do not maintain long-lived, unconfirmed SetupIntents as they may no longer be valid. The SetupIntent then transitions through multiple statuses as it guides you through the setup process.
Successful SetupIntents result in payment credentials that are optimized for future payments. For example, cardholders in certain regions may need to be run through Strong Customer Authentication at the time of payment method collection in order to streamline later off-session payments. If the SetupIntent is used with a Customer, upon success, it will automatically attach the resulting payment method to that Customer. We recommend using SetupIntents or setup_future_usage on PaymentIntents to save payment methods in order to prevent saving invalid or unoptimized payment methods.
By using SetupIntents, you ensure that your customers experience the minimum set of required friction, even as regulations change over time.
Related guide: Setup Intents API.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.summary: (ID of the Application) ID of the Connect application that created the SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Application
member.summary:

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.AttachToSelf
member.summary:
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the in-context Stripe Account.
It can only be used for this Stripe Accountâ€™s own money movement flows like InboundTransfer and OutboundTransfers. It cannot be set to true when setting up a PaymentMethod for a Customer, and defaults to false when attaching a PaymentMethod to a Customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for cancellation of this SetupIntent, one of abandoned, requested_by_customer, or duplicate. One of: abandoned, duplicate, or requested_by_customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.ClientSecret
member.summary:
The client secret of this SetupIntent. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.
The client secret can be used to complete payment setup from your frontend. It should not be stored, logged, or exposed to anyone other than the customer. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret.

member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.CustomerId
member.summary:
(ID of the Customer) ID of the Customer this SetupIntent belongs to, if one exists.
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer on successful setup. Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Customer this SetupIntent belongs to, if one exists.
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer on successful setup. Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this SetupIntent.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.FlowDirections
member.summary:
Indicates the directions of money movement for which this payment method is intended to be used.
Include inbound if you intend to use the payment method as the origin to pull funds from. Include outbound if you intend to use the payment method as the destination to send funds to. You can include both if you intend to use the payment method for both purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Usage
member.summary:
Indicates how the payment method is intended to be used in the future.
Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when the customer is in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. If not provided, this value defaults to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, automatic, or challenge_only.

member.name: T:Stripe.Source
member.summary:
Source objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods. They represent a customer's payment instrument, and can be used with the Stripe API just like a Card object: once chargeable, they can be charged, or can be attached to customers.
Stripe doesn't recommend using the deprecated Sources API. We recommend that you adopt the PaymentMethods API. This newer API provides access to our latest features and payment method types.
Related guides: Sources API and Sources & Customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for Â¥1, Japanese Yen being a zero-decimal currency) representing the total amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single_use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for the currency associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single_use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer to which this source is attached. This will not be present when the source has not been attached to a customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Flow
member.summary: The authentication flow of the source. flow is one of redirect, receiver, code_verification, none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a source. This will appear on your customer's statement every time you charge the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Status
member.summary: The status of the source, one of canceled, chargeable, consumed, failed, or pending. Only chargeable sources can be used to create a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Type
member.summary: The type of the source. The type is a payment method, one of ach_credit_transfer, ach_debit, alipay, bancontact, card, card_present, eps, giropay, ideal, multibanco, klarna, p24, sepa_debit, sofort, three_d_secure, or wechat. An additional hash is included on the source with a name matching this value. It contains additional information specific to the payment method used. One of: ach_credit_transfer, ach_debit, acss_debit, alipay, au_becs_debit, bancontact, card, card_present, eps, giropay, ideal, klarna, multibanco, p24, sepa_credit_transfer, sepa_debit, sofort, three_d_secure, or wechat.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Usage
member.summary: Either reusable or single_use. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while others may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.AttemptsRemaining

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.Status
member.summary: The status of the code verification, either pending (awaiting verification, attempts_remaining should be greater than 0), succeeded (successful verification) or failed (failed verification, cannot be verified anymore as attempts_remaining should be 0).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.Address
member.summary: Owner's address.

member.summary: Owner's phone number (including extension).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.VerifiedAddress
member.summary: Verified owner's address. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.VerifiedEmail
member.summary: Verified owner's email address. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.Address
member.summary: The address of the receiver source. This is the value that should be communicated to the customer to send their funds to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountCharged
member.summary: The total amount that was moved to your balance. This is almost always equal to the amount charged. In rare cases when customers deposit excess funds and we are unable to refund those, those funds get moved to your balance and show up in amount_charged as well. The amount charged is expressed in the source's currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountReceived
member.summary: The total amount received by the receiver source. amount_received = amount_returned + amount_charged should be true for consumed sources unless customers deposit excess funds. The amount received is expressed in the source's currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountReturned
member.summary: The total amount that was returned to the customer. The amount returned is expressed in the source's currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.RefundAttributesMethod
member.summary: Type of refund attribute method, one of email, manual, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.RefundAttributesStatus
member.summary: Type of refund attribute status, one of missing, requested, or available.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.FailureReason
member.summary: The failure reason for the redirect, either user_abort (the customer aborted or dropped out of the redirect flow), declined (the authentication failed or the transaction was declined), or processing_error (the redirect failed due to a technical error). Present only if the redirect status is failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL you provide to redirect the customer to after they authenticated their payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.Status
member.summary: The status of the redirect, either pending (ready to be used by your customer to authenticate the transaction), succeeded (succesful authentication, cannot be reused) or not_required (redirect should not be used) or failed (failed authentication, cannot be reused).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.Url
member.summary: The URL provided to you to redirect a customer to as part of a redirect authentication flow.

member.name: T:Stripe.SubscriptionItem
member.summary: Subscription items allow you to create customer subscriptions with more than one plan, making it easy to represent complex billing relationships.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItem.Plan
member.summary:
You can now model subscriptions more flexibly using the Prices API. It replaces the Plans API and is backwards compatible to simplify your migration.
Plans define the base price, currency, and billing cycle for recurring purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and plans help you track pricing. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by plans. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has plans for $10/month, $100/year, â‚¬9/month, and â‚¬90/year.
Related guides: Set up a subscription and more about products and prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItem.Price
member.summary:
Prices define the unit cost, currency, and (optional) billing cycle for both recurring and one-time purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and prices help you track payment terms. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by prices. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has prices for $10/month, $100/year, and â‚¬9 once.
Related guides: Set up a subscription, create an invoice, and more about products and prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItem.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of the plan to which the customer should be subscribed.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItem.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to this subscription_item. When set, the default_tax_rates on the subscription do not apply to this subscription_item.

member.summary: Usage threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. The timestamp is in UTC format.

member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.summary: A date in the future at which the subscription will automatically get canceled.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: If the subscription has been canceled with the at_period_end flag set to true, cancel_at_period_end on the subscription will be true. You can use this attribute to determine whether a subscription that has a status of active is scheduled to be canceled at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CanceledAt
member.summary: If the subscription has been canceled, the date of that cancellation. If the subscription was canceled with cancel_at_period_end, canceled_at will reflect the time of the most recent update request, not the end of the subscription period when the subscription is automatically moved to a canceled state.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the default payment method for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription. This takes precedence over default_source. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.summary:

If default_payment_method is also set, default_payment_method will take precedence. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.summary: Date when the subscription was first created. The date might differ from the created date due to backdating.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.Status
member.summary:
Possible values are incomplete, incomplete_expired, trialing, active, past_due, canceled, or unpaid.
For collection_method=charge_automatically a subscription moves into incomplete if the initial payment attempt fails. A subscription in this state can only have metadata and default_source updated. Once the first invoice is paid, the subscription moves into an active state. If the first invoice is not paid within 23 hours, the subscription transitions to incomplete_expired. This is a terminal state, the open invoice will be voided and no further invoices will be generated.
A subscription that is currently in a trial period is trialing and moves to active when the trial period is over.
If subscription collection_method=charge_automatically it becomes past_due when payment to renew it fails and canceled or unpaid (depending on your subscriptions settings) when Stripe has exhausted all payment retry attempts.
If subscription collection_method=send_invoice it becomes past_due when its invoice is not paid by the due date, and canceled or unpaid if it is still not paid by an additional deadline after that. Note that when a subscription has a status of unpaid, no subsequent invoices will be attempted (invoices will be created, but then immediately automatically closed). After receiving updated payment information from a customer, you may choose to reopen and pay their closed invoices. One of: active, canceled, incomplete, incomplete_expired, past_due, trialing, or unpaid.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferEuBankTransfer.Country
member.summary: The desired country code of the bank account information. Permitted values include: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL. One of: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccount.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Bank account verification method. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountFinancialConnections.Permissions
member.summary: The list of permissions to request. The payment_method permission must be included.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemInterval.Interval
member.summary: Specifies invoicing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemInterval.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between invoices. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingUpdate.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: If the update is applied, determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. The timestamp is in UTC format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingUpdate.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The point after which the changes reflected by this update will be discarded and no longer applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingUpdate.SubscriptionItems
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan, that will be set if the update is applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingUpdate.TrialEnd
member.summary: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time, if the update is applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingUpdate.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan's trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with trial_end is not allowed. See Using trial periods on subscriptions to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferData.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferData.DestinationId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferData.Destination
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: T:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule
member.summary:
A subscription schedule allows you to create and manage the lifecycle of a subscription by predefining expected changes.
Related guide: Subscription Schedules.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.ApplicationId
member.summary: (ID of the Application) ID of the Connect Application that created the schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Application
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Connect Application that created the schedule.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.CanceledAt
member.summary: Time at which the subscription schedule was canceled. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.CompletedAt
member.summary: Time at which the subscription schedule was completed. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.CurrentPhase
member.summary: Object representing the start and end dates for the current phase of the subscription schedule, if it is active.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) ID of the customer who owns the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Customer
member.summary:

For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.EndBehavior
member.summary: Behavior of the subscription schedule and underlying subscription when it ends. Possible values are release and cancel. One of: cancel, none, release, or renew.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Phases
member.summary: Configuration for the subscription schedule's phases.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.ReleasedAt
member.summary: Time at which the subscription schedule was released. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.ReleasedSubscription
member.summary: ID of the subscription once managed by the subscription schedule (if it is released).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Status
member.summary: The present status of the subscription schedule. Possible values are not_started, active, completed, released, and canceled. You can read more about the different states in our behavior guide. One of: active, canceled, completed, not_started, or released.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.SubscriptionId
member.summary: (ID of the Subscription) ID of the subscription managed by the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.Subscription
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the subscription managed by the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.TestClockId
member.summary: (ID of the TestHelpers.TestClock) ID of the test clock this subscription schedule belongs to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedule.TestClock
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the test clock this subscription schedule belongs to.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCurrentPhase.EndDate
member.summary: The end of this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCurrentPhase.StartDate
member.summary: The start of this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account during this phase of the schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Possible values are phase_start or automatic. If phase_start then billing cycle anchor of the subscription is set to the start of the phase when entering the phase. If automatic then the billing cycle anchor is automatically modified as needed when entering the phase. For more information, see the billing cycle documentation. One of: automatic, or phase_start.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.DefaultPaymentMethodId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule. If not set, invoices will use the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule. If not set, invoices will use the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.Description
member.summary: Subscription description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: The subscription schedule's default invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of for charges associated with the schedule's subscription. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.OnBehalfOf
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of for charges associated with the schedule's subscription. See the Connect documentation for details.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.TransferData
member.summary: The account (if any) the associated subscription's payments will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from each payment will be transferred to for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsAutomaticTax.Enabled
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on invoices created during this phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsBillingThresholds.AmountGte
member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsBillingThresholds.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be true if the subscription contains items with plans that have aggregate_usage=last_ever.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsInvoiceSettings.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days within which a customer must pay invoices generated by this subscription schedule. This value will be null for subscription schedules where billing=charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsTransferData.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsTransferData.DestinationId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsTransferData.Destination
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the next invoice for this phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account during this phase of the schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Possible values are phase_start or automatic. If phase_start then billing cycle anchor of the subscription is set to the start of the phase when entering the phase. If automatic then the billing cycle anchor is automatically modified as needed when entering the phase. For more information, see the billing cycle documentation. One of: automatic, or phase_start.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.CouponId
member.summary: (ID of the Coupon) ID of the coupon to use during this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.Coupon
member.summary:

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.DefaultPaymentMethodId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription schedule. If not set, invoices will use the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a phase. Metadata on a schedule's phase will update the underlying subscription's metadata when the phase is entered. Updating the underlying subscription's metadata directly will not affect the current phase's metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of for charges associated with the schedule's subscription. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhase.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: If the subscription schedule will prorate when transitioning to this phase. Possible values are create_prorations and none. One of: always_invoice, create_prorations, or none.

member.summary: The start of this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRate.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.summary: Defaults to true. When set to false, this tax rate cannot be used with new applications or Checkout Sessions, but will still work for subscriptions and invoices that already have it set.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRate.Country
member.summary: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the tax rate for your internal use only. It will not be visible to your customers.

member.summary: The display name of the tax rates as it will appear to your customer on their receipt email, PDF, and the hosted invoice page.

member.summary: This specifies if the tax rate is inclusive or exclusive.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRate.Jurisdiction
member.summary: The jurisdiction for the tax rate. You can use this label field for tax reporting purposes. It also appears on your customerâ€™s invoice.

member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.summary: This represents the tax rate percent out of 100.

member.name: T:Stripe.Terminal.ConnectionToken
member.summary:
A Connection Token is used by the Stripe Terminal SDK to connect to a reader.
Related guide: Fleet Management.

member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Terminal.ConnectionToken.Location
member.summary: The id of the location that this connection token is scoped to. Note that location scoping only applies to internet-connected readers. For more details, see the docs on scoping connection tokens.

member.summary: Your application should pass this token to the Stripe Terminal SDK.

member.summary: The id of the location that this connection token is scoped to. If specified the connection token will only be usable with readers assigned to that location, otherwise the connection token will be usable with all readers. Note that location scoping only applies to internet-connected readers. For more details, see the docs on scoping connection tokens.

member.name: T:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock
member.summary: A test clock enables deterministic control over objects in testmode. With a test clock, you can create objects at a frozen time in the past or future, and advance to a specific future time to observe webhooks and state changes. After the clock advances, you can either validate the current state of your scenario (and test your assumptions), change the current state of your scenario (and test more complex scenarios), or keep advancing forward in time.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.DeletesAfter
member.summary: Time at which this clock is scheduled to auto delete.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.FrozenTime
member.summary: Time at which all objects belonging to this clock are frozen.

member.name: P:Stripe.TestHelpers.TestClock.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: T:Stripe.Token
member.summary:
Tokenization is the process Stripe uses to collect sensitive card or bank account details, or personally identifiable information (PII), directly from your customers in a secure manner. A token representing this information is returned to your server to use. You should use our recommended payments integrations to perform this process client-side. This ensures that no sensitive card data touches your server, and allows your integration to operate in a PCI-compliant way.
If you cannot use client-side tokenization, you can also create tokens using the API with either your publishable or secret API key. Keep in mind that if your integration uses this method, you are responsible for any PCI compliance that may be required, and you must keep your secret API key safe. Unlike with client-side tokenization, your customer's information is not sent directly to Stripe, so we cannot determine how it is handled or stored.
Tokens cannot be stored or used more than once. To store card or bank account information for later use, you can create Customer objects or Custom accounts. Note that Radar, our integrated solution for automatic fraud protection, performs best with integrations that use client-side tokenization.
Related guide: Accept a payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.BankAccount
member.summary:
These bank accounts are payment methods on Customer objects.
On the other hand External Accounts are transfer destinations on Account objects for Custom accounts. They can be bank accounts or debit cards as well, and are documented in the links above.
Related guide: Bank Debits and Transfers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.Card
member.summary:
You can store multiple cards on a customer in order to charge the customer later. You can also store multiple debit cards on a recipient in order to transfer to those cards later.
Related guide: Card Payments with Sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.ClientIp
member.summary: IP address of the client that generated the token.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.Type
member.summary: Type of the token: account, bank_account, card, or pii.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.Used
member.summary: Whether this token has already been used (tokens can be used only once).

member.name: T:Stripe.Topup
member.summary:
To top up your Stripe balance, you create a top-up object. You can retrieve individual top-ups, as well as list all top-ups. Top-ups are identified by a unique, random ID.
Related guide: Topping Up your Platform Account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: Amount transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this top-up on your account balance. May not be specified depending on status of top-up.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.BalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this top-up on your account balance. May not be specified depending on status of top-up.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.ExpectedAvailabilityDate
member.summary: Date the funds are expected to arrive in your Stripe account for payouts. This factors in delays like weekends or bank holidays. May not be specified depending on status of top-up.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.FailureCode
member.summary: Error code explaining reason for top-up failure if available (see the errors section for a list of codes).

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Source
member.summary: For most Stripe users, the source of every top-up is a bank account. This hash is then the source object describing that bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a top-up. This will appear on your source's bank statement. It must contain at least one letter.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Status
member.summary: The status of the top-up is either canceled, failed, pending, reversed, or succeeded. One of: canceled, failed, pending, reversed, or succeeded.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this top-up as part of a group.

member.name: T:Stripe.TransferReversal
member.summary:
Stripe Connect platforms can reverse transfers made to a connected account, either entirely or partially, and can also specify whether to refund any related application fees. Transfer reversals add to the platform's balance and subtract from the destination account's balance.
Reversing a transfer that was made for a destination charge is allowed only up to the amount of the charge. It is possible to reverse a transfer_group transfer only if the destination account has enough balance to cover the reversal.
Related guide: Reversing Transfers.

member.name: T:Stripe.Transfer
member.summary:
A Transfer object is created when you move funds between Stripe accounts as part of Connect.
Before April 6, 2017, transfers also represented movement of funds from a Stripe account to a card or bank account. This behavior has since been split out into a Payout object, with corresponding payout endpoints. For more information, read about the transfer/payout split.
Related guide: Creating Separate Charges and Transfers.

member.summary: Amount in %s reversed (can be less than the amount attribute on the transfer if a partial reversal was issued).

member.name: T:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount
member.summary: Stripe Treasury provides users with a container for money called a FinancialAccount that is separate from their Payments balance. FinancialAccounts serve as the source and destination of Treasuryâ€™s money movement APIs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.ActiveFeatures
member.summary: The array of paths to active Features in the Features hash.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Balance
member.summary: Balance information for the FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Country
member.summary: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Features
member.summary: Encodes whether a FinancialAccount has access to a particular Feature, with a status enum and associated status_details. Stripe or the platform can control Features via the requested field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.FinancialAddresses
member.summary: The set of credentials that resolve to a FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.PendingFeatures
member.summary: The array of paths to pending Features in the Features hash.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.PlatformRestrictions
member.summary: The set of functionalities that the platform can restrict on the FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.RestrictedFeatures
member.summary: The array of paths to restricted Features in the Features hash.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.Status
member.summary: The enum specifying what state the account is in. One of: closed, or open.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccount.SupportedCurrencies
member.summary: The currencies the FinancialAccount can hold a balance in. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountBalance.Cash
member.summary: Funds the user can spend right now.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountBalance.InboundPending
member.summary: Funds not spendable yet, but will become available at a later time.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountBalance.OutboundPending
member.summary: Funds in the account, but not spendable because they are being held for pending outbound flows.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddress.Aba
member.summary: ABA Records contain U.S. bank account details per the ABA format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddress.SupportedNetworks
member.summary: The list of networks that the address supports.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddress.Type
member.summary: The type of financial address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddressAba.AccountHolderName
member.summary: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddressAba.AccountNumber
member.summary: The account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddressAba.AccountNumberLast4
member.summary: The last four characters of the account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddressAba.BankName
member.summary: Name of the bank.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountFinancialAddressAba.RoutingNumber
member.summary: Routing number for the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountPlatformRestrictions.InboundFlows
member.summary: Restricts all inbound money movement. One of: restricted, or unrestricted.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountPlatformRestrictions.OutboundFlows
member.summary: Restricts all outbound money movement. One of: restricted, or unrestricted.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountStatusDetails.Closed
member.summary: Details related to the closure of this FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.FinancialAccountStatusDetailsClosed.Reasons
member.summary: The array that contains reasons for a FinancialAccount closure.

member.name: T:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer
member.summary: Use InboundTransfers to add funds to your FinancialAccount via a PaymentMethod that is owned by you. The funds will be transferred via an ACH debit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Amount
member.summary: Amount (in cents) transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Cancelable
member.summary: Returns true if the InboundTransfer is able to be canceled.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.FailureDetails
member.summary: Details about this InboundTransfer's failure. Only set when status is failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.FinancialAccount
member.summary: The FinancialAccount that received the funds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.HostedRegulatoryReceiptUrl
member.summary: A hosted transaction receipt URL that is provided when money movement is considered regulated under Stripe's money transmission licenses.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.OriginPaymentMethod
member.summary: The origin payment method to be debited for an InboundTransfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.OriginPaymentMethodDetails
member.summary: Details about the PaymentMethod for an InboundTransfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Returned
member.summary: Returns true if the funds for an InboundTransfer were returned after the InboundTransfer went to the succeeded state.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Statement descriptor shown when funds are debited from the source. Not all payment networks support statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Status
member.summary: Status of the InboundTransfer: processing, succeeded, failed, and canceled. An InboundTransfer is processing if it is created and pending. The status changes to succeeded once the funds have been "confirmed" and a transaction is created and posted. The status changes to failed if the transfer fails. One of: canceled, failed, processing, or succeeded.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.TransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the Transaction) The Transaction associated with this object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransfer.Transaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) The Transaction associated with this object.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferFailureDetails.Code
member.summary: Reason for the failure. One of: account_closed, account_frozen, bank_account_restricted, bank_ownership_changed, debit_not_authorized, incorrect_account_holder_address, incorrect_account_holder_name, incorrect_account_holder_tax_id, insufficient_funds, invalid_account_number, invalid_currency, no_account, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferLinkedFlows.ReceivedDebit
member.summary: If funds for this flow were returned after the flow went to the succeeded state, this field contains a reference to the ReceivedDebit return.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetails.Type
member.summary: The type of the payment method used in the InboundTransfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Email
member.summary: Email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Name
member.summary: Full name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.AccountHolderType
member.summary: Account holder type: individual or company. One of: company, or individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.AccountType
member.summary: Account type: checkings or savings. Defaults to checking if omitted. One of: checking, or savings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.BankName
member.summary: Name of the bank associated with the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Fingerprint
member.summary: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Last4
member.summary: Last four digits of the bank account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Network
member.summary: The US bank account network used to debit funds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferOriginPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.RoutingNumber
member.summary: Routing number of the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferStatusTransitions.CanceledAt
member.summary: Timestamp describing when an InboundTransfer changed status to canceled.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferStatusTransitions.FailedAt
member.summary: Timestamp describing when an InboundTransfer changed status to failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.InboundTransferStatusTransitions.SucceededAt
member.summary: Timestamp describing when an InboundTransfer changed status to succeeded.

member.name: T:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment
member.summary:
Use OutboundPayments to send funds to another party's external bank account or FinancialAccount. To send money to an account belonging to the same user, use an OutboundTransfer.
Simulate OutboundPayment state changes with the /v1/test_helpers/treasury/outbound_payments endpoints. These methods can only be called on test mode objects.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Amount
member.summary: Amount (in cents) transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Cancelable
member.summary: Returns true if the object can be canceled, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Customer
member.summary: ID of the customer to whom an OutboundPayment is sent.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.DestinationPaymentMethod
member.summary: The PaymentMethod via which an OutboundPayment is sent. This field can be empty if the OutboundPayment was created using destination_payment_method_data.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.DestinationPaymentMethodDetails
member.summary: Details about the PaymentMethod for an OutboundPayment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.EndUserDetails
member.summary: Details about the end user.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.ExpectedArrivalDate
member.summary: The date when funds are expected to arrive in the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.FinancialAccount
member.summary: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.HostedRegulatoryReceiptUrl
member.summary: A hosted transaction receipt URL that is provided when money movement is considered regulated under Stripe's money transmission licenses.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.ReturnedDetails
member.summary: Details about a returned OutboundPayment. Only set when the status is returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The description that appears on the receiving end for an OutboundPayment (for example, bank statement for external bank transfer).

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Status
member.summary: Current status of the OutboundPayment: processing, failed, posted, returned, canceled. An OutboundPayment is processing if it has been created and is pending. The status changes to posted once the OutboundPayment has been "confirmed" and funds have left the account, or to failed or canceled. If an OutboundPayment fails to arrive at its destination, its status will change to returned. One of: canceled, failed, posted, processing, or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.TransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the Transaction) The Transaction associated with this object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPayment.Transaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) The Transaction associated with this object.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetails.Type
member.summary: The type of the payment method used in the OutboundPayment. One of: financial_account, or us_bank_account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Email
member.summary: Email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Name
member.summary: Full name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsFinancialAccount.Id
member.summary: Token of the FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsFinancialAccount.Network
member.summary: The rails used to send funds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.AccountHolderType
member.summary: Account holder type: individual or company. One of: company, or individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.AccountType
member.summary: Account type: checkings or savings. Defaults to checking if omitted. One of: checking, or savings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.BankName
member.summary: Name of the bank associated with the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Fingerprint
member.summary: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Last4
member.summary: Last four digits of the bank account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Network
member.summary: The US bank account network used to send funds. One of: ach, or us_domestic_wire.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.RoutingNumber
member.summary: Routing number of the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentEndUserDetails.IpAddress
member.summary: IP address of the user initiating the OutboundPayment. Set if present is set to true. IP address collection is required for risk and compliance reasons. This will be used to help determine if the OutboundPayment is authorized or should be blocked.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentEndUserDetails.Present
member.summary: true`` if the OutboundPayment creation request is being made on behalf of an end user by a platform. Otherwise, false`.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentReturnedDetails.Code
member.summary: Reason for the return. One of: account_closed, account_frozen, bank_account_restricted, bank_ownership_changed, declined, incorrect_account_holder_name, invalid_account_number, invalid_currency, no_account, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentReturnedDetails.TransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the Transaction) The Transaction associated with this object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentReturnedDetails.Transaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) The Transaction associated with this object.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentStatusTransitions.CanceledAt
member.summary: Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to canceled.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentStatusTransitions.FailedAt
member.summary: Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundPaymentStatusTransitions.ReturnedAt
member.summary: Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to returned.

member.name: T:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer
member.summary:
Use OutboundTransfers to transfer funds from a FinancialAccount to a PaymentMethod belonging to the same entity. To send funds to a different party, use OutboundPayments instead. You can send funds over ACH rails or through a domestic wire transfer to a user's own external bank account.
Simulate OutboundTransfer state changes with the /v1/test_helpers/treasury/outbound_transfers endpoints. These methods can only be called on test mode objects.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Amount
member.summary: Amount (in cents) transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Cancelable
member.summary: Returns true if the object can be canceled, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.DestinationPaymentMethod
member.summary: The PaymentMethod used as the payment instrument for an OutboundTransfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.ExpectedArrivalDate
member.summary: The date when funds are expected to arrive in the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.FinancialAccount
member.summary: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.HostedRegulatoryReceiptUrl
member.summary: A hosted transaction receipt URL that is provided when money movement is considered regulated under Stripe's money transmission licenses.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.ReturnedDetails
member.summary: Details about a returned OutboundTransfer. Only set when the status is returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Information about the OutboundTransfer to be sent to the recipient account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Status
member.summary: Current status of the OutboundTransfer: processing, failed, canceled, posted, returned. An OutboundTransfer is processing if it has been created and is pending. The status changes to posted once the OutboundTransfer has been "confirmed" and funds have left the account, or to failed or canceled. If an OutboundTransfer fails to arrive at its destination, its status will change to returned. One of: canceled, failed, posted, processing, or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.TransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the Transaction) The Transaction associated with this object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransfer.Transaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) The Transaction associated with this object.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetails.Type
member.summary: The type of the payment method used in the OutboundTransfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Email
member.summary: Email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Name
member.summary: Full name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.AccountHolderType
member.summary: Account holder type: individual or company. One of: company, or individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.AccountType
member.summary: Account type: checkings or savings. Defaults to checking if omitted. One of: checking, or savings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.BankName
member.summary: Name of the bank associated with the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Fingerprint
member.summary: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Last4
member.summary: Last four digits of the bank account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Network
member.summary: The US bank account network used to send funds. One of: ach, or us_domestic_wire.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferDestinationPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.RoutingNumber
member.summary: Routing number of the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.OutboundTransferReturnedDetails.Code
member.summary: Reason for the return. One of: account_closed, account_frozen, bank_account_restricted, bank_ownership_changed, declined, incorrect_account_holder_name, invalid_account_number, invalid_currency, no_account, or other.

member.summary: Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to canceled.

member.summary: Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to failed.

member.summary: Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to posted.
