member.name: T:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit
member.summary: ReceivedCredits represent funds sent to a FinancialAccount (for example, via ACH or wire). These money movements are not initiated from the FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Amount
member.summary: Amount (in cents) transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.FailureCode
member.summary: Reason for the failure. A ReceivedCredit might fail because the receiving FinancialAccount is closed or frozen. One of: account_closed, account_frozen, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.FinancialAccount
member.summary: The FinancialAccount that received the funds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.HostedRegulatoryReceiptUrl
member.summary: A hosted transaction receipt URL that is provided when money movement is considered regulated under Stripe's money transmission licenses.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Network
member.summary: The rails used to send the funds. One of: ach, card, stripe, or us_domestic_wire.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.ReversalDetails
member.summary: Details describing when a ReceivedCredit may be reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Status
member.summary: Status of the ReceivedCredit. ReceivedCredits are created either succeeded (approved) or failed (declined). If a ReceivedCredit is declined, the failure reason can be found in the failure_code field. One of: failed, or succeeded.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.TransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the Transaction) The Transaction associated with this object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCredit.Transaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) The Transaction associated with this object.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetails.Balance
member.summary: Set when type is balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetails.IssuingCard
member.summary: Set when type is issuing_card. This is an Issuing Card ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetails.Type
member.summary: Polymorphic type matching the originating money movement's source. This can be an external account, a Stripe balance, or a FinancialAccount. One of: balance, financial_account, issuing_card, stripe, or us_bank_account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Email
member.summary: Email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsBillingDetails.Name
member.summary: Full name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsFinancialAccount.Id
member.summary: The FinancialAccount ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsFinancialAccount.Network
member.summary: The rails the ReceivedCredit was sent over. A FinancialAccount can only send funds over stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.BankName
member.summary: Bank name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.Last4
member.summary: The last four digits of the bank account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditInitiatingPaymentMethodDetailsUsBankAccount.RoutingNumber
member.summary: The routing number for the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlows.CreditReversal
member.summary: The CreditReversal created as a result of this ReceivedCredit being reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlows.IssuingAuthorization
member.summary: Set if the ReceivedCredit was created due to an Issuing Authorization object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlows.IssuingTransaction
member.summary: Set if the ReceivedCredit is also viewable as an Issuing transaction object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlows.SourceFlow
member.summary: ID of the source flow. Set if network is stripe and the source flow is visible to the user. Examples of source flows include OutboundPayments, payouts, or CreditReversals.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlows.SourceFlowDetails
member.summary: The expandable object of the source flow.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlows.SourceFlowType
member.summary: The type of flow that originated the ReceivedCredit (for example, outbound_payment).

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlowsSourceFlowDetails.CreditReversal
member.summary: You can reverse some ReceivedCredits depending on their network and source flow. Reversing a ReceivedCredit leads to the creation of a new object known as a CreditReversal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlowsSourceFlowDetails.OutboundPayment
member.summary:
Use OutboundPayments to send funds to another party's external bank account or FinancialAccount. To send money to an account belonging to the same user, use an OutboundTransfer.
Simulate OutboundPayment state changes with the /v1/test_helpers/treasury/outbound_payments endpoints. These methods can only be called on test mode objects.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlowsSourceFlowDetails.Payout
member.summary:
A Payout object is created when you receive funds from Stripe, or when you initiate a payout to either a bank account or debit card of a connected Stripe account. You can retrieve individual payouts, as well as list all payouts. Payouts are made on varying schedules, depending on your country and industry.
Related guide: Receiving Payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditLinkedFlowsSourceFlowDetails.Type
member.summary: The type of the source flow that originated the ReceivedCredit. One of: credit_reversal, other, outbound_payment, or payout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditReversalDetails.Deadline
member.summary: Time before which a ReceivedCredit can be reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedCreditReversalDetails.RestrictedReason
member.summary: Set if a ReceivedCredit cannot be reversed. One of: already_reversed, deadline_passed, network_restricted, other, or source_flow_restricted.

member.summary: The network used for the ReceivedDebit. One of: ach, card, or stripe.

member.summary: Details describing when a ReceivedDebit might be reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.ReceivedDebit.Status
member.summary: Status of the ReceivedDebit. ReceivedDebits are created with a status of either succeeded (approved) or failed (declined). The failure reason can be found under the failure_code. One of: failed, or succeeded.

member.name: T:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry
member.summary: TransactionEntries represent individual units of money movements within a single Transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.BalanceImpact
member.summary: Change to a FinancialAccount's balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.EffectiveAt
member.summary: When the TransactionEntry will impact the FinancialAccount's balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.FinancialAccount
member.summary: The FinancialAccount associated with this object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Flow
member.summary: Token of the flow associated with the TransactionEntry.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.FlowDetails
member.summary: Details of the flow associated with the TransactionEntry.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.FlowType
member.summary: Type of the flow associated with the TransactionEntry. One of: credit_reversal, debit_reversal, inbound_transfer, issuing_authorization, other, outbound_payment, outbound_transfer, received_credit, or received_debit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntry.Type
member.summary: The specific money movement that generated the TransactionEntry. One of: credit_reversal, credit_reversal_posting, debit_reversal, inbound_transfer, inbound_transfer_return, issuing_authorization_hold, issuing_authorization_release, other, outbound_payment, outbound_payment_cancellation, outbound_payment_failure, outbound_payment_posting, outbound_payment_return, outbound_transfer, outbound_transfer_cancellation, outbound_transfer_failure, outbound_transfer_posting, outbound_transfer_return, received_credit, or received_debit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryBalanceImpact.Cash
member.summary: The change made to funds the user can spend right now.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryBalanceImpact.InboundPending
member.summary: The change made to funds that are not spendable yet, but will become available at a later time.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryBalanceImpact.OutboundPending
member.summary: The change made to funds in the account, but not spendable because they are being held for pending outbound flows.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.CreditReversal
member.summary: You can reverse some ReceivedCredits depending on their network and source flow. Reversing a ReceivedCredit leads to the creation of a new object known as a CreditReversal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.DebitReversal
member.summary: You can reverse some ReceivedDebits depending on their network and source flow. Reversing a ReceivedDebit leads to the creation of a new object known as a DebitReversal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.InboundTransfer
member.summary: Use InboundTransfers to add funds to your FinancialAccount via a PaymentMethod that is owned by you. The funds will be transferred via an ACH debit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.IssuingAuthorization
member.summary:
When an issued card is used to make a purchase, an Issuing Authorization object is created. Authorizations must be approved for the purchase to be completed successfully.
Related guide: Issued Card Authorizations.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.OutboundPayment
member.summary:
Use OutboundPayments to send funds to another party's external bank account or FinancialAccount. To send money to an account belonging to the same user, use an OutboundTransfer.
Simulate OutboundPayment state changes with the /v1/test_helpers/treasury/outbound_payments endpoints. These methods can only be called on test mode objects.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.OutboundTransfer
member.summary:
Use OutboundTransfers to transfer funds from a FinancialAccount to a PaymentMethod belonging to the same entity. To send funds to a different party, use OutboundPayments instead. You can send funds over ACH rails or through a domestic wire transfer to a user's own external bank account.
Simulate OutboundTransfer state changes with the /v1/test_helpers/treasury/outbound_transfers endpoints. These methods can only be called on test mode objects.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.ReceivedCredit
member.summary: ReceivedCredits represent funds sent to a FinancialAccount (for example, via ACH or wire). These money movements are not initiated from the FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.ReceivedDebit
member.summary: ReceivedDebits represent funds pulled from a FinancialAccount. These are not initiated from the FinancialAccount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Treasury.TransactionEntryFlowDetails.Type
member.summary: Type of the flow that created the Transaction. Set to the same value as flow_type. One of: credit_reversal, debit_reversal, inbound_transfer, issuing_authorization, other, outbound_payment, outbound_transfer, received_credit, or received_debit.

member.name: T:Stripe.UsageRecord
member.summary:
Usage records allow you to report customer usage and metrics to Stripe for metered billing of subscription prices.
Related guide: Metered Billing.

member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: T:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint
member.summary:
You can configure webhook endpoints via the API to be notified about events that happen in your Stripe account or connected accounts.
Most users configure webhooks from the dashboard, which provides a user interface for registering and testing your webhook endpoints.
Related guide: Setting up Webhooks.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.summary: The API version events are rendered as for this webhook endpoint.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Application
member.summary: The ID of the associated Connect application.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Description
member.summary: An optional description of what the webhook is used for.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.EnabledEvents
member.summary: The list of events to enable for this endpoint. ['*'] indicates that all events are enabled, except those that require explicit selection.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.WebhookEndpoint.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.summary: The endpoint's secret, used to generate webhook signatures. Only returned at creation.

member.remarks: This code is largely borrowed from the System.Linq.Async project (see https://github.com/dotnet/reactive/blob/7ad606b3dcd4bb2c6ae9622f8a59db7f8f52aa85/Ix.NET/Source/System.Linq.Async/System/Linq/Operators/ToEnumerable.cs). The reason we're not using System.Linq.Async directly is that it can cause issues with some versions of EF Core (see https://github.com/stripe/stripe-dotnet/issues/1974).

member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given instance.

The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsOptions(Stripe.INestedOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given options class. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the options class contains a parameter `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The options class for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsDictionary(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given dictionary. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the dictionary contains a key `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The dictionary for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsList(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given list of objects. The parameter keys will be indexed under the `keyPrefix` parameter. E.g. if the `keyPrefix` is `foo`, then the key for the first element's will be `foo[0]`, etc.
member.param: The list for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.SingleParam(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a list containing a single parameter.
member.returns: A list containg the single parameter.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.NewPrefix(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Computes the new key prefix, given a key and an existing prefix (if any). E.g. if the key is `bar` and the existing prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar]` is returned. If a key already contains nested values, then only the non-nested part is nested under the prefix, e.g. if the key is `bar[baz]` and the prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar][baz]` is returned. If no prefix is provided, the key is returned unchanged.
member.param: The existing key prefix, if any.
member.returns: The new key prefix.

member.name: T:Stripe.Infrastructure.StripeObjectConverter
member.summary: This converter can be used to deserialize any Stripe object. It is mainly useful for polymorphic attributes, when the property's type is an interface instead of a concrete type. In this case, the converter will use the value of the `object` key in the JSON payload to decide which concrete type to instantiate. If no concrete type is found (or if one is found, but it's not compatible with the expected interface), then the converter returns `null`.

If you do change these settings, make sure that is among the converters, otherwise Stripe.net will no longer be able to deserialize polymorphic resources represented by interfaces (e.g. ).

Converts this response into a regular by reading the body in full.

member.name: F:Stripe.StripeTypeRegistry.ObjectsToTypes

member.name: T:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient
member.summary: Standard client to make requests to Stripe's API, using to send HTTP requests. It can gather telemetry about request latency (via ) and automatically retry failed requests when it's safe to do so.

member.name: F:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.DefaultMaxNumberRetries
member.summary: Default maximum number of retries made by the client.

member.name: M:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Int32,Stripe.AppInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The client to use. If null, an HTTP client will be created with default parameters.
The maximum number of times the client will retry requests that fail due to an intermittent problem.
Information about the "app" which this integration belongs to. This should be reserved for plugins that wish to identify themselves with Stripe.
Whether to enable request latency telemetry or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.DefaultHttpTimeout
member.summary: Default timespan before the request times out.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MaxNetworkRetriesDelay
member.summary: Maximum sleep time between tries to send HTTP requests after network failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MinNetworkRetriesDelay
member.summary: Minimum sleep time between tries to send HTTP requests after network failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.EnableTelemetry
member.summary: Gets whether telemetry was enabled for this client.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MaxNetworkRetries
member.summary: Gets how many network retries were configured for this client.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.NetworkRetriesSleep
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the client should sleep between automatic request retries.
member.remarks: This is an internal property meant to be used in tests only.

member.name: M:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.BuildDefaultSystemNetHttpClient
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default parameters.

member.summary: Sends a request to Stripe's API as an asynchronous operation.
member.param: The parameters of the request to send.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.Account
member.summary: The identifier of the account to create an account link for.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.Collect
member.summary: Which information the platform needs to collect from the user. One of currently_due or eventually_due. Default is currently_due. One of: currently_due, or eventually_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.RefreshUrl
member.summary: The URL the user will be redirected to if the account link is expired, has been previously-visited, or is otherwise invalid. The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new account link with the same parameters used to create the original account link, then redirect the user to the new account link's URL so they can continue with Connect Onboarding. If a new account link cannot be generated or the redirect fails you should display a useful error to the user.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon leaving or completing the linked flow.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of account link the user is requesting. Possible values are account_onboarding or account_update. One of: account_onboarding, account_update, custom_account_update, or custom_account_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.AccountHolderName
member.summary: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.This field is required when attaching the bank account to a Customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.AccountHolderType
member.summary: The type of entity that holds the account. It can be company or individual. This field is required when attaching the bank account to a Customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.AccountNumber
member.summary: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a checking account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.Country
member.summary: The country in which the bank account is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.Currency
member.summary: The currency the bank account is in. This must be a country/currency pairing that Stripe supports..

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.RoutingNumber
member.summary: The routing number, sort code, or other country-appropriateinstitution number for the bank account. For US bank accounts, this is required and should bethe ACH routing number, not the wire routing number. If you are providing an IBAN foraccount_number, this field is not required.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.Mcc
member.summary: The merchant category code for the account. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.Name
member.summary: The customer-facing business name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: Internal-only description of the product sold by, or service provided by, the business. Used by Stripe for risk and underwriting purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportAddress
member.summary: A publicly available mailing address for sending support issues to.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportEmail
member.summary: A publicly available email address for sending support issues to.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportPhone
member.summary: A publicly available phone number to call with support issues.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportUrl
member.summary: A publicly available website for handling support issues.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.Url
member.summary: The business's publicly available website.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCardOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Address
member.summary: The company's primary address.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.DirectorsProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's directors with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.director requirement. This value is not automatically set to true after creating directors, so it needs to be updated to indicate all directors have been provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.ExecutivesProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's executives with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.executive requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Name
member.summary: The company's legal name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.NameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.NameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.OwnersProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's owners with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.owner requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.OwnershipDeclaration
member.summary: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Phone
member.summary: The company's phone number (used for verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.RegistrationNumber
member.summary: The identification number given to a company when it is registered or incorporated, if distinct from the identification number used for filing taxes. (Examples are the CIN for companies and LLP IN for partnerships in India, and the Company Registration Number in Hong Kong).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Structure
member.summary: The category identifying the legal structure of the company or legal entity. See Business structure for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.TaxId
member.summary: The business ID number of the company, as appropriate for the companyâ€™s country. (Examples are an Employer ID Number in the U.S., a Business Number in Canada, or a Company Number in the UK.).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.TaxIdRegistrar
member.summary: The jurisdiction in which the tax_id is registered (Germany-based companies only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.VatId
member.summary: The VAT number of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Verification
member.summary: Information on the verification state of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOwnershipDeclarationOptions.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOwnershipDeclarationOptions.Ip
member.summary: The IP address from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOwnershipDeclarationOptions.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: A document verifying the business.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.AccountToken
member.summary: An account token, used to securely provide details to the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.BusinessProfile
member.summary: Business information about the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Capabilities
member.summary: Each key of the dictionary represents a capability, and each capability maps to its settings (e.g. whether it has been requested or not). Each capability will be inactive until you have provided its specific requirements and Stripe has verified them. An account may have some of its requested capabilities be active and some be inactive.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Company
member.summary: Information about the company or business. This field is available for any business_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Country
member.summary: The country in which the account holder resides, or in which the business is legally established. This should be an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. For example, if you are in the United States and the business for which you're creating an account is legally represented in Canada, you would use CA as the country for the account being created. Available countries include Stripe's global markets as well as countries where cross-border payouts are supported.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that Stripe supports in the account's country.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Documents
member.summary: Documents that may be submitted to satisfy various informational requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the account holder. This is only to make the account easier to identify to you. Stripe only emails Custom accounts with your consent.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person represented by the account. This field is null unless business_type is set to individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Settings
member.summary: Options for customizing how the account functions within Stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.TosAcceptance
member.summary: Details on the account's acceptance of the Stripe Services Agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of Stripe account to create. May be one of custom, express or standard. One of: custom, express, or standard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsBankAccountOwnershipVerificationOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyLicenseOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyMemorandumOfAssociationOptions.Files

member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.BankAccountOwnershipVerification
member.summary: One or more documents that support the Bank account ownership verification requirement. Must be a document associated with the accountâ€™s primary active bank account that displays the last 4 digits of the account number, either a statement or a voided check.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyLicense
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company's license to operate.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyMemorandumOfAssociation
member.summary: One or more documents showing the company's Memorandum of Association.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyMinisterialDecree
member.summary: (Certain countries only) One or more documents showing the ministerial decree legalizing the company's establishment.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyRegistrationVerification
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company's registration with the appropriate local authorities.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyTaxIdVerification
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company's tax ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.ProofOfRegistration
member.summary: One or more documents showing the companyâ€™s proof of registration with the national business registry.

member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.summary: The Kana variation of the the individual's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.AddressKanji

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.IdNumberSecondary

In Thailand, this would be the laser code found on the back of an ID card. Instead of the number itself, you can also provide a PII token created with Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Phone

member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationOptions.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRejectOptions.Reason
member.summary: The reason for rejecting the account. Can be fraud, terms_of_service, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.Icon
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) An icon for the account. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.Logo
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) A logo for the account that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the account's name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.PrimaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.SecondaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the secondary branding color for this account.

member.summary: Details on the account's acceptance of the Stripe Issuing Terms and Disclosures.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardIssuingTosAcceptanceOptions.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.summary: The IP address from which the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardIssuingTosAcceptanceOptions.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsDeclineOnOptions.AvsFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsDeclineOnOptions.CvcFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsOptions.DeclineOn
member.summary: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorPrefix
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorPrefixKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only). This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix_kana specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix_kana is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorPrefixKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only). This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix_kanji specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix_kanji is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Branding
member.summary: Settings used to apply the account's branding to email receipts, invoices, Checkout, and other products.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.CardIssuing

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.CardPayments
member.summary: Settings specific to card charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Payments
member.summary: Settings that apply across payment methods for charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Payouts
member.summary: Settings specific to the account's payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Treasury
member.summary: Settings specific to the account's Treasury FinancialAccounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsOptions.DebitNegativeBalances
member.summary: A Boolean indicating whether Stripe should try to reclaim negative balances from an attached bank account. For details, see Understanding Connect Account Balances.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsOptions.Schedule
member.summary: Details on when funds from charges are available, and when they are paid out to an external account. For details, see our Setting Bank and Debit Card Payouts documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The text that appears on the bank account statement for payouts. If not set, this defaults to the platform's bank descriptor as set in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.DelayDays
member.summary: temp.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.Interval
member.summary: How frequently available funds are paid out. One of: daily, manual, weekly, or monthly. Default is daily. One of: daily, manual, monthly, or weekly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.MonthlyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the month when available funds are paid out, specified as a number between 1--31. Payouts nominally scheduled between the 29th and 31st of the month are instead sent on the last day of a shorter month. Required and applicable only if interval is monthly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.WeeklyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the week when available funds are paid out, specified as monday, tuesday, etc. (required and applicable only if interval is weekly.). One of: friday, monday, saturday, sunday, thursday, tuesday, or wednesday.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsTreasuryOptions.TosAcceptance

member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the account representative accepted the service agreement.

member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the account representative accepted their service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.AccountToken
member.summary: An account token, used to securely provide details to the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.BusinessProfile
member.summary: Business information about the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Capabilities
member.summary: Each key of the dictionary represents a capability, and each capability maps to its settings (e.g. whether it has been requested or not). Each capability will be inactive until you have provided its specific requirements and Stripe has verified them. An account may have some of its requested capabilities be active and some be inactive.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Company
member.summary: Information about the company or business. This field is available for any business_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that Stripe supports in the account's country.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Documents
member.summary: Documents that may be submitted to satisfy various informational requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the account holder. This is only to make the account easier to identify to you. Stripe only emails Custom accounts with your consent.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person represented by the account. This field is null unless business_type is set to individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Settings
member.summary: Options for customizing how the account functions within Stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.TosAcceptance
member.summary: Details on the account's acceptance of the Stripe Services Agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.ApplicationFeeRefundCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer, in cents (or local equivalent), representing how much of this fee to refund. Can refund only up to the remaining unrefunded amount of the fee.

member.name: P:Stripe.ApplicationFeeRefundCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.ApplicationFeeRefundUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.AccountHolderName
member.summary: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.AccountHolderType
member.summary: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either individual or company.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.AccountType
member.summary: The bank account type. This can only be checking or savings in most countries. In Japan, this can only be futsu or toza. One of: checking, futsu, savings, or toza.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountVerifyOptions.Amounts
member.summary: Two positive integers, in cents, equal to the values of the microdeposits sent to the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityUpdateOptions.Requested
member.summary: Passing true requests the capability for the account, if it is not already requested. A requested capability may not immediately become active. Any requirements to activate the capability are returned in the requirements arrays.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AccountType
member.summary: The bank account type. This can only be checking or savings in most countries. In Japan, this can only be futsu or toza. One of: checking, futsu, savings, or toza.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressCity
member.summary: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressCountry
member.summary: Billing address country, if provided when creating card.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressLine1

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressLine2
member.summary: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressState
member.summary: State/County/Province/Region.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressZip
member.summary: ZIP or postal code.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.Name
member.summary: Cardholder name.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalanceSettingsOptions.ReconciliationMode
member.summary: Controls how funds transferred by the customer are applied to payment intents and invoices. Valid options are automatic or manual. For more information about these reconciliation modes, see Reconciliation. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.CashBalanceUpdateOptions.Settings
member.summary: A hash of settings for this cash balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to capture, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: An application fee to add on to this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: An application fee amount to add on to this charge, which must be less than or equal to the original amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to send this charge's receipt to. This will override the previously-specified email address for this charge, if one was set. Receipts will not be sent in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For card charges, use statement_descriptor_suffix instead. Otherwise, you can use this value as the complete description of a charge on your customersâ€™ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.TransferData
member.summary: An optional dictionary including the account to automatically transfer to as part of a destination charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. transfer_group may only be provided if it has not been set. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents (or local equivalent) that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Capture
member.summary: Whether to immediately capture the charge. Defaults to true. When false, the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization), and will need to be captured later. Uncaptured charges expire after a set number of days (7 by default). For more information, see the authorizing charges and settling later documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a Charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended. Automatically set if you use the destination parameter. For details, see Creating Separate Charges and Transfers.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.RadarOptions
member.summary: Options to configure Radar. See Radar Session for more information.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to which this charge's receipt will be sent. The receipt will not be sent until the charge is paid, and no receipts will be sent for test mode charges. If this charge is for a Customer, the email address specified here will override the customer's email address. If receipt_email is specified for a charge in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For card charges, use statement_descriptor_suffix instead. Otherwise, you can use this value as the complete description of a charge on your customersâ€™ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: An optional dictionary including the account to automatically transfer to as part of a destination charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. For details, see Grouping transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationOptions.Account
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to transfer to the destination account without creating an Application Fee object. Cannot be combined with the application_fee parameter. Must be less than or equal to the charge amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetailsOptions.UserReport
member.summary: Either safe or fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeRadarOptionsOptions.Session
member.summary: A Radar Session is a snapshot of the browser metadata and device details that help Radar make more accurate predictions on your payments.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Address
member.summary: Shipping address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Carrier
member.summary: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Name
member.summary: Recipient name.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Phone
member.summary: Recipient phone (including extension).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.TrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount transferred to the destination account, if specified. By default, the entire charge amount is transferred to the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be associated with this request. This field may only be updated if there is no existing associated customer with this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.FraudDetails
member.summary: A set of key-value pairs you can attach to a charge giving information about its riskiness. If you believe a charge is fraudulent, include a user_report key with a value of fraudulent. If you believe a charge is safe, include a user_report key with a value of safe. Stripe will use the information you send to improve our fraud detection algorithms.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge will be sent to. If this field is updated, then a new email receipt will be sent to the updated address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. transfer_group may only be provided if it has not been set. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponAppliesToOptions.Products
member.summary: An array of Product IDs that this Coupon will apply to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.AmountOff
member.summary: A positive integer representing the amount to subtract from an invoice total (required if percent_off is not passed).

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.AppliesTo
member.summary: A hash containing directions for what this Coupon will apply discounts to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for the currency of the amount_off parameter (required if amount_off is passed).

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Coupons defined in each available currency option (only supported if amount_off is passed). Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Duration
member.summary: Specifies how long the discount will be in effect if used on a subscription. Defaults to once. One of: forever, once, or repeating.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.DurationInMonths
member.summary: Required only if duration is repeating, in which case it must be a positive integer that specifies the number of months the discount will be in effect.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: Unique string of your choice that will be used to identify this coupon when applying it to a customer. If you don't want to specify a particular code, you can leave the ID blank and we'll generate a random code for you.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.MaxRedemptions
member.summary: A positive integer specifying the number of times the coupon can be redeemed before it's no longer valid. For example, you might have a 50% off coupon that the first 20 readers of your blog can use.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Name
member.summary: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on, for instance invoices, or receipts. By default the id is shown if name is not set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.PercentOff
member.summary: A positive float larger than 0, and smaller or equal to 100, that represents the discount the coupon will apply (required if amount_off is not passed).

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.RedeemBy
member.summary: Unix timestamp specifying the last time at which the coupon can be redeemed. After the redeem_by date, the coupon can no longer be applied to new customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCurrencyOptionsOptions.AmountOff
member.summary: A positive integer representing the amount to subtract from an invoice total.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponUpdateOptions.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Coupons defined in each available currency option (only supported if the coupon is amount-based). Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponUpdateOptions.Name
member.summary: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on, for instance invoices, or receipts. By default the id is shown if name is not set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the total amount of the credit note.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.CreditAmount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the amount to credit the customer's balance, which will be automatically applied to their next invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Invoice
member.summary: ID of the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Lines
member.summary: Line items that make up the credit note.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Memo
member.summary: The credit note's memo appears on the credit note PDF.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.OutOfBandAmount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the amount that is credited outside of Stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Reason
member.summary: Reason for issuing this credit note, one of duplicate, fraudulent, order_change, or product_unsatisfactory. One of: duplicate, fraudulent, order_change, or product_unsatisfactory.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Refund
member.summary: ID of an existing refund to link this credit note to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.RefundAmount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the amount to refund. If set, a refund will be created for the charge associated with the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.Amount
member.summary: The line item amount to credit. Only valid when type is invoice_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.Description
member.summary: The description of the credit note line item. Only valid when the type is custom_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.InvoiceLineItem
member.summary: The invoice line item to credit. Only valid when the type is invoice_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The line item quantity to credit.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the credit note line item. Only valid when the type is custom_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.Type
member.summary: Type of the credit note line item, one of invoice_line_item or custom_line_item. One of: custom_line_item, or invoice_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in cents (or local equivalent) of the credit note line item. This unit_amount will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount to credit for this line item. Only valid when type is custom_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.AccessActivityLog
member.summary: Any server or activity logs showing proof that the customer accessed or downloaded the purchased digital product. This information should include IP addresses, corresponding timestamps, and any detailed recorded activity. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.BillingAddress
member.summary: The billing address provided by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CancellationPolicy
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Your subscription cancellation policy, as shown to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CancellationPolicyDisclosure
member.summary: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CancellationRebuttal
member.summary: A justification for why the customer's subscription was not canceled. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerCommunication
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Any communication with the customer that you feel is relevant to your case. Examples include emails proving that the customer received the product or service, or demonstrating their use of or satisfaction with the product or service.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerEmailAddress
member.summary: The email address of the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerName
member.summary: The name of the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerPurchaseIp
member.summary: The IP address that the customer used when making the purchase.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerSignature
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) A relevant document or contract showing the customer's signature.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.DuplicateChargeDocumentation
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Documentation for the prior charge that can uniquely identify the charge, such as a receipt, shipping label, work order, etc. This document should be paired with a similar document from the disputed payment that proves the two payments are separate.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.DuplicateChargeExplanation
member.summary: An explanation of the difference between the disputed charge versus the prior charge that appears to be a duplicate. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.DuplicateChargeId
member.summary: The Stripe ID for the prior charge which appears to be a duplicate of the disputed charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: A description of the product or service that was sold. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.Receipt
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Any receipt or message sent to the customer notifying them of the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.RefundPolicy
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Your refund policy, as shown to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.RefundPolicyDisclosure
member.summary: Documentation demonstrating that the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.RefundRefusalExplanation
member.summary: A justification for why the customer is not entitled to a refund. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ServiceDate
member.summary: The date on which the customer received or began receiving the purchased service, in a clear human-readable format.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ServiceDocumentation
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the customer. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order, or other form of written agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingAddress
member.summary: The address to which a physical product was shipped. You should try to include as complete address information as possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingCarrier
member.summary: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc. If multiple carriers were used for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingDate
member.summary: The date on which a physical product began its route to the shipping address, in a clear human-readable format.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingDocumentation
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a product was shipped to the customer at the same address the customer provided to you. This could include a copy of the shipment receipt, shipping label, etc. It should show the customer's full shipping address, if possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingTrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.UncategorizedFile
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Any additional evidence or statements.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.UncategorizedText
member.summary: Any additional evidence or statements. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Evidence
member.summary: Evidence to upload, to respond to a dispute. Updating any field in the hash will submit all fields in the hash for review. The combined character count of all fields is limited to 150,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Submit
member.summary: Whether to immediately submit evidence to the bank. If false, evidence is staged on the dispute. Staged evidence is visible in the API and Dashboard, and can be submitted to the bank by making another request with this attribute set to true (the default).

member.name: P:Stripe.EphemeralKeyCreateOptions.Customer

member.name: P:Stripe.EphemeralKeyCreateOptions.IssuingCard
member.summary: The ID of the Issuing Card you'd like to access using the resulting ephemeral key.

member.name: T:Stripe.EventUtility
member.summary: This class contains utility methods to process event objects in Stripe's webhooks.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ParseEvent(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.
member.remarks: This method doesn't verify webhook signatures. It's recommended that you use instead.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ConstructEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object, while verifying the webhook's signature.
member.param: The value of the Stripe-Signature header from the webhook request.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the signature verification fails for any reason, of if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ConstructEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object, while verifying the webhook's signature.
member.param: The value of the Stripe-Signature header from the webhook request.
The timestamp to use for the current time.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the signature verification fails for any reason, of if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.
