member.name: P:Stripe.FileFileLinkDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. Passing in a negative amount will reduce the amount_due on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer who will be billed when this invoice item is billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to the invoice item. The description is displayed in the invoice for easy tracking.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Discountable
member.summary: Controls whether discounts apply to this invoice item. Defaults to false for prorations or negative invoice items, and true for all other invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupons to redeem into discounts for the invoice item or invoice line item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Invoice
member.summary: The ID of an existing invoice to add this invoice item to. When left blank, the invoice item will be added to the next upcoming scheduled invoice. This is useful when adding invoice items in response to an invoice.created webhook. You can only add invoice items to draft invoices and there is a maximum of 250 items per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Period
member.summary: The period associated with this invoice item. When set to different values, the period will be rendered on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Non-negative integer. The quantity of units for the invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The ID of a subscription to add this invoice item to. When left blank, the invoice item will be be added to the next upcoming scheduled invoice. When set, scheduled invoices for subscriptions other than the specified subscription will ignore the invoice item. Use this when you want to express that an invoice item has been accrued within the context of a particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.TaxCode
member.summary: A tax code ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the invoice item. When set, the default_tax_rates on the invoice do not apply to this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in cents (or local equivalent) of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. This unit_amount will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount. Passing in a negative unit_amount will reduce the amount_due on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemDiscountOptions.Coupon
member.summary: ID of the coupon to create a new discount for.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemDiscountOptions.Discount
member.summary: ID of an existing discount on the object (or one of its ancestors) to reuse.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPeriodOptions.End
member.summary: The end of the period, which must be greater than or equal to the start.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPeriodOptions.Start
member.summary: The start of the period.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. If you want to apply a credit to the customer's account, pass a negative amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to the invoice item. The description is displayed in the invoice for easy tracking.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Discountable
member.summary: Controls whether discounts apply to this invoice item. Defaults to false for prorations or negative invoice items, and true for all other invoice items. Cannot be set to true for prorations.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupons & existing discounts which apply to the invoice item or invoice line item. Item discounts are applied before invoice discounts. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Period
member.summary: The period associated with this invoice item. When set to different values, the period will be rendered on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Non-negative integer. The quantity of units for the invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.TaxCode
member.summary: A tax code ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the invoice item. When set, the default_tax_rates on the invoice do not apply to this invoice item. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in cents (or local equivalent) of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. This unit_amount will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount. If you want to apply a credit to the customer's account, pass a negative unit_amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceAutomaticTaxOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this invoice. Note that incompatible invoice items (invoice items with manually specified tax rates, negative amounts, or tax_behavior=unspecified) cannot be added to automatic tax invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.AccountTaxIds
member.summary: The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents (or local equivalent) that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice. When false, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Settings for automatic tax lookup for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: The currency to create this invoice in. Defaults to that of customer if not specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.CustomFields
member.summary: A list of up to 4 custom fields to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer who will be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from when the invoice is created until it is due. Valid only for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any line item that does not have tax_rates set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupons to redeem into discounts for the invoice. If not specified, inherits the discount from the invoice's customer. Pass an empty string to avoid inheriting any discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. Valid only for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Footer
member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.FromInvoice
member.summary: Revise an existing invoice. The new invoice will be created in status=draft. See the revision documentation for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account (if any) for which the funds of the invoice payment are intended. If set, the invoice will be presented with the branding and support information of the specified account. See the Invoices with Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.PaymentSettings
member.summary: Configuration settings for the PaymentIntent that is generated when the invoice is finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.PendingInvoiceItemsBehavior
member.summary: How to handle pending invoice items on invoice creation. One of include or exclude. include will include any pending invoice items, and will create an empty draft invoice if no pending invoice items exist. exclude will always create an empty invoice draft regardless if there are pending invoice items or not. Defaults to exclude if the parameter is omitted. One of: exclude, include, or include_and_require.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.RenderingOptions
member.summary: Options for invoice PDF rendering.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge for the customer's credit card statement. It must contain at least one letter. If not specified and this invoice is part of a subscription, the default statement_descriptor will be set to the first subscription item's product's statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The ID of the subscription to invoice, if any. If set, the created invoice will only include pending invoice items for that subscription and pending invoice items not associated with any subscription if pending_invoice_items_behavior is include. The subscription's billing cycle and regular subscription events won't be affected.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the invoice will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfer will be found on the invoice's charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomerDetailsOptions.Address
member.summary: The customer's address.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomerDetailsOptions.Shipping
member.summary: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomerDetailsOptions.Tax
member.summary: Tax details about the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomerDetailsOptions.TaxExempt

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsOptions.DefaultMandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this invoice. It must correspond to the payment method used to pay the invoice, including the invoice's default_payment_method or default_source, if set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration to provide to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) to provide to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent. If not set, Stripe attempts to automatically determine the types to use by looking at the invoiceâ€™s default payment method, the subscriptionâ€™s default payment method, the customerâ€™s default payment method, and your invoice template settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptionsOptions.TransactionType
member.summary: Transaction type of the mandate. One of: business, or personal.

member.summary: Additional fields for Mandate creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Verification method for the intent. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsBancontactOptions.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to. One of: de, en, fr, or nl.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Setting to true enables installments for this invoice. Setting to false will prevent any selected plan from applying to a payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsOptions.Plan
member.summary: The selected installment plan to use for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Count
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the number of installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Interval
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the interval between installment payments your customer will make to their credit card. One of month.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Type
member.summary: Type of installment plan, one of fixed_count.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Installments
member.summary:
Installment configuration for payments attempted on this invoice (Mexico Only).
For more information, see the installments integration guide.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferEuBankTransferOptions.Country
member.summary: The desired country code of the bank account information. Permitted values include: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferOptions.EuBankTransfer
member.summary: Configuration for eu_bank_transfer funding type.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferOptions.Type
member.summary: The bank transfer type that can be used for funding. Permitted values include: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.BankTransfer
member.summary: Configuration for the bank transfer funding type, if the funding_type is set to bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.FundingType
member.summary: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Permitted values include: bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.AcssDebit
member.summary: If paying by acss_debit, this sub-hash contains details about the Canadian pre-authorized debit payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Bancontact
member.summary: If paying by bancontact, this sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Card

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.CustomerBalance

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Konbini
member.summary: If paying by konbini, this sub-hash contains details about the Konbini payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.UsBankAccount

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountFinancialConnectionsOptions.Permissions
member.summary: The list of permissions to request. If this parameter is passed, the payment_method permission must be included. Valid permissions include: balances, ownership, payment_method, and transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountOptions.FinancialConnections
member.summary: Additional fields for Financial Connections Session creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountOptions.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Verification method for the intent. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.Forgive
member.summary:
In cases where the source used to pay the invoice has insufficient funds, passing forgive=true controls whether a charge should be attempted for the full amount available on the source, up to the amount to fully pay the invoice. This effectively forgives the difference between the amount available on the source and the amount due.
Passing forgive=false will fail the charge if the source hasn't been pre-funded with the right amount. An example for this case is with ACH Credit Transfers and wires: if the amount wired is less than the amount due by a small amount, you might want to forgive the difference. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.Mandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this invoice. It must correspond to the payment method used to pay the invoice, including the payment_method param or the invoice's default_payment_method or default_source, if set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Indicates if a customer is on or off-session while an invoice payment is attempted. Defaults to true (off-session).

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.PaidOutOfBand
member.summary: Boolean representing whether an invoice is paid outside of Stripe. This will result in no charge being made. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: A PaymentMethod to be charged. The PaymentMethod must be the ID of a PaymentMethod belonging to the customer associated with the invoice being paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.Source
member.summary: A payment source to be charged. The source must be the ID of a source belonging to the customer associated with the invoice being paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceRenderingOptionsOptions.AmountTaxDisplay
member.summary: How line-item prices and amounts will be displayed with respect to tax on invoice PDFs. One of exclude_tax or include_inclusive_tax. include_inclusive_tax will include inclusive tax (and exclude exclusive tax) in invoice PDF amounts. exclude_tax will exclude all tax (inclusive and exclusive alike) from invoice PDF amounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemBillingThresholdsOptions.UsageGte
member.summary: Usage threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.ClearUsage
member.summary: Delete all usage for a given subscription item. Allowed only when deleted is set to true and the current plan's usage_type is metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Deleted
member.summary: A flag that, if set to true, will delete the specified item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Id
member.summary: Subscription item to update.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object. When changing a subscription item's price, quantity is set to 1 unless a quantity parameter is provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: A list of Tax Rate ids. These Tax Rates will override the default_tax_rates on the Subscription. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and interval_count.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will be transferred automatically when the invoice is paid. If no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.AccountTaxIds
member.summary: The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents (or local equivalent) that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Settings for automatic tax lookup for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically or send_invoice. This field can be updated only on draft invoices. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.CustomFields
member.summary: A list of up to 4 custom fields to be displayed on the invoice. If a value for custom_fields is specified, the list specified will replace the existing custom field list on this invoice. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined fields.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from which the invoice is created until it is due. Only valid for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice. This field can only be updated on draft invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any line item that does not have tax_rates set. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The discounts that will apply to the invoice. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. Only valid for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice. This field can only be updated on draft invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Footer
member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account (if any) for which the funds of the invoice payment are intended. If set, the invoice will be presented with the branding and support information of the specified account. See the Invoices with Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.PaymentSettings
member.summary: Configuration settings for the PaymentIntent that is generated when the invoice is finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.RenderingOptions
member.summary: Options for invoice PDF rendering.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge for the customer's credit card statement. It must contain at least one letter. If not specified and this invoice is part of a subscription, the default statement_descriptor will be set to the first subscription item's product's statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the invoice will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfer will be found on the invoice's charge. This will be unset if you POST an empty value.

member.name: P:Stripe.ShippingOptions.Address
member.summary: Customer shipping address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ShippingOptions.Name
member.summary: Customer name.

member.name: P:Stripe.ShippingOptions.Phone
member.summary: Customer phone (including extension).

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Settings for automatic tax lookup for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.CustomerDetails
member.summary: Details about the customer you want to invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.AlwaysPrompt
member.summary: Boolean to indicate that the user should always be asked to connect, even if they're already connected. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.ClientId
member.summary: The unique identifier provided to your application, found in your application settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.ResponseType
member.summary: The only option at the moment is code.

summary.para: The URL for the authorize response redirect. If provided, this must exactly match one of the comma-separated redirect_uri values in your application settings.
To protect yourself from certain forms of man-in-the-middle attacks, the live mode redirect_uri must use a secure HTTPS connection.
Defaults to the redirect_uri in your application settings if not provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.Scope
member.summary: read_write or read_only, depending on the level of access you need. Defaults to read_only.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.State
member.summary: An arbitrary string value we will pass back to you, useful for CSRF protection.

summary.para: login or register, depending on what type of screen you want your users to see. Only override this to be login if you expect all your users to have Stripe accounts already (e.g., most read-only applications, like analytics dashboards or accounting software).
Defaults to login for scope read_only and register for scope read_write.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.StripeUser
member.summary: Prefilled details in the account form for new users.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.SuggestedCapabilities
member.summary: If your platform is designated for one Capability (either card_payments or transfers), you won't need to specify additional Capabilities. However, if your platform supports both, you can add a Capability to an individual Express account by including the parameter in your OAuth link.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the address block.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.
The Kanji variation of the address block.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.
The Kana variation of the address building.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.
The Kanji variation of the address building.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.BusinessName
member.summary: The legal name of the business, also used for the statement descriptor.

summary.para: The type of the business.
Must be one of sole_prop, corporation, non_profit, partnership, or llc.
Address city of the business.
We highly recommend that you also prefill with the corresponding country.
Two-letter country code (e.g., US or CA).
Must be a country that Stripe currently supports.
Three-letter ISO code representing currency, in lowercase (e.g., usd or cad).
Must be a valid country and currency combination that Stripe supports.
Must prefill with the corresponding country.
Day (1-31) for the birth date of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
If filling this property, you must also fill and .
Month (1-12) for the birth date of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
If filling this property, you must also fill and .
Year (YYYY, greather than 1900) for the birth date of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
If filling this property, you must also fill and .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.Email
member.summary: The user's email address. Must be a valid email format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.FirstName
member.summary: First name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the first name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The Kanji variation of the first name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The gender of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application. (International regulations require either male or female.)
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.LastName
member.summary: Last name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the last name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The Kanji variation of the last name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The business phone number. Must be 10 digits only.
Must also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.PhysicalProduct
member.summary: true if the user sells a physical product, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: A description of what the business is accepting payments for.

summary.para: Address state of the business. Must be the two-letter state or province code (e.g., NY for a U.S. business or AB for a Canadian one).
Must also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.StreetAddress
member.summary: Street address of the business.

summary.para: The URL for the user's business. This may be the user's website, a profile page within your application, or another publicly available profile for the business, such as a LinkedIn or Facebook profile.
Must be URL-encoded and include a scheme (http or https).

If you will be prefilling this field, we highly recommend that the linked page contain a description of the user's products or services and their contact information. If we don't have enough information, we'll have to reach out to the user directly before initiating payouts.
Address postal code of the business.
We highly recommend that you also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorizeOptions.ClientId
member.summary: The client_id of the application that you'd like to disconnect the account from. The account must be connected to this application.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorizeOptions.StripeUserId
member.summary: The account you'd like to disconnect from.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.AssertCapabilities
member.summary: If you specified a Capability using the parameter, you can verify that Stripe applied the suggested Capability in this POST request by including and identifying that card_payments or transfers match. A request error will be returned if the suggested Capability doesn't match the assertion: in this case, it's recommended to end the onboarding flow with a failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The secret API key. When converting an authorization code to an access token, you must use an API key that matches the modeâ€”live or testâ€”of the authorization code (which depends on whether the client_id used was production or development).

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.Code
member.summary: The value of the code, depending on the grant_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.GrantType
member.summary: authorization_code when turning an authorization code into an access token, or refresh_token when using a refresh token to get a new access token.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.RefreshToken
member.summary: The value of the refresh_token, depending on the grant_type.

summary.para: When requesting a new access token from a refresh token, any scope that has an equal or lesser scope as the refresh token. Has no effect when requesting an access token from an authorization code.
Defaults to the scope of the refresh token.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentApplyCustomerBalanceOptions.Amount
member.summary:
Amount intended to be applied to this PaymentIntent from the customerâ€™s cash balance.
A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency).
The maximum amount is the amount of the PaymentIntent.
When omitted, the amount defaults to the remaining amount requested on the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentApplyCustomerBalanceOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentAutomaticPaymentMethodsOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Whether this feature is enabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCancelOptions.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for canceling this PaymentIntent. Possible values are duplicate, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or abandoned. One of: abandoned, duplicate, fraudulent, or requested_by_customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.AmountToCapture
member.summary: The amount to capture from the PaymentIntent, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded. Defaults to the full amount_capturable if not provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customersâ€™ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment is captured. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ErrorOnRequiresAction
member.summary: Set to true to fail the payment attempt if the PaymentIntent transitions into requires_action. This parameter is intended for simpler integrations that do not handle customer actions, like saving cards without authentication.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Mandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, or compatible Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodData
member.summary: If provided, this hash will be used to create a PaymentMethod. The new PaymentMethod will appear in the payment_method property on the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use. If this is not provided, defaults to ["card"].

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.RadarOptions
member.summary: Options to configure Radar. See Radar Session for more information.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment method's app or site. If you'd prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter is only used for cards and other redirect-based payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.
If setup_future_usage is already set and you are performing a request using a publishable key, you may only update the value from on_session to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.UseStripeSdk
member.summary: Set to true only when using manual confirmation and the iOS or Android SDKs to handle additional authentication steps.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.AutomaticPaymentMethods
member.summary: When enabled, this PaymentIntent will accept payment methods that you have enabled in the Dashboard and are compatible with this PaymentIntent's other parameters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Confirm
member.summary: Set to true to attempt to confirm this PaymentIntent immediately. This parameter defaults to false. When creating and confirming a PaymentIntent at the same time, parameters available in the confirm API may also be provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ErrorOnRequiresAction
member.summary: Set to true to fail the payment attempt if the PaymentIntent transitions into requires_action. This parameter is intended for simpler integrations that do not handle customer actions, like saving cards without authentication. This parameter can only be used with confirm=true.

If neither the payment_method parameter nor the source parameter are provided with confirm=true, source will be automatically populated with customer.default_source to improve the migration experience for users of the Charges API. member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.
If setup_future_usage is already set and you are performing a request using a publishable key, you may only update the value from on_session to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Verification method for the intent. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsAffirmOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary:
Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account.
If provided, this parameter will override the top-level capture_method when finalizing the payment with this payment method type.
If capture_method is already set on the PaymentIntent, providing an empty value for this parameter will unset the stored value for this payment method type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Setting to true enables installments for this PaymentIntent. This will cause the response to contain a list of available installment plans. Setting to false will prevent any selected plan from applying to a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsOptions.Plan
member.summary: The selected installment plan to use for this payment attempt. This parameter can only be provided during confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Count
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the number of installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Interval
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the interval between installment payments your customer will make to their credit card. One of month.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Type
member.summary: Type of installment plan, one of fixed_count.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount to be charged for future payments.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.AmountType
member.summary: One of fixed or maximum. If fixed, the amount param refers to the exact amount to be charged in future payments. If maximum, the amount charged can be up to the value passed for the amount param. One of: fixed, or maximum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.Description
member.summary: A description of the mandate or subscription that is meant to be displayed to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.EndDate
member.summary: End date of the mandate or subscription. If not provided, the mandate will be active until canceled. If provided, end date should be after start date.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies payment frequency. One of day, week, month, year, or sporadic. One of: day, month, sporadic, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between payments. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 indicates one payment every three months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks). This parameter is optional when interval=sporadic.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.Reference
member.summary: Unique identifier for the mandate or subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.StartDate
member.summary: Start date of the mandate or subscription. Start date should not be lesser than yesterday.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.SupportedTypes
member.summary: Specifies the type of mandates supported. Possible values are india.

Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account.
If provided, this parameter will override the top-level capture_method when finalizing the payment with this payment method type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.CvcToken
member.summary: A single-use cvc_update Token that represents a card CVC value. When provided, the CVC value will be verified during the card payment attempt. This parameter can only be provided during confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Installments
member.summary:
Installment configuration for payments attempted on this PaymentIntent (Mexico Only).
For more information, see the installments integration guide.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.MandateOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for setting up an eMandate for cards issued in India.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Moto
member.summary: When specified, this parameter indicates that a transaction will be marked as MOTO (Mail Order Telephone Order) and thus out of scope for SCA. This parameter can only be provided during confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Network
member.summary: Selected network to process this PaymentIntent on. Depends on the available networks of the card attached to the PaymentIntent. Can be only set confirm-time. One of: amex, cartes_bancaires, diners, discover, interac, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, unknown, or visa.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffixKana

Concatenated with the Kana prefix (shortened Kana descriptor) or Kana statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters. On card statements, the concatenation of both prefix and suffix (including separators) will appear truncated to 22 characters.

member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. On card statements, the concatenation of both prefix and suffix (including separators) will appear truncated to 17 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardPresentOptions.RequestExtendedAuthorization
member.summary: Request ability to capture this payment beyond the standard authorization validity window.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardPresentOptions.RequestIncrementalAuthorizationSupport

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferEuBankTransferOptions.Country
member.summary: The desired country code of the bank account information. Permitted values include: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferOptions.RequestedAddressTypes
member.summary:
List of address types that should be returned in the financial_addresses response. If not specified, all valid types will be returned.
Permitted values include: sort_code, zengin, iban, or spei.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferOptions.Type
member.summary: The list of bank transfer types that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use for funding Permitted values include: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer. One of: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.BankTransfer
member.summary: Configuration for the bank transfer funding type, if the funding_type is set to bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.FundingType
member.summary: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Permitted values include: bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.
If setup_future_usage is already set and you are performing a request using a publishable key, you may only update the value from on_session to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsKlarnaOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary:
Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account.
If provided, this parameter will override the top-level capture_method when finalizing the payment with this payment method type.
If capture_method is already set on the PaymentIntent, providing an empty value for this parameter will unset the stored value for this payment method type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsKlarnaOptions.PreferredLocale
member.summary: Preferred language of the Klarna authorization page that the customer is redirected to. One of: da-DK, de-AT, de-CH, de-DE, en-AT, en-AU, en-BE, en-CA, en-CH, en-DE, en-DK, en-ES, en-FI, en-FR, en-GB, en-IE, en-IT, en-NL, en-NO, en-NZ, en-PL, en-PT, en-SE, en-US, es-ES, es-US, fi-FI, fr-BE, fr-CA, fr-CH, fr-FR, it-CH, it-IT, nb-NO, nl-BE, nl-NL, pl-PL, pt-PT, sv-FI, or sv-SE.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsKonbiniOptions.ConfirmationNumber
member.summary: An optional 10 to 11 digit numeric-only string determining the confirmation code at applicable convenience stores. Must not consist of only zeroes and could be rejected in case of insufficient uniqueness. We recommend to use the customer's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsKonbiniOptions.ExpiresAfterDays
member.summary: The number of calendar days (between 1 and 60) after which Konbini payment instructions will expire. For example, if a PaymentIntent is confirmed with Konbini and expires_after_days set to 2 on Monday JST, the instructions will expire on Wednesday 23:59:59 JST. Defaults to 3 days.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsKonbiniOptions.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The timestamp at which the Konbini payment instructions will expire. Only one of expires_after_days or expires_at may be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsKonbiniOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: A product descriptor of up to 22 characters, which will appear to customers at the convenience store.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentRadarOptionsOptions.Session
member.summary: A Radar Session is a snapshot of the browser metadata and device details that help Radar make more accurate predictions on your payments.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary:
The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds. The amount is capped at the total transaction amount and if no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.
If you intend to collect a fee and you need a more robust reporting experience, using application_fee_amount might be a better fit for your integration.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, successful charges will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from charges will be transferred to the destination account. The ID of the resulting transfer will be returned on the successful charge's transfer field.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, or compatible Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodData
member.summary: If provided, this hash will be used to create a PaymentMethod. The new PaymentMethod will appear in the payment_method property on the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use. Use automatic_payment_methods to manage payment methods from the Stripe Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customersâ€™ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor thatâ€™s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.TransferGroup

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentVerifyMicrodepositsOptions.DescriptorCode

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkAfterCompletionRedirectOptions.Url
member.summary: The URL the customer will be redirected to after the purchase is complete. You can embed {CHECKOUT_SESSION_ID} into the URL to have the id of the completed checkout session included.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkAutomaticTaxOptions.Enabled
member.summary: If true, tax will be calculated automatically using the customer's location.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkConsentCollectionOptions.Promotions
member.summary: If set to auto, enables the collection of customer consent for promotional communications. The Checkout Session will determine whether to display an option to opt into promotional communication from the merchant depending on the customer's locale. Only available to US merchants. One of: auto, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkConsentCollectionOptions.TermsOfService
member.summary: If set to required, it requires customers to check a terms of service checkbox before being able to pay. There must be a valid terms of service URL set in your Dashboard settings. One of: none, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.AfterCompletion
member.summary: Behavior after the purchase is complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.AllowPromotionCodes
member.summary: Enables user redeemable promotion codes.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. Can only be applied when there are no line items with recurring prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. There must be at least 1 line item with a recurring price to use this field.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.AutomaticTax

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency and supported by each line item's price.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.CustomText
member.summary: Display additional text for your customers using custom text.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.CustomerCreation
member.summary: Configures whether checkout sessions created by this payment link create a Customer. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.LineItems
member.summary: The line items representing what is being sold. Each line item represents an item being sold. Up to 20 line items are supported.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Metadata associated with this Payment Link will automatically be copied to checkout sessions created by this payment link.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.PaymentMethodCollection
member.summary:
Specify whether Checkout should collect a payment method. When set to if_required, Checkout will not collect a payment method when the total due for the session is 0.This may occur if the Checkout Session includes a free trial or a discount.
Can only be set in subscription mode.
If you'd like information on how to collect a payment method outside of Checkout, read the guide on configuring subscriptions with a free trial. One of: always, or if_required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types that customers can use. If no value is passed, Stripe will dynamically show relevant payment methods from your payment method settings (20+ payment methods supported).

We recommend that you review your privacy policy and check with your legal contacts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkCreateOptions.SubscriptionData

member.summary: The maximum quantity the customer can purchase. By default this value is 99. You can specify a value up to 99.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkLineItemAdjustableQuantityOptions.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum quantity the customer can purchase. By default this value is 0. You can specify a value up to 98. If there is only one item in the cart then that item's quantity cannot go down to 0.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkLineItemOptions.AdjustableQuantity

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkPaymentIntentDataOptions.CaptureMethod

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkPaymentIntentDataOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with the payment method collected by this Checkout Session.
When setting this to on_session, Checkout will show a notice to the customer that their payment details will be saved.
When setting this to off_session, Checkout will show a notice to the customer that their payment details will be saved and used for future payments.
If a Customer has been provided or Checkout creates a new Customer,Checkout will attach the payment method to the Customer.
If Checkout does not create a Customer, the payment method is not attached to a Customer. To reuse the payment method, you can retrieve it from the Checkout Session's PaymentIntent.
When processing card payments, Checkout also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentLinkPhoneNumberCollectionOptions.Enabled

member.summary: The balance type of your Stripe balance to draw this payout from. Balances for different payment sources are kept separately. You can find the amounts with the balances API. One of bank_account, card, or fpx. One of: bank_account, card, or fpx.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: A string to be displayed on the recipient's bank or card statement. This may be at most 22 characters. Attempting to use a statement_descriptor longer than 22 characters will return an error. Note: Most banks will truncate this information and/or display it inconsistently. Some may not display it at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutReverseOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.summary: The person's ID number, as appropriate for their country. For example, a social security number in the U.S., social insurance number in Canada, etc. Instead of the number itself, you can also provide a PII token provided by Stripe.js.

member.summary: Whether the person is a director of the account's legal entity. Directors are typically members of the governing board of the company, or responsible for ensuring the company meets its regulatory obligations.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Executive
member.summary: Whether the person has significant responsibility to control, manage, or direct the organization.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Owner
member.summary: Whether the person is an owner of the accountâ€™s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.PercentOwnership
member.summary: The percent owned by the person of the account's legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Representative
member.summary: Whether the person is authorized as the primary representative of the account. This is the person nominated by the business to provide information about themselves, and general information about the account. There can only be one representative at any given time. At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.
