member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationOptions.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum. One of: last_during_period, last_ever, max, or sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free plan) representing how much to charge on a recurring basis.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.AmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as amount, but accepts a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of amount and amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in amount) will be charged per unit in quantity (for plans with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for plans with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: An identifier randomly generated by Stripe. Used to identify this plan when subscribing a customer. You can optionally override this ID, but the ID must be unique across all plans in your Stripe account. You can, however, use the same plan ID in both live and test modes.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires billing_scheme to be set to tiered. See also the documentation for billing_scheme.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows. One of: graduated, or volume.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TransformUsage
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with tiers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed. One of: licensed, or metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the product. Must be unique. If not provided, an identifier will be randomly generated.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.Name
member.summary: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary:
An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card or bank statement. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.
This may be up to 22 characters. The statement description may not include <, >, \, ", ' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.TaxCode
member.summary: A tax code ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanProductOptions.UnitLabel
member.summary: A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customersâ€™ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.FlatAmount
member.summary: The flat billing amount for an entire tier, regardless of the number of units in the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as flat_amount, but accepts a decimal value representing an integer in the minor units of the currency. Only one of flat_amount and flat_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The per unit billing amount for each individual unit for which this tier applies.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UpTo
member.summary: Specifies the upper bound of this tier. The lower bound of a tier is the upper bound of the previous tier adding one. Use inf to define a fallback tier.

member.name: F:Stripe.PlanTierUpTo.Inf
member.summary: Use this value to define a fallback tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsageOptions.DivideBy
member.summary: Divide usage by this number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsageOptions.Round
member.summary: After division, either round the result up or down. One of: down, or up.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Product
member.summary: The product the plan belongs to. This cannot be changed once it has been used in a subscription or subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Prices defined in each available currency option. Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.CustomUnitAmount
member.summary: When set, provides configuration for the amount to be adjusted by the customer during Checkout Sessions and Payment Links.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.LookupKey
member.summary: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.ProductData
member.summary: These fields can be used to create a new product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and usage_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires billing_scheme to be set to tiered. See also the documentation for billing_scheme.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows. One of: graduated, or volume.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TransferLookupKey
member.summary: If set to true, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing price, and assign it to this price.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TransformQuantity
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with tiers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge. One of unit_amount or custom_unit_amount is required, unless billing_scheme=tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCurrencyOptionsCustomUnitAmountOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Pass in true to enable custom_unit_amount, otherwise omit custom_unit_amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCurrencyOptionsCustomUnitAmountOptions.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum unit amount the customer can specify for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCurrencyOptionsCustomUnitAmountOptions.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum unit amount the customer can specify for this item. Must be at least the minimum charge amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCurrencyOptionsCustomUnitAmountOptions.Preset
member.summary: The starting unit amount which can be updated by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCurrencyOptionsOptions.CustomUnitAmount
member.summary: When set, provides configuration for the amount to be adjusted by the customer during Checkout Sessions and Payment Links.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCurrencyOptionsOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum. One of: last_during_period, last_ever, max, or sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this price using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed. One of: licensed, or metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTierOptions.FlatAmount
member.summary: The flat billing amount for an entire tier, regardless of the number of units in the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTierOptions.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as flat_amount, but accepts a decimal value representing an integer in the minor units of the currency. Only one of flat_amount and flat_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTierOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The per unit billing amount for each individual unit for which this tier applies.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTierOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTierOptions.UpTo
member.summary: Specifies the upper bound of this tier. The lower bound of a tier is the upper bound of the previous tier adding one. Use inf to define a fallback tier.

member.name: F:Stripe.PriceTierUpTo.Inf
member.summary: Use this value to define a fallback tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTransformQuantityOptions.DivideBy
member.summary: Divide usage by this number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTransformQuantityOptions.Round
member.summary: After division, either round the result up or down. One of: down, or up.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Prices defined in each available currency option. Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.LookupKey
member.summary: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and usage_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceUpdateOptions.TransferLookupKey
member.summary: If set to true, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing price, and assign it to this price.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Attributes
member.summary: A list of up to 5 alphanumeric attributes. Should only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.DeactivateOn
member.summary: An array of Connect application names or identifiers that should not be able to order the SKUs for this product. May only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.DefaultPriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object. This Price will be set as the default price for this product.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: An identifier will be randomly generated by Stripe. You can optionally override this ID, but the ID must be unique across all products in your Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Images
member.summary: A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.summary: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary:
An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card or bank statement. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.
This may be up to 22 characters. The statement description may not include <, >, \, ", ' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. It must contain at least one letter.

member.summary: The type of the product. Defaults to service if not explicitly specified, enabling use of this product with Subscriptions and Plans. member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeCreateOptions.Code
member.summary: The customer-facing code. Regardless of case, this code must be unique across all active promotion codes for a specific customer. If left blank, we will generate one automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeCreateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The coupon for this promotion code.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The customer that this promotion code can be used by. If not set, the promotion code can be used by all customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeCreateOptions.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The timestamp at which this promotion code will expire. If the coupon has specified a redeems_by, then this value cannot be after the coupon's redeems_by.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeCreateOptions.MaxRedemptions
member.summary: A positive integer specifying the number of times the promotion code can be redeemed. If the coupon has specified a max_redemptions, then this value cannot be greater than the coupon's max_redemptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.summary: Settings that restrict the redemption of the promotion code.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeRestrictionsCurrencyOptionsOptions.MinimumAmount
member.summary: Minimum amount required to redeem this Promotion Code into a Coupon (e.g., a purchase must be $100 or more to work).

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeRestrictionsOptions.CurrencyOptions
member.summary: Promotion codes defined in each available currency option. Each key must be a three-letter ISO currency code and a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeRestrictionsOptions.FirstTimeTransaction
member.summary: A Boolean indicating if the Promotion Code should only be redeemed for Customers without any successful payments or invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.PromotionCodeRestrictionsOptions.MinimumAmount
member.summary: Minimum amount required to redeem this Promotion Code into a Coupon (e.g., a purchase must be $100 or more to work).

member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for minimum_amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteAutomaticTaxOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will automatically compute tax on the resulting invoices or subscriptions as well as the quote itself.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. There cannot be any line items with recurring prices when using this field.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. There must be at least 1 line item with a recurring price to use this field.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Settings for automatic tax lookup for this quote and resulting invoices and subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay invoices at the end of the subscription cycle or at invoice finalization using the default payment method attached to the subscription or customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The customer for which this quote belongs to. A customer is required before finalizing the quote. Once specified, it cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any line item that does not have tax_rates set.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: A description that will be displayed on the quote PDF. If no value is passed, the default description configured in your quote template settings will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The discounts applied to the quote. You can only set up to one discount.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.ExpiresAt
member.summary: A future timestamp on which the quote will be canceled if in open or draft status. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch. If no value is passed, the default expiration date configured in your quote template settings will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.Footer
member.summary: A footer that will be displayed on the quote PDF. If no value is passed, the default footer configured in your quote template settings will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.FromQuote
member.summary: Clone an existing quote. The new quote will be created in status=draft. When using this parameter, you cannot specify any other parameters except for expires_at.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.Header
member.summary: A header that will be displayed on the quote PDF. If no value is passed, the default header configured in your quote template settings will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: All invoices will be billed using the specified settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.LineItems
member.summary: A list of line items the customer is being quoted for. Each line item includes information about the product, the quantity, and the resulting cost.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account on behalf of which to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.SubscriptionData
member.summary: When creating a subscription or subscription schedule, the specified configuration data will be used. There must be at least one line item with a recurring price for a subscription or subscription schedule to be created. A subscription schedule is created if subscription_data[effective_date] is present and in the future, otherwise a subscription is created.

member.name: P:Stripe.QuoteCreateOptions.TestClock

member.summary: When creating a new subscription, the date of which the subscription schedule will start after the quote is accepted. A subscription schedule is created if subscription_data[effective_date] is present and in the future, otherwise a subscription is created.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentConfirmOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate on the payment method's app or site. If you'd prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter is only used for cards and other redirect-based payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.AttachToSelf
member.summary:
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the in-context Stripe Account.
It can only be used for this Stripe Accountâ€™s own money movement flows like InboundTransfer and OutboundTransfers. It cannot be set to true when setting up a PaymentMethod for a Customer, and defaults to false when attaching a PaymentMethod to a Customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Confirm
member.summary: Set to true to attempt to confirm this SetupIntent immediately. This parameter defaults to false. If the payment method attached is a card, a return_url may be provided in case additional authentication is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of the Customer this SetupIntent belongs to, if one exists.
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer on successful setup. Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.FlowDirections
member.summary:
Indicates the directions of money movement for which this payment method is intended to be used.
Include inbound if you intend to use the payment method as the origin to pull funds from. Include outbound if you intend to use the payment method as the destination to send funds to. You can include both if you intend to use the payment method for both purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Network

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentSingleUseOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount the customer is granting permission to collect later. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge Â¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentSingleUseOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.AttachToSelf
member.summary:
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the in-context Stripe Account.
It can only be used for this Stripe Accountâ€™s own money movement flows like InboundTransfer and OutboundTransfers. It cannot be set to true when setting up a PaymentMethod for a Customer, and defaults to false when attaching a PaymentMethod to a Customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of the Customer this SetupIntent belongs to, if one exists.
If present, the SetupIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer on successful setup. Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.FlowDirections
member.summary:
Indicates the directions of money movement for which this payment method is intended to be used.
Include inbound if you intend to use the payment method as the origin to pull funds from. Include outbound if you intend to use the payment method as the destination to send funds to. You can include both if you intend to use the payment method for both purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethod

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodData

One of: deprecated_none, email, manual, none, or stripe_email.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemCreateOptions.PaymentBehavior
member.summary:
Use allow_incomplete to transition the subscription to status=past_due if a payment is required but cannot be paid. This allows you to manage scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscription's invoice. For example, SCA regulation may require 3DS authentication to complete payment. See the SCA Migration Guide for Billing to learn more. This is the default behavior.
Use default_incomplete to transition the subscription to status=past_due when payment is required and await explicit confirmation of the invoice's payment intent. This allows simpler management of scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscriptionâ€™s invoice. Such as failed payments, SCA regulation, or collecting a mandate for a bank debit payment method.
Use pending_if_incomplete to update the subscription using pending updates. When you use pending_if_incomplete you can only pass the parameters supported by pending updates.
Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if a subscription's invoice cannot be paid. For example, if a payment method requires 3DS authentication due to SCA regulation and further user action is needed, this parameter does not update the subscription and returns an error instead. This was the default behavior for API versions prior to 2019-03-14. See the changelog to learn more. One of: allow_incomplete, default_incomplete, error_if_incomplete, or pending_if_incomplete.

member.summary:
Use allow_incomplete to transition the subscription to status=past_due if a payment is required but cannot be paid. This allows you to manage scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscription's invoice. For example, SCA regulation may require 3DS authentication to complete payment. See the SCA Migration Guide for Billing to learn more. This is the default behavior.
Use default_incomplete to transition the subscription to status=past_due when payment is required and await explicit confirmation of the invoice's payment intent. Such as failed payments, SCA regulation, or collecting a mandate for a bank debit payment method.
Use pending_if_incomplete to update the subscription using pending updates. When you use pending_if_incomplete you can only pass the parameters supported by pending updates.
Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if a subscription's invoice cannot be paid. For example, if a payment method requires 3DS authentication due to SCA regulation and further user action is needed, this parameter does not update the subscription and returns an error instead. This was the default behavior for API versions prior to 2019-03-14. See the changelog to learn more. One of: allow_incomplete, default_incomplete, error_if_incomplete, or pending_if_incomplete.

member.summary: Enabled automatic tax calculation which will automatically compute tax rates on all invoices generated by the subscription.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingCycleAnchor.Now
member.summary: Resets the subscription's billing cycle anchor to the current time.
