member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholdsOptions.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCancelOptions.InvoiceNow
member.summary: Will generate a final invoice that invoices for any un-invoiced metered usage and new/pending proration invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCancelOptions.Prorate
member.summary: Will generate a proration invoice item that credits remaining unused time until the subscription period end.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the next invoice for this subscription. You may pass up to 20 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made by a platform account on a connected account in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Automatic tax settings for this subscription. We recommend you only include this parameter when the existing value is being changed.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BackdateStartDate
member.summary: For new subscriptions, a past timestamp to backdate the subscription's start date to. If set, the first invoice will contain a proration for the timespan between the start date and the current time. Can be combined with trials and the billing cycle anchor.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: A future timestamp to anchor the subscription's billing cycle. This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. The timestamp is in UTC format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.CancelAt
member.summary: A timestamp at which the subscription should cancel. If set to a date before the current period ends, this will cause a proration if prorations have been enabled using proration_behavior. If set during a future period, this will always cause a proration for that period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.CancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The ID of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The identifier of the customer to subscribe.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. Valid only for subscriptions where collection_method is set to send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription. This takes precedence over default_source. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If default_payment_method is also set, default_payment_method will take precedence. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any subscription item that does not have tax_rates set. Invoices created will have their default_tax_rates populated from the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: The subscription's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription for rendering in Stripe surfaces.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Items
member.summary: A list of up to 20 subscription items, each with an attached price.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Indicates if a customer is on or off-session while an invoice payment is attempted.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account on behalf of which to charge, for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.PaymentBehavior
member.summary:
Only applies to subscriptions with collection_method=charge_automatically.
Use allow_incomplete to create subscriptions with status=incomplete if the first invoice cannot be paid. Creating subscriptions with this status allows you to manage scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscription's invoice. For example, SCA regulation may require 3DS authentication to complete payment. See the SCA Migration Guide for Billing to learn more. This is the default behavior.
Use default_incomplete to create Subscriptions with status=incomplete when the first invoice requires payment, otherwise start as active. Subscriptions transition to status=active when successfully confirming the payment intent on the first invoice. This allows simpler management of scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscriptionâ€™s invoice. Such as failed payments, SCA regulation, or collecting a mandate for a bank debit payment method. If the payment intent is not confirmed within 23 hours subscriptions transition to status=incomplete_expired, which is a terminal state.
Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if a subscription's first invoice cannot be paid. For example, if a payment method requires 3DS authentication due to SCA regulation and further user action is needed, this parameter does not create a subscription and returns an error instead. This was the default behavior for API versions prior to 2019-03-14. See the changelog to learn more.
pending_if_incomplete is only used with updates and cannot be passed when creating a subscription.
Subscriptions with collection_method=send_invoice are automatically activated regardless of the first invoice status. One of: allow_incomplete, default_incomplete, error_if_incomplete, or pending_if_incomplete.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.PaymentSettings
member.summary: Payment settings to pass to invoices created by the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.PendingInvoiceItemInterval
member.summary: Specifies an interval for how often to bill for any pending invoice items. It is analogous to calling Create an invoice for the given subscription at the specified interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.PromotionCode
member.summary: The API ID of a promotion code to apply to this subscription. A promotion code applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: Determines how to handle prorations resulting from the billing_cycle_anchor. If no value is passed, the default is create_prorations. One of: always_invoice, create_prorations, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the subscription's invoices will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfers will be found on the resulting charges.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. This will always overwrite any trials that might apply via a subscribed plan. If set, trial_end will override the default trial period of the plan the customer is being subscribed to. The special value now can be provided to end the customer's trial immediately. Can be at most two years from billing_cycle_anchor. See Using trial periods on subscriptions to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan's trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with trial_end is not allowed. See Using trial periods on subscriptions to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Integer representing the number of trial period days before the customer is charged for the first time. This will always overwrite any trials that might apply via a subscribed plan. See Using trial periods on subscriptions to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemBillingThresholdsOptions.UsageGte
member.summary: Usage threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.ClearUsage
member.summary: Delete all usage for a given subscription item. Allowed only when deleted is set to true and the current plan's usage_type is metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Deleted
member.summary: A flag that, if set to true, will delete the specified item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Id
member.summary: Subscription item to update.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: A list of Tax Rate ids. These Tax Rates will override the default_tax_rates on the Subscription. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and interval_count.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPauseCollectionOptions.Behavior
member.summary: The payment collection behavior for this subscription while paused. One of keep_as_draft, mark_uncollectible, or void. One of: keep_as_draft, mark_uncollectible, or void.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPauseCollectionOptions.ResumesAt
member.summary: The time after which the subscription will resume collecting payments.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration to provide to invoices created by the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) to provide to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent. If not set, Stripe attempts to automatically determine the types to use by looking at the invoiceâ€™s default payment method, the subscriptionâ€™s default payment method, the customerâ€™s default payment method, and your invoice template settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsOptions.SaveDefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: Either off, or on_subscription. With on_subscription Stripe updates subscription.default_payment_method when a subscription payment succeeds. One of: off, or on_subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitMandateOptionsOptions.TransactionType
member.summary: Transaction type of the mandate. One of: business, or personal.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.MandateOptions
member.summary: Additional fields for Mandate creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsAcssDebitOptions.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Verification method for the intent. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsBancontactOptions.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to. One of: de, en, fr, or nl.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount to be charged for future payments.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.AmountType
member.summary: One of fixed or maximum. If fixed, the amount param refers to the exact amount to be charged in future payments. If maximum, the amount charged can be up to the value passed for the amount param. One of: fixed, or maximum.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardMandateOptionsOptions.Description
member.summary: A description of the mandate or subscription that is meant to be displayed to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.MandateOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for setting up an eMandate for cards issued in India.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Network
member.summary: Selected network to process this Subscription on. Depends on the available networks of the card attached to the Subscription. Can be only set confirm-time. One of: amex, cartes_bancaires, diners, discover, interac, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, unknown, or visa.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferEuBankTransferOptions.Country
member.summary: The desired country code of the bank account information. Permitted values include: DE, ES, FR, IE, or NL.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferOptions.EuBankTransfer
member.summary: Configuration for eu_bank_transfer funding type.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceBankTransferOptions.Type
member.summary: The bank transfer type that can be used for funding. Permitted values include: eu_bank_transfer, gb_bank_transfer, jp_bank_transfer, or mx_bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.BankTransfer
member.summary: Configuration for the bank transfer funding type, if the funding_type is set to bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCustomerBalanceOptions.FundingType
member.summary: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Permitted values include: bank_transfer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.AcssDebit
member.summary: This sub-hash contains details about the Canadian pre-authorized debit payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Bancontact
member.summary: This sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Card
member.summary: This sub-hash contains details about the Card payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.CustomerBalance
member.summary: This sub-hash contains details about the Bank transfer payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Konbini
member.summary: This sub-hash contains details about the Konbini payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.UsBankAccount
member.summary: This sub-hash contains details about the ACH direct debit payment method options to pass to the invoiceâ€™s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountFinancialConnectionsOptions.Permissions
member.summary: The list of permissions to request. If this parameter is passed, the payment_method permission must be included. Valid permissions include: balances, ownership, payment_method, and transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountOptions.FinancialConnections
member.summary: Additional fields for Financial Connections Session creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsUsBankAccountOptions.VerificationMethod
member.summary: Verification method for the intent. One of: automatic, instant, or microdeposits.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemIntervalOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies invoicing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemIntervalOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between invoices. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferDataOptions.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionTrialEnd.Now
member.summary: Special value used to end a customer's trial immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the next invoice for this subscription. You may pass up to 20 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made by a platform account on a connected account in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Automatic tax settings for this subscription. We recommend you only include this parameter when the existing value is being changed.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Either now or unchanged. Setting the value to now resets the subscription's billing cycle anchor to the current time (in UTC). For more information, see the billing cycle documentation. One of: now, or unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.CancelAt
member.summary: A timestamp at which the subscription should cancel. If set to a date before the current period ends, this will cause a proration if prorations have been enabled using proration_behavior. If set during a future period, this will always cause a proration for that period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.CancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The ID of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. Valid only for subscriptions where collection_method is set to send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription. This takes precedence over default_source. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If default_payment_method is also set, default_payment_method will take precedence. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any subscription item that does not have tax_rates set. Invoices created will have their default_tax_rates populated from the subscription. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: The subscription's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription for rendering in Stripe surfaces.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.Items
member.summary: A list of up to 20 subscription items, each with an attached price.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Indicates if a customer is on or off-session while an invoice payment is attempted.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account on behalf of which to charge, for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.PauseCollection
member.summary: If specified, payment collection for this subscription will be paused.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.PaymentBehavior
member.summary:
Use allow_incomplete to transition the subscription to status=past_due if a payment is required but cannot be paid. This allows you to manage scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscription's invoice. For example, SCA regulation may require 3DS authentication to complete payment. See the SCA Migration Guide for Billing to learn more. This is the default behavior.
Use default_incomplete to transition the subscription to status=past_due when payment is required and await explicit confirmation of the invoice's payment intent. This allows simpler management of scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscriptionâ€™s invoice. Such as failed payments, SCA regulation, or collecting a mandate for a bank debit payment method.
Use pending_if_incomplete to update the subscription using pending updates. When you use pending_if_incomplete you can only pass the parameters supported by pending updates.
Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if a subscription's invoice cannot be paid. For example, if a payment method requires 3DS authentication due to SCA regulation and further user action is needed, this parameter does not update the subscription and returns an error instead. This was the default behavior for API versions prior to 2019-03-14. See the changelog to learn more. One of: allow_incomplete, default_incomplete, error_if_incomplete, or pending_if_incomplete.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.PaymentSettings
member.summary: Payment settings to pass to invoices created by the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.PendingInvoiceItemInterval
member.summary: Specifies an interval for how often to bill for any pending invoice items. It is analogous to calling Create an invoice for the given subscription at the specified interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.PromotionCode
member.summary: The promotion code to apply to this subscription. A promotion code applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: Determines how to handle prorations when the billing cycle changes (e.g., when switching plans, resetting billing_cycle_anchor=now, or starting a trial), or if an item's quantity changes. One of: always_invoice, create_prorations, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.ProrationDate
member.summary: If set, the proration will be calculated as though the subscription was updated at the given time. This can be used to apply exactly the same proration that was previewed with upcoming invoice endpoint. It can also be used to implement custom proration logic, such as prorating by day instead of by second, by providing the time that you wish to use for proration calculations.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the subscription's invoices will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfers will be found on the resulting charges. This will be unset if you POST an empty value.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. This will always overwrite any trials that might apply via a subscribed plan. If set, trial_end will override the default trial period of the plan the customer is being subscribed to. The special value now can be provided to end the customer's trial immediately. Can be at most two years from billing_cycle_anchor.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan's trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with trial_end is not allowed. See Using trial periods on subscriptions to learn more.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCancelOptions.InvoiceNow
member.summary: If the subscription schedule is active, indicates if a final invoice will be generated that contains any un-invoiced metered usage and new/pending proration invoice items. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCancelOptions.Prorate
member.summary: If the subscription schedule is active, indicates if the cancellation should be prorated. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The identifier of the customer to create the subscription schedule for.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.DefaultSettings
member.summary: Object representing the subscription schedule's default settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.EndBehavior
member.summary: Configures how the subscription schedule behaves when it ends. Possible values are release or cancel with the default being release. release will end the subscription schedule and keep the underlying subscription running.cancel will end the subscription schedule and cancel the underlying subscription. One of: cancel, none, release, or renew.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.FromSubscription
member.summary: Migrate an existing subscription to be managed by a subscription schedule. If this parameter is set, a subscription schedule will be created using the subscription's item(s), set to auto-renew using the subscription's interval. When using this parameter, other parameters (such as phase values) cannot be set. To create a subscription schedule with other modifications, we recommend making two separate API calls.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.Phases
member.summary: List representing phases of the subscription schedule. Each phase can be customized to have different durations, plans, and coupons. If there are multiple phases, the end_date of one phase will always equal the start_date of the next phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.StartDate
member.summary: When the subscription schedule starts. We recommend using now so that it starts the subscription immediately. You can also use a Unix timestamp to backdate the subscription so that it starts on a past date, or set a future date for the subscription to start on.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsAutomaticTaxOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Enabled automatic tax calculation which will automatically compute tax rates on all invoices generated by the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsBillingThresholdsOptions.AmountGte
member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsBillingThresholdsOptions.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsInvoiceSettingsOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days within which a customer must pay invoices generated by this subscription schedule. This value will be null for subscription schedules where billing=charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made by a platform account on a connected account in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Default settings for automatic tax computation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Can be set to phase_start to set the anchor to the start of the phase or automatic to automatically change it if needed. Cannot be set to phase_start if this phase specifies a trial. For more information, see the billing cycle documentation. One of: automatic, or phase_start.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically on creation. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription schedule. If not set, invoices will use the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.Description
member.summary: Subscription description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: All invoices will be billed using the specified settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account on behalf of which to charge, for each of the associated subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The data with which to automatically create a Transfer for each of the associated subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsTransferDataOptions.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the item. When set, the default_tax_rates do not apply to this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAddInvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseAutomaticTaxOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Enabled automatic tax calculation which will automatically compute tax rates on all invoices generated by the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseBillingThresholdsOptions.AmountGte
member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseBillingThresholdsOptions.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseInvoiceSettingsOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days within which a customer must pay invoices generated by this subscription schedule. This value will be null for subscription schedules where billing=charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemBillingThresholdsOptions.UsageGte
member.summary: Usage threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: The plan ID to subscribe to. You may specify the same ID in plan and price.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for the given price. Can be set only if the price's usage_type is licensed and not metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: A list of Tax Rate ids. These Tax Rates will override the default_tax_rates on the Subscription. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and interval_count.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataOptions.TaxBehavior
member.summary: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed. One of: exclusive, inclusive, or unspecified.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the next invoice for this phase. You may pass up to 20 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made by a platform account on a connected account in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.AutomaticTax
member.summary: Automatic tax settings for this phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Can be set to phase_start to set the anchor to the start of the phase or automatic to automatically change it if needed. Cannot be set to phase_start if this phase specifies a trial. For more information, see the billing cycle documentation. One of: automatic, or phase_start.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically on creation. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The identifier of the coupon to apply to this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription schedule. If not set, invoices will use the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: A list of Tax Rate ids. These Tax Rates will set the Subscription's default_tax_rates, which means they will be the Invoice's default_tax_rates for any Invoices issued by the Subscription during this Phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Description
member.summary: Subscription description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.EndDate
member.summary: The date at which this phase of the subscription schedule ends. If set, iterations must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: All invoices will be billed using the specified settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Items
member.summary: List of configuration items, each with an attached price, to apply during this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Iterations
member.summary: Integer representing the multiplier applied to the price interval. For example, iterations=2 applied to a price with interval=month and interval_count=3 results in a phase of duration 2 * 3 months = 6 months. If set, end_date must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a phase. Metadata on a schedule's phase will update the underlying subscription's metadata when the phase is entered, adding new keys and replacing existing keys in the subscription's metadata. Individual keys in the subscription's metadata can be unset by posting an empty value to them in the phase's metadata. To unset all keys in the subscription's metadata, update the subscription directly or unset every key individually from the phase's metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The account on behalf of which to charge, for each of the associated subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: Whether the subscription schedule will create prorations when transitioning to this phase. The default value is create_prorations. One of: always_invoice, create_prorations, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The data with which to automatically create a Transfer for each of the associated subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Trial
member.summary: If set to true the entire phase is counted as a trial and the customer will not be charged for any fees.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Sets the phase to trialing from the start date to this date. Must be before the phase end date, can not be combined with trial.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhasePlanPriceDataRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhasePlanPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseTransferDataOptions.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleReleaseOptions.PreserveCancelDate
member.summary: Keep any cancellation on the subscription that the schedule has set.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleStartDate.Now
member.summary: Special value used to start a subscription schedule immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.DefaultSettings
member.summary: Object representing the subscription schedule's default settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.EndBehavior
member.summary: Configures how the subscription schedule behaves when it ends. Possible values are release or cancel with the default being release. release will end the subscription schedule and keep the underlying subscription running.cancel will end the subscription schedule and cancel the underlying subscription. One of: cancel, none, release, or renew.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.Phases
member.summary: List representing phases of the subscription schedule. Each phase can be customized to have different durations, plans, and coupons. If there are multiple phases, the end_date of one phase will always equal the start_date of the next phase. Note that past phases can be omitted.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: If the update changes the current phase, indicates whether the changes should be prorated. The default value is create_prorations. One of: always_invoice, create_prorations, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxIdCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: Type of the tax ID, one of ae_trn, au_abn, au_arn, bg_uic, br_cnpj, br_cpf, ca_bn, ca_gst_hst, ca_pst_bc, ca_pst_mb, ca_pst_sk, ca_qst, ch_vat, cl_tin, eg_tin, es_cif, eu_oss_vat, eu_vat, gb_vat, ge_vat, hk_br, hu_tin, id_npwp, il_vat, in_gst, is_vat, jp_cn, jp_rn, jp_trn, ke_pin, kr_brn, li_uid, mx_rfc, my_frp, my_itn, my_sst, no_vat, nz_gst, ph_tin, ru_inn, ru_kpp, sa_vat, sg_gst, sg_uen, si_tin, th_vat, tr_tin, tw_vat, ua_vat, us_ein, or za_vat. One of: ae_trn, au_abn, au_arn, bg_uic, br_cnpj, br_cpf, ca_bn, ca_gst_hst, ca_pst_bc, ca_pst_mb, ca_pst_sk, ca_qst, ch_vat, cl_tin, eg_tin, es_cif, eu_oss_vat, eu_vat, gb_vat, ge_vat, hk_br, hu_tin, id_npwp, il_vat, in_gst, is_vat, jp_cn, jp_rn, jp_trn, ke_pin, kr_brn, li_uid, mx_rfc, my_frp, my_itn, my_sst, no_vat, nz_gst, ph_tin, ru_inn, ru_kpp, sa_vat, sg_gst, sg_uen, si_tin, th_vat, tr_tin, tw_vat, ua_vat, us_ein, or za_vat.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxIdCreateOptions.Value
member.summary: Value of the tax ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Flag determining whether the tax rate is active or inactive (archived). Inactive tax rates cannot be used with new applications or Checkout Sessions, but will still work for subscriptions and invoices that already have it set.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Country
member.summary: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the tax rate for your internal use only. It will not be visible to your customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the tax rate, which will be shown to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Inclusive
member.summary: This specifies if the tax rate is inclusive or exclusive.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Jurisdiction
member.summary: The jurisdiction for the tax rate. You can use this label field for tax reporting purposes. It also appears on your customerâ€™s invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Percentage
member.summary: This represents the tax rate percent out of 100.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.State
member.summary: ISO 3166-2 subdivision code, without country prefix. For example, "NY" for New York, United States.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.TaxType
member.summary: The high-level tax type, such as vat or sales_tax. One of: gst, hst, jct, pst, qst, rst, sales_tax, or vat.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.Active
member.summary: Flag determining whether the tax rate is active or inactive (archived). Inactive tax rates cannot be used with new applications or Checkout Sessions, but will still work for subscriptions and invoices that already have it set.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.Country
member.summary: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the tax rate for your internal use only. It will not be visible to your customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the tax rate, which will be shown to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.Jurisdiction
member.summary: The jurisdiction for the tax rate. You can use this label field for tax reporting purposes. It also appears on your customerâ€™s invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.State
member.summary: ISO 3166-2 subdivision code, without country prefix. For example, "NY" for New York, United States.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateUpdateOptions.TaxType
member.summary: The high-level tax type, such as vat or sales_tax. One of: gst, hst, jct, pst, qst, rst, sales_tax, or vat.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Address
member.summary: The company's primary address.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.DirectorsProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's directors with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.director requirement. This value is not automatically set to true after creating directors, so it needs to be updated to indicate all directors have been provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.ExecutivesProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's executives with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.executive requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Name
member.summary: The company's legal name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.NameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.NameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.OwnersProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's owners with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.owner requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.OwnershipDeclaration
member.summary: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.OwnershipDeclarationShownAndSigned
member.summary: Whether the user described by the data in the token has been shown the Ownership Declaration and indicated that it is correct.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Phone
member.summary: The company's phone number (used for verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.RegistrationNumber
member.summary: The identification number given to a company when it is registered or incorporated, if distinct from the identification number used for filing taxes. (Examples are the CIN for companies and LLP IN for partnerships in India, and the Company Registration Number in Hong Kong).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Structure
member.summary: The category identifying the legal structure of the company or legal entity. See Business structure for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.TaxId
member.summary: The business ID number of the company, as appropriate for the companyâ€™s country. (Examples are an Employer ID Number in the U.S., a Business Number in Canada, or a Company Number in the UK.).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.TaxIdRegistrar
member.summary: The jurisdiction in which the tax_id is registered (Germany-based companies only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.VatId
member.summary: The VAT number of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Verification
member.summary: Information on the verification state of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOwnershipDeclarationOptions.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOwnershipDeclarationOptions.Ip
member.summary: The IP address from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOwnershipDeclarationOptions.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: A document verifying the business.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Address
member.summary: The individual's primary address.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the the individual's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the the individual's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Dob
member.summary: The individual's date of birth.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Email
member.summary: The individual's email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.FirstName
member.summary: The individual's first name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.FirstNameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the the individual's first name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.FirstNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the individual's first name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.FullNameAliases
member.summary: A list of alternate names or aliases that the individual is known by.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Gender
member.summary: The individual's gender (International regulations require either "male" or "female").

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.IdNumber
member.summary: The government-issued ID number of the individual, as appropriate for the representativeâ€™s country. (Examples are a Social Security Number in the U.S., or a Social Insurance Number in Canada). Instead of the number itself, you can also provide a PII token created with Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.IdNumberSecondary
member.summary: The government-issued secondary ID number of the individual, as appropriate for the representative's country, will be used for enhanced verification checks. In Thailand, this would be the laser code found on the back of an ID card. Instead of the number itself, you can also provide a PII token created with Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.LastName
member.summary: The individual's last name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.LastNameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the individual's last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.LastNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the individual's last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.MaidenName
member.summary: The individual's maiden name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Phone
member.summary: The individual's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.PoliticalExposure
member.summary: Indicates if the person or any of their representatives, family members, or other closely related persons, declares that they hold or have held an important public job or function, in any jurisdiction. One of: existing, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.RegisteredAddress
member.summary: The individual's registered address.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.SsnLast4
member.summary: The last four digits of the individual's Social Security Number (U.S. only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualOptions.Verification
member.summary: The individual's verification document information.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualVerificationOptions.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountIndividualVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.Company
member.summary: Information about the company or business.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person represented by the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.TosShownAndAccepted
member.summary: Whether the user described by the data in the token has been shown the Stripe Connected Account Agreement. When creating an account token to create a new Connect account, this value must be true.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.AccountHolderName
member.summary: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.This field is required when attaching the bank account to a Customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.AccountHolderType
member.summary: The type of entity that holds the account. It can be company or individual. This field is required when attaching the bank account to a Customer object. One of: company, or individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.AccountNumber
member.summary: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a checking account.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.AccountType
member.summary: The bank account type. This can only be checking or savings in most countries. In Japan, this can only be futsu or toza. One of: checking, futsu, savings, or toza.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.Country
member.summary: The country in which the bank account is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.Currency
member.summary: The currency the bank account is in. This must be a country/currency pairing that Stripe supports..

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenBankAccountOptions.RoutingNumber
member.summary: The routing number, sort code, or other country-appropriateinstitution number for the bank account. For US bank accounts, this is required and should bethe ACH routing number, not the wire routing number. If you are providing an IBAN foraccount_number, this field is not required.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Account
member.summary: Information for the account this token will represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The customer (owned by the application's account) for which to create a token. This can be used only with an OAuth access token or Stripe-Account header. For more details, see Cloning Saved Payment Methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.CvcUpdate
member.summary: The updated CVC value this token will represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Person
member.summary: Information for the person this token will represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Pii
member.summary: The PII this token will represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCvcUpdateOptions.Cvc
member.summary: The CVC value, in string form.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonDocumentsCompanyAuthorizationOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonDocumentsOptions.CompanyAuthorization
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof that this person is authorized to represent the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonDocumentsOptions.Passport
member.summary: One or more documents showing the person's passport page with photo and personal data.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonDocumentsOptions.Visa
member.summary: One or more documents showing the person's visa required for living in the country where they are residing.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonDocumentsPassportOptions.Files

member.name: P:Stripe.TransferReversalCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) representing how much of this transfer to reverse. Can only reverse up to the unreversed amount remaining of the transfer. Partial transfer reversals are only allowed for transfers to Stripe Accounts. Defaults to the entire transfer amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.TransferReversalCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a reversal object. It is displayed alongside the reversal in the Dashboard. This will be unset if you POST an empty value.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.TransferReversalCreateOptions.RefundApplicationFee
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the application fee should be refunded when reversing this transfer. If a full transfer reversal is given, the full application fee will be refunded. Otherwise, the application fee will be refunded with an amount proportional to the amount of the transfer reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.UsageRecordCreateOptions.Action
member.summary: Valid values are increment (default) or set. When using increment the specified quantity will be added to the usage at the specified timestamp. The set action will overwrite the usage quantity at that timestamp. If the subscription has billing thresholds, increment is the only allowed value. One of: increment, or set.

member.name: P:Stripe.UsageRecordCreateOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The usage quantity for the specified timestamp.

member.name: P:Stripe.UsageRecordCreateOptions.Timestamp
member.summary: The timestamp for the usage event. This timestamp must be within the current billing period of the subscription of the provided subscription_item, and must not be in the future. When passing "now", Stripe records usage for the current time. Default is "now" if a value is not provided.

member.name: F:Stripe.UsageRecordTimestamp.Now
member.summary: Special value used to record usage for the current time.

member.name: T:Stripe.BaseOptions
member.summary: Base class for Stripe options classes, i.e. classes representing parameters for Stripe API requests.

member.summary: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

member.name: P:Stripe.BaseOptions.ExtraParams
member.summary: Dictionary containing extra request parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.BaseOptions.AddExpand(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an expand value to the request, to request expansion of a specific field in the response. When requesting expansions in a list request, don't forget to prefix the field names with data..
member.param: The name of the field to expand.

member.name: M:Stripe.BaseOptions.AddRangeExpand(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Adds a collection of expand values to the request, to request expansion of specific fields in the response. When requesting expansions in a list request, don't forget to prefix the field names with data..
member.param: The collection of names of the fields to expand.

member.name: M:Stripe.BaseOptions.AddExtraParam(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an extra parameter to the request. This can be useful if you need to use parameters not available in regular options classes, e.g. for beta features.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.Limit
member.summary: A limit on the number of objects to be returned, between 1 and 100.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.StartingAfter
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.EndingBefore
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptionsWithCreated.Created
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object created field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.SearchOptions.Limit
member.summary: A limit on the number of objects to be returned, between 1 and 100.

member.name: T:Stripe.StringEnum
member.summary: Abstract base class for string enum parameters.
member.remarks: This class is used to define request parameters that can only take certain string values. We use it instead of defining a regular enum with annotations for serialization because enum is really an integer under the hood. This can be problematic in some cases, like when a parameter can be an integer OR a string enum (e.g. ).

member.name: P:Stripe.RequestOptions.StripeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the API version for the request.
member.remarks: This is an internal property. For most requests, the API version is always set to the library's pinned version (). This property is only used for creating ephemeral keys, which require a specific API version.
